reviewText: I was given these headphones as a gift and while I thought they were kinda neat I wasn't really sure how much I would use them. I typically use my headphones for physical activities like running and cycling; and I already have a pair that stay in my ears while doing that (previously my only criteria). But since the giver was very excited about them I thought I'd give them a try. I've had them a week and I've found it hard to put them down since. It's amazing how liberating it is not to have a wire. I keep having to remind myself that I can just walk away from my phone, or I don't have to unplug my headphones when I get off the bike.Pros so far:-Battery power. My initial charge seemed to last forever! Then it only took about an hour to recharge.-Distance. I find it has pretty decent distance. In my office I can go just about anywhere with zero interference (about 1800 sq ft but it is mostly "open" space with few walls). At my house I left my phone in my car parked in my driveway, went inside my house about 20 feet and it still worked fine. This will really depend on what's in between you and your phone but for the most part you're pretty free.-Everything it can do! Part of this is because I have an iphone 5S but I'm very impressed with all that I can do without touching my phone, including having it read my texts or emails. Requires no setup or special app, just push the phone button and say "read my texts", after reading it Siri will ask you if you want to reply and she'll accept dictation. Speech seems to be very clear through the headset. Previously I didn't have much use for Siri, now I'm using it all the time. If you're like me and don't utilize it much, I'd suggest Googling everything Siri can do.-Noise canceling. These headphones work well to cancel out background noise. Almost a little too well, so I only wear one ear bud while at work.-Comfort. I thought it'd be awkward to have these around my neck all day but I forget that it is there.My one complaint, is that for me these won't stay in my ears during a high impact workout, like running. They seem fine for everything else including the gym, elliptical and cycling. Maybe I just have funny ears :) But I'll probably stick to my headphones that wrap around my ears for my runs. I can handle that. I'm glad someone else realized how much I would love these.
title: LG Tone Wireless Bluetooth Stereo Headset - Retail Packaging - Black/Orange

reviewText: This headset has good sound, and the volume goes much louder than my Jabra bluetooth for my phone (and I searched high and low for the loudest one available).  The fit of the ear pieces is just a good a most earbuds.  The bluetooth connection seems to be made rather easily and the battery-life is an absolute ton of time.  I like that the little orange ends of the headset are magnetic and can hold the earbuds easily for storage.The one flaw is that there is no native way to keep the headset from falling off while on your back (bench press, sit ups, etc.).  I bought a $.60 eye glasses lanyard and used a could of knots to make a sliding loop and an adjustable length.  It is not the most attractive apparatus, but effective and it never falls off now, and is not heavy enough for me to notice any pull on the front of my neck.

reviewText: This headset is great.  Very good sound, very durable and very affordable.  The controls are pretty simple to use and I can easily listen to my desktop PC or Transformer Prime or android phone.  They are worth what you spend on them as they work really well......Unless you're at the gym and then they will fall off of your neck any time you are leaning or lying back.  Incline or flat bench (or similar) they are falling off.  Hop around too much and they will come off.  Lean back in your chair with your hands behind your head and they will come off.If there was some kind of connecting lanyard or something like that across the two ends then I think that would solve the problem.  Better yet, a band that goes around your neck connecting with velcro.  It wouldn't have to be tight and yet could keep the electronics secure.  Add a bit more noise cancellation and you would really have something special!But, if you aren't jogging or bike riding or in the gym then these bluetooth earbuds are worth every penny.  I will be getting another pair of these soon as a matter of fact.

reviewText: I hate Bluetooth headsets.I've tried Plantronics, Jawbone, Motorola, and others.  In ear, on ear, hanging over your ear, you name it.  The problem with ears is that everyone's ears are different, and despite being similar, the generic earpieces all suck for my ears.  Beyond that, the biggest drawback for Bluetooth headsets that I found was battery life.  If I'm working for eight hours and my earpiece dies after three, I'm out of luck.  For the longest time I relegated myself to using corded earbuds with my phone, because it was the only thing that was comfortable that I could wear for a long period of time.  For ages, I wished that I could find something as comfortable as my earbuds without the hassle and frustration of a cord and a plug tying me to my phone.Enter LG, and their remarkable invention, the LG Tone.  I ordered this item in August of 2012, and I've been using it each and every day since it arrived.  The earbuds are soft and comfortable, and it arrived with a variety of sizes for varying ear canals.  I use my headset at work to listen to streaming audio, and although the advertised battery life is ten hours of use, I frequently get much more.  The controls are easy to use, and despite its size, once the collar is resting around your neck it's barely noticeable, and light as a feather.  I even wear it when running and working out at the gym without any problems.  Bluetooth range is exceptional, allowing me to walk thirty feet or more from my phone before I experience any interruption in signal.Without question, I will never buy another traditional Bluetooth headset again.  Thank you, LG.  I've recently ordered a LG Tone+ for use with my laptop computer while at home, freeing me from yet another cord.pros:  Amazingly comfortable; easy to use; comfortable earbuds; spectacular battery life. durable. great sound and microphone response.cons:  the gauge of wire for the earbuds could be a heavier gauge, though I have experienced no problems after more than 1,700 hours of use.
title: LG Tone Wireless Bluetooth Stereo Headset - Retail Packaging - Black/Orange
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: I use this mainly to listen to Audiobooks on my Nexus 7 and 10. Is it pairs very easily with either. The audio quality is clear and smooth. The controls are intuitive and easy to use and you can easily adjust the volume controls, play/pause, and fast forward and reverse. It lies comfortably around your neck and the short, but adjustable, earbud cords reach  perfectly to your ears.The soft silicone earbuds fit very comfortably and are supplied in 2 sizes: small and medium. The earpieces are magnetically held to the ends of the lightweight neckpiece for storage, which essentially prevents the rats nest tangle of wired headphones. I've used a dozen other earphones and I'm always struggling with the wiring. Listening to 1000's of hours of audio books and podcasts this is a constant problem. It's great not to have to deal with it chords any more and I can move around the room freely without having to carry the tablet all the time.The rubbing noise that you always get from cords on earphones does not exist with these. It makes a great difference in the audio experience and is one reason why the perceived audio quality is superior.There's a blue LED that blinks every 5 seconds to indicate the bluetooth is functioning. It's a bit bright at night so I simply put the neckpiece on upside down.The battery life is stated as 10 hours. All in all, I'm extremely pleased with this item.
title: LG Tone Wireless Bluetooth Stereo Headset - Retail Packaging - Black/Orange
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: So I move around a lot.  Like spinning around in my chair at work, walking around outside, doing chores around the apartment.  So you can imagine that wired headphones can get annoying really quickly.  While there are lots of bluetooth headphones out there, I wear glasses, which means that ear-bud headphones are most comfortable for me.  The ear-bud types are really rare, and the ones I have found (aside from these) tend to be of very poor quality according to reviews, or they are more expensive than I would like.These LG headphones are relatively cheap, and they are high quality.  I have been using them for about a week now, and I think I can easily say that they are the best headphones I have ever owned.  Previously, thePhilips SHE6001/28 In-Ear Headphones Surround Sound (White)were my "gold standard", since they could take my abuse and deliver great sound.  This LG headset has, at the least, comparable sound quality and is well constructed.  I am convinced that it will be able to survive everything I can throw at it!  Not that I would intentionally abuse a fine piece of electronics like this, I'm just very... "accident prone".I have only used it with my Droid Razr, but the sound quality for music playback and calling is great.  It was easy to pair with the phone, and it beeps to let me know when it has connected to the phone after I turn the headset on.Pros:-Durable-Great audio quality-Incredibly small learning curve-Easy pairing (at least on an Android phone)-Built in cord/ear-bud management-Roughly 20-24hrs of battery life based on playing music, making phone calls, and turning the head set off when I am not using it-Awesome range (like 30-50ft)-Great value for what you getCons:-Not free-You may forget you are still wearing it at times-When the battery starts to die, it doesn't beep or anything to let you know, your music/calls will just start to stutter and go in/out and the phone button will blink until you figure out that its the battery and not interference-It would be nice if the ear-bud cords retracted into the bigger parts, instead of having to use the loop dealies to keep them controlled

reviewText: When I first saw this headset, my first thought is how weird to wear this on my neck and have loose wires go up to my ears! But I had to try since this headset is so versatile that it can replace all of my ear buds / headsets for portable devices and my laptop! It works well for stereo music and phone conversation for my Android phone. It works good for my iPad as well for music. I'm also really enjoying using it with my PlayStation Vita. In all cases the stereo sounds quite good, even better than many wired headset at this price range. Doing phone calls in stereo is also quite refreshing. If I want to hear outside, I'll just use one ear bud.At first I was concerned about using this for jogging and mountain biking, as I would be conscious about having something around my neck. But that turned out to be non issue. It's also very light.Despite having 6 buttons and a on/off switch, remembering them took less than few seconds! This is because the grouping of buttons on each side are very logical. Changing volume and forward/rewind songs make sense.One thing we often taking for granted is the ease of switching connection with varies devices. This one is capable of pairing with multiple devices. I was able easily switch between my Android and Vita.I highly recommend this product, event though it already has the overwhelming positive reviews. It's funny looking, but it's fun to wear knowing I can use just one headset for multiple electronic portable devices.*UPDATE* After having it for almost 1 year, I can say it's the best I ever had for 30 years! I use it every day for both phone and playing music. Heck, I stop using my car stereo (BMW) in favor of listening to music from this headset while driving!

reviewText: This headset frequently drops the bluetooth connection to my phone even when it is only a few feet away.  I have used other headsets which never dropped the connection until they stopped working altogether.  The earpieces also do not stay in my ears and often fall out; this happens with both of the sizes of earpieces provided.This headset can be used as the above issues are annoying but do not render the device completely useless.  However, they are enough of an issue that I am returning my headset.
title: LG Tone Wireless Bluetooth Stereo Headset - Retail Packaging - Black/Orange
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: Turns out, traditional "on the head" headphones give me headaches (including one that was over $150--drat). I looked for something else. I go nuts with earbuds' tangling cords.I'm certainly not a music connoisseur, but the sound on this headset is fine with me. The whole setup is feather-weight; I forget it's around my neck. The whole thing is like a delicate flower; treat it gingerly. No cords. Two devices means I can use my iPod for listening to music so as not to drain my iPhone 4S's battery.Everything about this headset is elegant and well-designed. What a great design this is.UPDATE 2 Dec 2012I still love this gizmo (*****). It's the first "headphone" that doesn't clamp my skull. No more headaches. Works beautifully. Highly recommend.UPDATE 4 Dec 2012I forgot. The instructions are really tiny (3-inches x 3.5-inches). Itty-bitty, teeny-weeny. Ugh! Not good! The typography is very nearly illegible. LG: Why are you trying to make your purchasers blind?QUESTION 28 March 2013I still like this headset--a lot. However, I have a new application for it, not for iOS but for Macintosh. I don't know where else to ask this question, so I'll ask it here: is this headset compatible with Dragon Dictate 3 for Mac? It seems that Dragon Dictate would a natural application for this headset, but do they talk to each other? If not now, maybe someday.
title: LG Tone Wireless Bluetooth Stereo Headset - Retail Packaging - Black/Orange
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: Once you start using the controls it will become 2nd nature to adjust the volume or skip tracks. Battery life is ridiculous. I flew from San Diego to Philadelphia with 1 hour layovers in between, each way. I was able to listen to music the entire time without a single recharge. Very pleased about not having to always looking for the nearest charging source every few hours.I cannot give 5 stars as the sound quality in my opinion, is lacking.It is a good buy for the money, but if you are an audiophile like me, you may want to look elsewhere.
title: LG Tone Wireless Bluetooth Stereo Headset - Retail Packaging - Black/Orange

reviewText: Just got the LG Tone(black/orange) today and synced to my iPhone 4S no problem. Music and calls worked without problems. There were just a few features that I would have liked to have on this headset though. I found out from the LG live chat rep there's no way to see how much battery is left...see the conversation below:Guest: Hi I just received my LG Tone HBS-700Guest: and have a few questionsGuest: Am I able to check the battery status some how?Guest: and how long does it take to fully charge?Guest: and can it be used while chargingJermel: 1. no to the first question.Jermel: It should take as long as it will show the fully charged light.Guest: so once the light is blue?Jermel: And it is not recommend to be used while charging.Guest: okGuest: Is there a warning sign when the battery is low?Jermel: You will start to notice that the quality of the calls are not the same.Guest: thats it?Guest: no flashing lights?Guest: or anything of that kindJermel: Unfortunately not.I am sure I need to live down the hype of not having to deal with cords now and having stereo sound first before I can make an honest review. But so far, calls worked great (people on the other end said I sounded clear), battery is rated for at least a whole day worth of use and the music sounds great (I am not super picky about the sound BUT am picky when it comes to static sounds and the like, which I did not hear)Only time will tell how well this will hold up. I will update this review with any bad (or good) observations in the future that are worth mentioning. For now, 4 stars for the initial impression.---- UPDATE ---- ONE YEAR LATER ----So I have had these headphones for a year now and still work like day one. I am leaving at 4 stars because while it serves its purpose well, I wish it had some type of battery meter. It pairs well with my iPhone 5 (upgraded since the last time) and the buttons on the BT headset still function properly. Battery life seems to be good. I wear the headset in the office, while working out and cleaning. None of the components have started to wear off and no clips or ear buds have broken off. I use for music and taking calls over bluetooth and it is good. By good I mean it serves its purpose. If you're looking for rich bass and treble with amazing voice call quality - you may want to look elsewhere (like in the $100 range). Mines lasted a year so its been worth the investment (cost me $50 at the time).
title: LG Tone Wireless Bluetooth Stereo Headset - Retail Packaging - Black/Orange
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: While researching well-rated bluetooth stereo headsets, I narrowed it down to two choices: this LG 700W or the Air Fi Runaway that was also rated well by customers. I decided on this LG item first since it seems more inconspicuous and won't leave a dent in the hair, LOL! The Runaway headset does seem sturdier though..Upon first seeing this LG item, I was surprised how skinny and flexible the loop part of this headset was (the section that goes around the back of the neck)! Indeed very lightweight and I hope this doesn't make it too fragile. Want this headset to last awhile ..To start, swing the usb slot cover out to charge the unit via a micro usb to wall outlet plug. It paired easily with a Samsung Galaxy 7" Tab 2 and also to an older model flip cellphone. The headset vibrates and flashes when there's an incoming call. Pressing the button on one end turns off the music and connects the headset to the incoming call. Talk quality is excellent from both sides of the phone conversation.The magnetic earbuds are seated into the grooved ends of the headset and the wire slide adjustments take up the slack to keep the cords from getting all tangled up. I would recommend storing the headset in a protective pouch or ziploc bag to prevent the wires and all the various buttons from getting scraped up and damaged.This is an impressive product .. recommended!
title: LG Tone Wireless Bluetooth Stereo Headset - Retail Packaging - Black/Orange
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: I'm the type of guy who hates to be tied down with cords. Anytime i can get something "wireless" i will make sure i take that oppotunity . The battery on this bluetooth last a long time ...i mean a LOOONNGGG time. i work 8- 10 hours a day and i'm a delivery driver so having anything wireless is a must because i need my hands on the wheel at all times. The sound on this is amazing ! you can hear the lyrics without having overpowerful bass. The bass is awesome too ! everything balances out perfect ! It might seem a little pricey to some, but trust me, if something was to happen to my bluetooth headphones, i'll be buying another one, the SAME exact one LOL. You know you want it, so buy it . I take this everywhere with me, school, work, and just a day out in the town. Go wireless :)

reviewText: FIRST REVIEW:As a personal trainer, owner and operator of [...] - adult, child & group fitness training throughout Beverly Hills, Santa Monica, Dallas, Miami, South Beach, and New York) I can tell you that this is without a doubt the MUST HAVE Bluetooth headset for the active person. Although the collar does seem a bit Star Trek it really is no inconvenience given the added controls, extended battery life and ergonomic fit. After trying dozens of horrible Bluetooth devices throughout the years I can ASSURE YOU that you need look no further. I've only had it 2 days now but I'm THOROUGHLY IMPRESSED!!! I'll update a month or 2 from now and see if my feelings are the same about it.p.s. the only potential issue I've noticed (and this could be a coincidence) but there is suddenly a massive echo error on my iPad 3 since syncing to this device... I don't know... might be nothing, time will tell.----UPDATE:I've had these headsets now over 6 months and in fact have bought 2 pair (had to replace the 1st set due to a puppy chewing incident). Unfortunately I've had to lower my rating to 3 stars from 5 becasue of one major issue that exist in both of my headsets.1. EVERYTIME I'm on these headsets EVERY PERSON I speak to says the background noise is too loud. So other than chatting on the phone in my car or living room in absolute silence I really can't use these for phone conversations. Apparently the gym sounds like a circus on these sets and jogging sounds like I'm running through desert storm in the middle of a gun fight. Its really a shame because other than that (and the inconvenience of them falling off my neck when lying down - e.g. bench press, sit ups, etc.) these sets would be perfect. Unfortunately I have gone back to wired sets for phone conversations. *sigh!

reviewText: I've been looking for a bluetooth headset for a couple years now.I finally took the leap with the LG Tone.The yea! These are great. The design is much more comfortable that I expected. As many reviews state, you really do forget you are wearing them.Not having to worry about the cord snagging and wrapping around every little thing takes a little getting used to.The sound is much better than an old wrap around BT that did pretty much the same things as the LG, just poorly.I didn't think that there was such a device that would provide great battery life, good range, great sound, and practical design in one package.The LG Tone has done so admirably.The meh: Running, and outdoors generally, are slightly better. Earphones do allow me to hear outside noise. The buds tend to slip around with jarring and moisture. Other than super glue, there really isn't a good solution though. Wind can be a problem, but what system doesn't have that problem.The cord can get hung up on the collar, or a shoulder strap catch it, but this has only happened two or three times. This is easy to avoid.Summary: The phone is great. The mike picks up just what it needs to. The controls are perfectly placed and I really love the magnetic earbud holders.All in all my expectations were guarded at first, but I've been completely satisfied with all aspects of this device.
title: LG Tone Wireless Bluetooth Stereo Headset - Retail Packaging - Black/Orange
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: (though as a qualifier there are few out there that I have been satisfied with)Pros-Lightweight, Switch for power(opposed to holding a button) good sound quality, comfortable earbuds, good battery life, vibration functionCons-Magnets do not hold earbuds in place for storage, flashing LED light on front, pieces that hold the cable back are poorly designed, lacking in volume(common in most bluetooth headsets)Sound quality is the most important factor and the LG 700s are above par in the field of bluetooth headset, a good balance of highs and lows and good fit that are all hard to find in a set of wired earbuds in this price range much less in a bluetooth headset. Next is comfort and they again succeed where others have failed, the main unit is very lightweight and when I'm in my work attire with a collared shirt I wear it underneath the collar and on top of my undershirt and would not even notice that it is there. In a T-Shirt it's a bit different but still not uncomfortable. The only problem I have had is while out running the ends of the unit will bounce up and down on the top of my chest which gets very annoying, I usually end up shoving the whole thing behind my back and just using the earbuds to hold in up. The vibrating notification for calls is a novel concept that I love though it kind of freaked me out at first since I was not aware that it did that.My big complaints are with the design of the cable and the earbud holders, the magnet are far too weak and they often get knocked out. Sometimes I just let them hang down the inside of my shirt instead of bothering with them. Then the way the cable is designed to attach to the back band seems poorly designed where the clips get pushed too far forward or back holding the cable up.In the end I would recommend it as the best out there right now, there is the 730 model but there seem to be some large kinks to work out.
title: LG Tone Wireless Bluetooth Stereo Headset - Retail Packaging - Black/Orange
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: I bought this on a whim based on the massive number of stellar reviews.  Despite that, it's better than I expected. The sound is outstanding, much better than my Motorola S9.  It is remarkably comfortable.  The headset itself weighs next to nothing and on top of that, it's resting on your shoulders.  The controls are well sized and easy to operate.  In particular, with a sliding on/off switch you can tell at a glance which it is and also turn it off without looking and also reliably turn it on or off while you're wearing it.The design is... perfect.  I like that while I'm wearing the headset and someone comes up to me all I need do is flip one of the ear-buds out and I can hear what they're saying.  If it's someone I *really* care about I flip both out.  If it's someone I don't want to talk to I flip... never mind.  When I want to resume resuming the ear buds are easy to retrieve.  If I want to get fancy I can drop them in the magnetic holders at either end of the around-my-neck thingy.The headset works flawlessly with my iPhone4.  The "call" button answers calls if someone is calling, hangs up when I'm done, and get's Siri's attention at other times.  Thanks to a decent microphone Siri understands what I say as do people I call.  Also, unlike the S9, it doesn't matter where I carry my phone.  The signal is clear at all times.About the only time I used my S9 was while I walked my dog.  I'm using these lots more.  While they don't sound as good as some of my wired headsets (costing many times more) they do sound pretty darn good and there is the convenience of not having to deal with a cord.In some ways this headset travels better than wired headsets because there's nothing to get tangled.  Just drop the earbuds in their individual magnetic holders and put the whole thing in a flat compartment of your backpack, briefcase, purse, satchel, valise, etc, and you're good to go.  For me it fits nicely in pocket #3 of myMoblie Edge, Mini Messenger Bag fits up to 13.3- Inch laptops and 11- Inch widescreen netbooks, Black/Dr Pepper.So how, you ask, can you make it better still?  This headset came with two different sized pairs of ear gels, one pair slightly larger than medium and the other pair slightly smaller than medium.  My problem is, these press-to-fit ear gels never work for me.  Some work better than others and these worked about as good as any but it wasn't perfect; they would slip out on occasion.  Then I stumbled across these:2 Pair, Mens Size - Earphones Plus Brand, Tri-Level, Replacement Ear Cushions, Earbuds for Sound Isolating Earphones. (See Fit Information in Details Below).  They fit both this headset and my ears perfectly.  The soft silicon (?) seals out noise, keeps the ear buds from slipping out without having to drive them in with a hammer, and they make the headset sound even better.  *Now* it's totally perfect!Please feel free to let Amazon and me know if this review was helpful to you since it helps me improve the information I provide.

reviewText: I've owned a few variations of Bluetooth headsets that I've used while exercising, including the Motorola S-9 and S-10 and the Jaybird Freedoms. The new LG Tone 700 may look a bit strange, but it quickly became my favorite Bluetooth headset for exercise and general use.The 700 fits around your neck, and is light enough that you really don't know you're wearing them. The only caveat I'd add regarding comfort is that if you're wearing a collarless shirt, like a tee shirt when running, you will feel the headset's thin band on the back of your neck. This doesn't bother me since the Jaybirds have a wire connecting the two earbuds that also rides the back of our neck, and the Motorola headsets have a heavy, think band that goes back and over your ears. When evaluating comfort, also keep in mind that a regular wired headset or earbuds have a wire that's flapping around. On balance, the LG headset is really the most comfortable and least noticeable of those I've tried.Surprisingly, the LG's stay in place, even when running. Unlike the Jaybirds, which have some weight to them that helps to dislodge them from your ear, the LG earbuds are featherweight and stay put. After the first few minutes of wearing them, I didn't even notice that I had them on, they're really that comfortable. With a collared shirt, like a polo, I didn't feel the headband at all. It's like they're not there!The LG's have the best battery life by far of any of the Bluetooth headsets I've owned. I tried an experiment with the LG's where I used them on two 1-hour runs, then took them to the golf course where I volunteer once a week and listened to them for 6 hours straight. The battery didn't quit and still had enough juice to keep running. The Jaybirds and the Motorolas would both have died after about 3 to 4 hours of use.The built-in phone works great, and no one I talked to with the LG's complained about the sound, even though I was outdoors. I often got complaints with the Jaybirds that people had trouble hearing me.I will concede that the Jaybirds have better sound and noticeably better fidelity than the LG's. The LG can be adjusted to boost the bass response, but they don't match the Jaybirds for sound. On the other hand, the Jaybirds can't compete with the battery life of the LG, so you'll have to decide what's most important to you. I mostly listen to audiobooks while I exercise so a small loss of fidelity, while disappointing, isn't a deal breaker for me.There is a newer version of this headset, the 730, but after reading the reviews, I thought I'd stick with the 700. There are reports that the 730 is less stable holding onto a Bluetooth signal, although I can't verify those reports. I can say that the 700 is rock solid and doesn't drop the audio stream even when the phone is in my pocket of backpack.The bottom line is that I think the LG's are a great value for the price. The Motorola S-9's LED burned out on me after a year, and the S10 wasn't nearly as comfortable as its sibling. The Jaybird Freedom slips out of my ear, even with all of their adapters, so I'm constantly fiddling with them as I run. In addition, the Jaybird Freedoms have limited controls for your iPhone or iPod. Stop, start and volume are about all you can do, as well as answer a call. With the LG you can fast forward or reverse as well as jump tracks. Another plus in this area for the LG is that it can tell you it's remaining battery life via its LED, which the Jaybirds can't.Compared to these products, the LG Bluetooth Stereo Headset is my new benchmark for audio. They do look a bit weird, but they really are well designed to deliver maximum battery life, a strong Bluetooth connection, and all the controls you need to manipulate your iPhone or Android device.

reviewText: This thing has been great. Music sound quality is good as is call quality. The design is good so I don't have to have a device in my ear at all times. I get a call and grab one of the ear buds and push the button to answer. However, the leads that the ear buds are attached to are not very durable at all. After only a few months, the insulation from the leads is coming off from around where they go into the device. This is not good and I only give my device a few more weeks to live unless I can either get LG to warranty it or figure out some way to repair it myself.EDIT: The left side ear bud has stopped working. These are now garbage. This would be a great product of the wires to the ear buds were more durable. Disappointed and would not recommend you buy these.

reviewText: I'm very satisfied with that product. It was very easy to pair up with iPhone 3gs and iPhone 4. It is also easy to use it. You can listen to the music, and when you receive a phone call you have a calling tone and vibration alert. Simple answering with one button. Good quality of the sound. Also very good range as it comes to the distance from the phone to the headset. You can leave your phone in one room and talk / listen to the musing being in another room. Flexible neck part and in general good quality of the product.UPDATE:One day when I was putting my headset on one of the ear plugs fell off. I contacted the customer service, sent the product to them and they sent it back untouched saying it is mechanical damage. I know it wasn't, and I know that the company didn't put any effort to resolve the issue. Even if they thought it was my fault and didn't want to replace the product it shouldn't be a huge deal to put some glue on it. I read some other reviews of this product and it seems like I'm not the first one whose ear piece fell off.. Week connection in the plastic parts parts is not a huge deal, but I'm very disappointed with how the customer service avoids responsibility for a faulty item.

reviewText: How I use it:I wear this while biking to work. I keep my smartphone (which the headset is connected to via Bluetooth) in a pouch beneath my bike seat. I only use the left earbud (illegal to wear 2 earbuds while riding a bike in California, and its safer to only wear one).Bluetooth connectivity:Works very well. It automatically connects to my smartphone when I turn the headset on. The connection rarely cuts out and, if it does, cuts out for less than a second.Audio:The sound quality seems pretty good.Locking the earbuds into the earbud holder:The earbuds have magnets in them (don't worry, they shouldn't fry your brain...) so they 'lock in' to the earbud holders pretty easily, and then they stay there (even when I'm bouncing around on my bike). The magnets are nice because they enable me to lock the earbuds into the earbud holders without looking, and also when I have semi-bulky gloves on. Occasionally, the earbuds do fall out of the earbud holders; this usually happens when I am riding 'hard' and am bumping up and down a lot while riding.Comfort:I often forget that I'm wearing this headset. That is how comfortable and light and unobtrusive this headset is! The earbuds, themselves, are very comfortable, as well. The neckband is especially useful for me because I only wear one earbud. If there was no neckband that holds earbuds not in use, the earbud that I do not use would hang and pull the other earbud down.Button Controls:The volume and song skip buttons are very accessible. I can even press them when I have semi-bulky gloves on, though I can often press the wrong button (volume up instead of volume down).Battery Life:The headset lasts something like 500 - 800 minutes on a full charge. This is really good.

reviewText: I received the LG Tone as a gift.  First my evaluation; then the comparison.Setup: EasyI charged the LG and turned it on.  I turned on bluetooth on my Samsung Note, and then hit the button to search for bluetooth devices.  The Note immediately found the LG and I told it to pair - which took less than 5 seconds.Comfort: Good.The LG sits around my neck almost unnoticed. It comes with only 2 silicone ear bud sizes, but the larger one fit my ears.  The ear buds are then just as comfortable as any other ear bud.Snagging wires: No wires!Other ear buds must be connected by their wires to the phone/device and are prone to snagging.Range: About 30 feet.Casual Listening: Great!No hum, no hiss, no obvious distortion, and overall volume is good.  I usually have my Samsung Note music player set to 9/15 loudness with the LG volume set 3 down from the max loudness. The  LG Tone is a pleasure to use.COMPARISONContestants:1. LG Tone HBS-700 Wireless Bluetooth Stereo Headset (set to bass boost)2. Samsung Note Ear Buds3. JBuds Hi-Fi Noise-Reducing Ear Buds4. GOgroove DynaMIX High-Performance Ear Buds5. Sennheiser HD203 Closed-Back DJ Headphones (full size)6. JVC HA-RX500 Over-the-Ear Headphones (full size)Last Place: Gogroove.  Maybe this is unfair.  GOgroove didn't sound bad and seemingly (see below) had good base, but it was way too bright for my taste.  [If your ears have lost sensitivity to high frequencies maybe this would be your first choice.]Second Place: LG Tone, Samsung, and Jbuds.Really, it was hard to tell the difference between any of these 3 second place ear buds.  They were all a bit bright and all seemingly (see below) had good thumping base.  All 3 have what I would call a good quality of sound (low distortion).  I am happy that the LG sounded as good (to my ears) as any of the other ear buds.First Place: Sennheiser and JVC full size headphones.I hope nobody is surprised here!  There is just no way an ear bud can beat a good quality over-ear full-size headphone.  The ear buds only began to seem a bit bright when compared to the full size headphones.  Clarity was also better in the full size headphones (but not much better).  BASS RESPONSE?  This was the big difference.  After all, the JVC has a 40mm driver (almost 2 inches in size)!  Although the ear buds seemed to have good bass response, as soon as I put on the full size headphones the sad truth became obvious.  ALL of the ear buds were weak on bass and none of them had any very deep bass what-so-ever.  But then you knew that already, didn't you?Conclusion:  I think that all the second place ear buds (including the LG Tone) are at least adequate for casual listening, and because of their smaller size they are more convenient to carry around.  The  LG Tone was my favorite since it didn't have wires to snag.
title: LG Tone Wireless Bluetooth Stereo Headset - Retail Packaging - Black/Orange
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: So this was my third pair of Bluetooth headsets and it's the third one that fails my usability tests. Bear in mind all 3 were different brands and all 3 had significant faults to them that forced me to return them.For starters I was kind of put off by it being called "wireless" when infact you have wires leading to the actual ear pieces but that's just semantics I guess. They seemed durable, flexible and looked like they could be around for the long haul. I had no problem syncing them with my Android phone and the sound clearly beats out the Plantronics rival and the Motorola. While the bass is weak the overall sound quality is the best one could expect from a Bluetooth device. Same goes for the call quality.Now looking at the device before I purchased it one would assume that since it sits around your neck it would be stiff like a partial necklace in case you had to have them on while you were doing anything that required you to be horizontal. Not the case, it is flimsy and really the only thing keeping this on your neck is the weight (not much of it) of the ends/buttons. This poses a significant problem if your sole reason for purchasing these is to utilize them at the gym. If you need to do a bench workout, situps or anything that requires you to lay flat even for a moment these will fall right off your neck. When running with these they bounce around your neck and don't feel at all secure. I tucked mine into my shirt but I'd imagine if your a woman and run in a sports bra or tank top that's just not going to be possible.Much like the Motorola I wanted to like these but at the end of the day the cons really outweighed the pros and I could not in good conscience let LG keep my money for this product. I'm hoping one day someone get's this mastered for a reasonable price but until then if you're an active guy/gal and looking specifically for a gym headset I'd stick with a good pair of wired ear buds.
title: LG Tone Wireless Bluetooth Stereo Headset - Retail Packaging - Black/Orange
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: A staffer at one of my doctors' offices recommended this headset, and I'm glad he did. It's great! Highly recommended.A totally innovative design, the LG Tone Wireless Bluetooth Stereo Headset doesn't sit over your head or behind your ears and neck. It simply sits on your collarbone, around your neck. It doesn't feel tight or in the way. Other than the well-designed ear buds, you'd never know you're wearing it. I paid the LG with my iPhone in the car and with my Apple MacBook laptop in my office; I use it to make phone calls over my iPhone's AT&T; cellular service or over Skype on my laptop, iPhone, or iPad. I listen to music on any of these devices. It pairs easily with any of my devices and moves easily from being paired with one device to the next. Upshot, some days I wear the headset all day and move its pairing from device to device. Again, highly recommended.

reviewText: The HBS-700 is a stereo bluetooth headset with a unique design. Bluetooth headphones are a challenge for hardware designers because of the need to house the electronics and a big enough battery to supply decent autonomy, and the need for a wire between the electronics and both earpieces.This is why so far there has only been two major designs on the market: one is large over-the-ear pads connected with a headband or just a wire, the other being earbuds connected by a wire to a little box housing the electronics. Both designs have problems: the former is usually uncomfortable and the earpads tend to have problems staying in place, particularly when exercising; the latter defeats the purpose of wireless headphones by still leaving you to deal with a tangled mess of wires.The HBS-700 offers a novel approach to solving this problem: the electronics and controls are housed in a circle clip that sits around your neck, and the earbuds are connected to it by a short wire that can't get tangled. Even better, the earbuds attach magnetically to the tips of the neckband when not in use.Ergonomically, the HBS-700 gets top marks. The usual controls are very logically organized and easy to identify by touch even while running or exercising. The power switch is a mechanical slider, so there's never any doubt whether your headphone is on or off. Charging is done via a standard microUSB connector.The features are what you expect from bluetooth stereo headphones: bluetooth action button (pick up an incoming call, hang up, initiate a call/siri, redial), volume +/- on the left hand side, play/pause, previous and next on the right hand side. Everything works very reliably and just as you would expect (I have been using these headphones for months with an iPhone 4)Even better, the battery life is phenomenal (at least 10 hours of music playback) and the neckband vibrates when a call comes in: impossible to miss a call even in a noisy environment or while exercising.If you're listening to music and a call comes in, press the call button to pick up the call and the music pauses. When you hang up, the music resumes.In terms of sound quality, the HBS-700 delivers as well. These are not high quality audiophile headphones, but they sound perfectly adequate and will be great to use at the gym, while jogging, etc...Convenience, sound quality, battery life, reasonable price make the HBS-700 an excellent value. If you're only going to buy one set of bluetooth headphones, I can't think of a better model to recommend -- and I've tried them all.

reviewText: I have bought 3 versions of stereo bluetooth headsets.  All worked well initially, with only the Samsung 3700 awkward.  The LG might fit into the awkward catagory for some, maybe most, but so far, I have nothing but nits and PRAISE for this headset.The built in Play Music Android equalizer solved any sound quality issues I had.  The headset works very well.  The auto override of the music to the phone and back has been flawless.  The bluetooth has been the best functioning bluetooth units I have ever had.So far, the only nits I have are the charging cover seems strange, the UP/DOWN (Next/PREVIOUS) song selector is the opposite direction as the volume UP/DOWN, and mostly, the charger light.  Once you learn when the red light goes out, the unit is charged, this one goes away.Overall, so far, a very high quality headset.  Now to get it to Florida and see how it handles sweat...
title: LG Tone Wireless Bluetooth Stereo Headset - Retail Packaging - Black/Orange

reviewText: Primarily, my wife and I use these to listen to music on to iPads.Battery LifeIn the real world, these need to be charged daily.  We've had them about 3 months and generally I can get a fully work day about 9-10 hours plus a one hour workout.  I have a pair of Artic headphone which have phenominal battery life but are silly to wear cause they stick out far.ComfortWe always forget we are wearing them. Last week, my wife jumped into the shower with them on but I saw her jump in and was able to stop her before they received a thorough shampoo treatment.  They go best on the inside of some shirts and under the collar of others.The LookPeople are always asking about where they can get these.  If you are one of these people, you are getting much warmer...IOS/ipad and Blackberry and AndroidThese can be paired with two devices at once but there's a trick to it.  Connect the phone first.  If it connects to my ipad before the Blackberry it won't connect to Blackberry at all until bluetooth is off on IOS.  When it works, it works greatand music pauses while I take my call and resumes afterward.I've tried several different ear buds with these but ended up (unknowingly) back with the original size.  Other buds I had came from and earbud tip kit i bought at an airport electronics place.  Not that it matters, but I saw reviews trashing the headset because the person using them couldn't get a replacement.  Hope that helps you with your purchase!

reviewText: I found that my old blue tooth was just palne uncomfortable. When I asked a friend how he liked his LG Wireless Bluetooth Headset, he responded "it's the best investment I ever made". "It's so easy to use and you don't have something stuck in your ear all day". It synked up to my Palm Pixie phone with out a hitch!! The sound is AWESOME!! One suggestion to those who might want to buy this headset, as with any bluetooth headset. If your phone is in a craddle, make sure you do not walk away from your phone for more than 30 feet. The headset will go into standby mode. You must reconnect to your phone when you get back within the 30 foot range. Also, girls if you have long hair or a necklace on, make sure you remove your necklace and put your hair up. Keeps everything from getting tangled in the headset. Speaking from experience... LOLIt's an AWESOME accessory to my phone and I would recommend this product to anyone looking to purchase.

reviewText: I work in a warehouse pulling orders and driving a forklift all day, and I like to listen to news and audio books while working.  I've had a couple of Jawbone models and many pairs of corded headphones/ear-buds by Apple, Phillips, and Sony.  Problems with all of these include difficulties keeping the cord out of my way while working, volume levels too weak for loud noise environments, problems with the buds staying in my ears, and poor battery life.  This model corrects all of these deficiencies.The ear buds stay in my ears well because they are very light and the rubber tips seal well.  This was my biggest problem with the Jawbone models-even the icon was heavy enough to jostle out of my ears simply by walking.  All of the battery weight in this model is around your neck (and it's not that they're heavy, because they're not - it's just that even a little heft won't stay in my ear)  This setup also allows LG to cram at least 3 times as much battery into the halo around your neck, because the battery life is three times as long as the Jawbone, and as far as I could tell in my research, it has a better battery life than any other Bluetooth headset.Even running, the halo never threatens to fall off my neck, and I often forget it's there.  (Update; this is not the case when the buds are in the magnet pockets.  What happens then is that the buds bounce out of the pockets.  Bottom line, don't run without the buds in your ears.)The volume levels are fantastic, and with my Iphone 4 it gets louder than I can handle (and I am a drummer, I can handle loud). I can barely say this about many of the corded headsets that I have used.The range of this headset with my Iphone is the best I have ever experienced.  Maintaining line of sight, I can easily exceed 100 meters without losing signal.  In my warehouse, with many obstructions, I can exceed 50 meters as long as I don't enter a closed room without my phone.I cannot testify as to its water resistance.Callers tell me that background noise levels are much quieter than with my other headsets, which was an issue I didn't find addressed often in other reviews.There are many buttons on the headset, and initially I kept confusing the phone side with the media side (left is phone, right is media).  However, they are easy to use, have a nice feel when I press them, and I get the impression by the way that they feel when I press them that they will prove to be durable, which is a good thing because in my experience it's often buttons that wear out first on devices of this kind.The wires that connect the halo to the buds are not heavy duty, and are thin enough to have caused me a little anxiety at first, but it has not been a problem, and I cannot give too much praise to the designer who came up with the idea to provide magnetic pockets to hold the buds.  This is ingenious, and not only keeps them from flopping around when they're not in my ears, but also minimizes the opportunities for damaging them.Overall, this headset has a excellent design and is well built.  I love it, and when I wear this one out I will buy another.
title: LG Tone Wireless Bluetooth Stereo Headset - Retail Packaging - Black/Orange
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: I have to admit that even in bass boost mode, which is activated by holding the volume up and down buttons simultaneously for 1 second, the bass response of this headset leaves a lot to be desired.  If you listen to music where bass is an important component, this is probably not the headset for you.  For bass, I give this headset a 2 out of 5.However, for mobility and convenience, this headset easily gets a 5 out of 5.  You quickly will forget that you have them on.  The controls on the device allow forward, back, pause, play, up volume, down volume, call answering, etc.  Also, if you're accustomed to the low volume of many bluetooth devices, the LG HBS-700 will blow you away because the volume is adjustable to uncomfortably loud levels, so you will never have trouble hearing a caller on the other end.Great device overall and I'm pleased with my purchase.

reviewText: Two-week update: I cannot emphasize enough how FANTASTIC it is to be able to fast-forward through overly long podcast commercials in one simple button press with these things. I'm ordering another!This is one of the few (perhaps the only) bluetooth headsets that features a dedicated fast-forward button (quick press for next track, hold longer for fast-forward within a track).The FF offers a quick beep every other second it is pressed (which is good; it lets you know it's registered the button press and is obeying your command).I'm using an iPhone 4S. Connecting the unit via bluetooth has been easy.The sound is fine for podcasts & audiobooks. For music, I found the LG Tone adequate -- but subtly lifeless, and it was necessary to dig into the iPhone's EQ settings to make music listenable (but still a bit lifeless).Since I'm using it during my 25-minute walking commute along noisy brooklyn streets (buses, trucks, sirens), I don't mind the merely adequate music playback (which most BT headsets suffer from).I mainly listen to audiobooks & podcasts anyway. And for anyone who's ever suffered through one of Leo Laporte's five-minute Ford Sync ads knows, that FF button will come in REALLY HANDY. (I don't own a car!) The main reason I bought this unit is so I can FF thru junk without fishing out my iPhone.Battery life seems normal for a stereo BT device, and the neck-wrap style is only annoying for a minute before it blends in with the weight of your winter coat.I'm pleasantly satisfied with my LG Tone. :)
title: LG Tone Wireless Bluetooth Stereo Headset - Retail Packaging - Black/Orange

reviewText: I have had several mono and stereo Bluetooth headsets. I have had several call only and audio streaming devices. This one is the best yet.Good call sound, listening and speaking. Fits comfortably. It's not exactly unobtrusive when wearing a business suit, but it does look less geeky than always having a unit hanging on your ear.The sync is super solid. I haven't had it drop a call or a connection yet. The downside is that I am more likely to forget my phone in the car or in the house because I can get a good distance away from it before the connection breaks.I love using it for podcasts. Long drives are much more tolerable when I can listen with one ear plug or put in both plugs for certain conversations/listening. I have yet to have the battery run out during a heavy day's use.

reviewText: Design:The first thing that struck we was how well it was designed. Every aspect of it was paid excellent attention to. The headphone sits very well across the neck and very seamlessly. I did not sense it while running after the first few minutes.Every operation (at least the ones we care for from a headphone) has a dedicated button. This means, you can concentrate on what you do instead of figuring out a button push sequence or using it in combination.The headsets are not think and heavy going into the ear and when you are done they snap back in place that fundamentally removes cluttered wires.Performance:The pairing was seamless. It only took a few seconds (MotoACTV).I am not a audio expert by any means, so take it from that perspective. The audio stream has been very stable without any "silence". The bass (especially when you run outside) is okay and the it also sound slightly tinny (which can probably be adjusted if we had an EQ app but the ACTV does not support such apps). It does not isolate external audio as well as it advertises. It is definitely not annoying (not even close) but i am not sure that the noise-suppression works as well as it is advertised.The battery was high when I received it and have run for about 2 hours now and haven't had a chance to recharge it yet.I haven't tried multi-connection with my phone yet. I will, someday, but dont have a usecase for it yet.Overall, if you are looking for a simple-to-use headset that you aren't constantly worried if it may fall down, get this one and you will not be disappointed. Do note that its not a performance headset but definitely well-designed and does well what it mainly sets off to do at its price-point.
title: LG Tone Wireless Bluetooth Stereo Headset - Retail Packaging - Black/Orange
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: very good product.Very comfortable.Supplied rubber ear inserts are cheap, I used silicone ear inserts from a Nokia device instead.Battery lasts a respectable amount of time, but not the claimed amount of ten hours of use.Audio quality for listening to music is good (considering it is bluetooth).Microphone is good, no need to hold mic next to mouth or cheek.  I can use it in an open area like Wal-Mart and still get good audio quality from mic.Controls work well with Nokia E7 and T-Mobile G2.Magnetic holder for ear buds works well.Adjusting cord length can be a nuisance, but once adjusted it works well.I have short hair, but people with long hair may think twice about ear bud cords.>>> UPDATE: this unit works well with the T-Mobile G2.  However, it does not work well with the Nokia E7-00.  When connecting it freezes the phone for about 20 seconds.  When starting to listen to any media the phone will also freeze for about 10-15 seconds.  When advancing a track or going back a track, the phone will also freeze for about 10-15 seconds.  Unpairing and repairing will not resolve this problem.  I do not know why it does this and have not been able to remedy it.>>> UPDATE: Nokia's update to Belle (not Belle Refresh) has resolved the connection/interface problem with the E7-00.

reviewText: This was one of my favorite purchases of the year.  I recently misplaced them, however, and will be upgrading to the new model (HBS-730).First, if you have never had wireless headphones, get ready for a treat.  Not having to worry about snagging a cord on something is great.  The battery lasts all day for me, and the duration did not seem to noticeably decrease after a year.I used them to listen to music and podcasts at work almost every day.  I appreciated the fact you can leave one earbud in, while the other sits safely in its magnetic holder.  This way I could still hear my coworkers.  Being able to leave my phone charging and still walk around while listening is great.  I can grab a glass of water from the water cooler or walk over to a colleague's desk without any hassle.  I am using a wired set of earbuds until my HBS 730 arrives, and it is amazing how much of an inconvenience the cord is.I enjoyed using them while running, although I know many hear have said the neckband bounced around too much for their liking.  This didn't bother me much so maybe my neck is bigger.  The fact that you don' t have a wire pulling on them as you run means they stayed in my ears better than a corded set.  Putting my phone in an armband and having no cord involved made running very enjoyable.Sound quality is OK.  It was better than I expected for a wireless set, and although I hear the newer version has improved sound quality, I had no complaints.  A lot of my listening was just talk radio podcasts with only one earbud in, but sound was decent for hip hop and rock when I was listening to music.Finally, just a comment on the build quality and durability.  As others have noted, these things seems to be very well built.  My set still looked new after a years worth of use.  I didn't exactly baby my set either.  They may seem kind of flimsy when you first pick them up, but the materials being used are apparently high quality.If I end up having range issues with the HBS-730 as some of the other reviewers have mentioned, I will likely end up returning those and coming back to the HBS-700.  The only thing that is NOT in question is that I apparently can't live without these, as replacing my lost pair was never in doubt.

reviewText: I love the headset.  However, even though it looked like it was in original packaging, it did NOT come with a user manual.  I had hoped it would also have multiple sizes of earbud covers, but no... And these earbuds are a bit too large for my ears.But I'm not returning this because I love the headset.  I use it with my iPhone 4 to listen to audio books.  Like it does with wired ear buds, it switches flawlessly between phone calls and my audio books.  Love the vibrations.  The only gotchas that I've encountered are:- I can't just hold down the phone button and go into voice control.  If I press the phone button, it only redials my previous call.  Hmmmm.  This will be s major problem when I can't look at the phone.  I did find the user manual online and downloaded it to my iPad, so will look to see if this is simply done differently on this headset.- earbud size a bit too large..  But they do seem to be secure, so I'll wear them for a few days to see how the comfort is after 4-6 hours.** correction after reading the user manual... voice control DOES work.  But where my old wired earbuds required me to press and hold the phone button to go into voice conntrol, this LG headset goes into 'redial' mode after 'press and hold'. Instead, just tap the phone button and voila, voice control.  It works great.So I've put this up to a 5star rating.  Am looking forward to finding out how long the headset lasts (wires DO break after heavy usage).  But no matter how long, I'm buying another one for my husband. This is exactly what I've been looking for!!** update 2:  tested this while wring the neck piece under the collar of my polo shirt.  Vibrations from an incoming call tickled (love that feature) and I got good reports on my voice quality despite that the microphone was under my collar.Am updating this after using it for months:  I absolutely love the vibrations on my neck letting me know there's an incoming phone call.  I many cases (especially in noisy areas), that is the only indicator I have.  Even though I have my phone set to ring and vibrate, it's this headset vibration that I notice.  Love it!
title: LG Tone Wireless Bluetooth Stereo Headset - Retail Packaging - Black/Orange
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: Looking to purchase a headset for a run or workout at the gym? This is the way to go!If you do a little research you will find that every single over the ear bluetooth set falls victim to sweat and moisture making its way into the circuitry and shorting it out... regardless of the 'Sweatproof' adverts. The only solution thus far seems to be moving the hardware to your neckline away from those hotspots. I have officially hit 4 months of constant use running and hitting the gym 3-5 times a week without a hitch. The convenience is unparalleled as you can run with your phone on your arm or workout with the phone on the ground next to you. I have taken calls in the middle of a set by simply hitting the call button. Change tracks on Pandora or even hold and speak to do voice commands. The possibilities are endless.Cons- The from factor makes for a bumpy ride if you are not wearing a shirt during a run. Normal use typically makes one end hang lower than the other which makes it feel awkward at first. Headphones can get wrapped around the set itself as the magnets are not very powerful.
title: LG Tone Wireless Bluetooth Stereo Headset - Retail Packaging - Black/Orange
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: I've had these for just over a month now and they work as intended. They're light so you don't even know they're there and they're comfortable. Only fitment issue I've had are that the size/shape of the ear bud is just big enough that it doesn't quite fit properly in my ear canal. At first I thought it was the silicon bulbs but the problem still persisted even after I swapped the bulbs from my old ear buds which fit me perfectly and never came loose. I compared the size of these ear buds to my old pair and these were a touch bigger. If I'm just sitting down they stay seated in my ear canals fine, it's when I'm moving around that they come loose and the noise cancelling effect is diminished. Not a big deal but just a concern if you feel as though you have smaller ear canals.The buttons are a bit too easy to activate. It would be nice if they were a bit firmer or required a more deliberate push to activate the intended function. It's too easy to bump something or if I reach to adjust the headset on my neck I will accidentally tap a button when grabbing for the headset.The sound quality is so-so. This is my first pair of Bluetooth earbuds so I can only compare to my old wired earbuds which sound great, IMHO. I've never really heard much bass, and the sound overall is a bit hollow (if that makes sense?) and on the tinny side. Adequate but nothing special.I've used this headset with a Samsung Galaxy S and now with a Galaxy SIII, along with my wife's HTC Windows phone and it paired fine with all three. The only functionality issues I've had with both Galaxy phones is that I will hit the play/pause button to pause music and then if it sits paused long enough, when I hit the play button again it won't restart the music. When I look at the phone I see that each time I hit the play/pause button it's actually skipping to the next song but never actually plays it. I have to start the music on my phone again and then the play/pause button functions properly. I'm using PowerAmp on my Android phone as my music player so it may be an issue with PowerAmp as much as it may be an issue with the headset. I haven't tried it with any other media player on my phone to determine which is to blame. I only used them once for a brief time on my wife's Windows phone so I didn't thoroughly test out the full functionality on that phone.I've used these when walking/jogging, mowing the yard, riding my motorcycle, and just working around my house. They're always comfortable and I sometimes forget they're even there until I bend over or lean back or do something that causes the headset to slide up my neck or fall off my neck. I've had a few times where I've been wearing them while sweating profusely and so far, so good, they're doing okay.If I could make one improvement to the headset it would be to put some sort of rigid beam in the actual headset so that you can actually form the headset to stay in fitted position - picture a piece of wire hanger running through the headset - so you can manipulate the shape a bit and have it stay in that shape. This would be a huge benefit when I'm riding my motorcycle.Speaking of using them on my motorcycle. I searched the reviews as I purchased these specifically for use when riding my motorcycle and several reviews said they worked great on their motorcycle and didn't have any problems. I have to respectively, but vehemently, disagree with each and every one of them. I ride a sportbike and wear a full face (non-modular) helmet and a leather jacket with a bit of a collar. My first few rides I put on my jacket and put the headset on the outside of my jacket and the thing flew all over the place and smack up against my helmet, and if it wasn't blowing around, whenever I would turn my head to do a lane check, or look down to check my speed I routinely bumped a button causing an undesired result. I tucked the headset in my jacket and it still randomly tapped a button when I moved my head around or the headset just happened to shift in an unfortunate manner and would press up against the jacket collar. The only way I can wear these when riding my bike is to turn them backwards (opening is on the back of my neck) and flip'em upside down and then tuck the front into my collar and leave the sides (where the buttons are) exposed above my collar. It works but this is the main reason I would love to have some sort of semi-rigid spine in the headset that would allow me to bend and form the headset around my neck to keep it from flapping around. I'm still trying to think of some way to fit something to the headset to allow me to form it securely around my neck. I'm not knocking the headset for this, just sharing my experience that this may not work for you if you intend to wear them while on your motorcycle.I have yet to use them to a point that they've clearly run out of battery power. At most I've got them on for about 30-35 minutes at a time once or twice a day. I just tend to charge them about once every 7-9 days just to avoid them actually running out of juice when I really wanted to use them. For this reason I won't really comment on battery life.For the desire of the headset having some rigidness for mold-ability I knocked off a half-star - not that the headset doesn't function properly, just that this would be an improvement I think a lot of people would appreciate. The other 1-1/2 stars is for the too-easily-activated buttons and the okay sound quality. Firm up the buttons and improve the speakers and this is a solid 4-1/2 star product.**UPDATE** 9/3/2013:Just wanted to update this review after owning these for so long...Since last March I started jogging/running pretty much every day for 30-45 minutes outdoors along with going to the gym to lift weights several days a week. I've logged hundreds of miles on these earbuds and happy to say, despite all the sweat these things have seen, they're still working great. The charge still seems to last the same as well, I've only fully drained them a few times after multiple uses for varying amounts of time. One thing I've discovered is sometimes, depending on the pace of my jog, the headset tends to bounce around a bit and will hit against my collar bones. It isn't truly painful but definitely irritating after awhile. Additionally, when jogging, the same pace which causes them to bounce off my collar bones also causes the headset to shift around on my neck so I am constantly re-adjusting them to not be lopsided to one side or the other. These two traits only serve to reinforce my original suggestion of some form of rigidness to the spine of the headset. If you're a runner this may be of some concern for you; still nothing I would consider a deal-breaker, but felt it noteworthy nonetheless.Additionally, since my original review, I've also picked up an ASUS TF-700 tablet. The headset has an issue with connecting with the tablet; it works, but each time I pair the 2 I have to go into the Bluetooth settings and tap the headset entry to manually begin the pairing process as opposed to just turning on the Bluetooth antenna and the LG headset then waiting for the automatic pairing to take place. Additionally, and this is a ding against the tablet but related to the headset, ASUS, for some reason, decided to have Bluetooth and wi-fi share the same antenna. If you like to stream anything from the Internet - Netflix, YouTube, etc. - the audio will not be in sync; about a solid half-second delay in the characters' mouths moving and the dialogue being heard through the headset. If I intend to watch any streaming videos through my tablet I make sure to have a pair of wired earbuds with me. This is not an issue when watching videos stored on the tablet itself or an inserted memory card. Again, not a fault of the headset, just noting the issue.

reviewText: What I like:Call quality is acceptable. As good as any other wireless headset I've used and far better than my Sennheiser MM400s. The vibrating neckband is killer.I like having an analog on/off switch. This is missing on nearly everything these days.The form factor is great. I wear it everywhere under my shirt collar in a business casual environment. Hints of wires would be visible if you are wearing a more formal white business shirt, but my collared polo and sport shirts hide it well. The form factor is why you should buy this and why you will love it. As I stated before, I own the superior Sennheiser MM400 which has amazing audio quality. I rarely have the MM400 with me because it is not designed to wear as a business accessory. The form factor of these is perfect. Absolutely perfect. These will go with you everywhere. You will not look like a gadget spaz like the guys using the normal bluetooth accessories. When wearing the buds, you are wearing plain buds. They easily tuck away under your collar when not in use. The only bad thing about the aesthetics is the flashing blue light, but this is concealed by your collar.What I don't like:Unfortunately, the stereo sound quality is pretty poor. They don't sound as good as stock iPhone/iPod buds. They sound like cheap $10-$20 buds. Highs and lows are clipped. They funnel all sound into the muddy mids. Imagine a stock FM car stereo from 1984. I'd gladly pay $200 more for this form factor with the sound quality of my Sennheiser MM400s.Conclusion:Buy these. Buy them now. For <$50, they are a great value and you will use them every day. I gave them 3 stars but they really almost merit four when you consider how flippin' cheap they are.For listening to music in a less-portable more-conspicuous form factor, buy yourself a pair of good quality Sennheisers (wired or bluetooth, they are the best for sound quality).

reviewText: I bought these to replace samsung units that failed me. These had favorable reviews wanted to give them a shot. Had for one day and this is what I have to say.1. Very Comfortable, hardly know they are there.2. Respectable sound. Not as good as quality wired headphones, but pretty good. Had trouble with garble from my HTC EVO LTE, but found conflict between Beats EQ on Phone and EQ on headset. Turned off headset EQ, sound better.3. Connectivity. Pairing was a snap, super easy, turn them both on set search and done. Connection is more steady than old Samsung units, but be aware, the owners manual says 33 feet, they are dreaming! Putting it in your back pocket can cause problems! If it is in your front jeans pocket should be fine.4. Fashion: NOT! They look kinda wierd. They get attention alright...if you like that sort of "What is that massager thing around your neck " thing.Overall after day one I am happy with them and they do what I want.I recommend and will update as time goes by.++++Update March 5 , 2013The Battery Life on these is Amazing. Part time use (2-3 Hours a day, has lead to going 7,8,9, 10 days between full charges! Sound I would still rate as decent, not exceptional. One con is I am a big man with a 19" neck so sometimes my neck pushes buttons inadvertantly. But it is no big deal. Still loving them!Enjoy.JB

reviewText: There are plenty of super elaborate reviews on this headset, so I am not going to write another long one. Almost all of the good stuff said about this Headset are absolutely true.Especially Good:* Lightweight* Keeps BT radiation further from your brain than most (i.e. BTR is not directly in your ear)* Great sound quality, I am sure there are superior analog buds, but they sound great to me.* I use these for exercise. I wrap the headphones under my necklace to keep the headset around my neck.* Magnetic earbud holders pretty much set a new standard.The Bad:* Serious connectivity issues when listening to streamed music on my phone. Does not work as well with wifi enabled, but this could just be my phone. Tested with Grooveshark and Pandora on a Nexus One.* When Jogging, I use a very small back pack to hold my phone and everything works as expected. When walking with the same backpack, more connectivity issues (wtf is that?!). Oh well, works perfectly fine in my pocket.* Constant blinking blue light when in use or listening to music. Can be annoying when in the dark.* Doesn't work well (for me) when connecting to a PC, either in Windows or Linux (poor sound quality). Did not test with a Mac.I do not in any way regret my purchase at all. Perfect dedicated headset for my phone which was the only reason why I purchased it. I wish streamed music would not cause connection issues, but I have no problem getting more MP3s for my phone so as to avoid these issues. Will test with a kindle fire soon and update this review to see if streamed music still causes issues.
