reviewText: I purchased these for my wife because she likes to listen to audio books a lot.  She is constantly complaining about catching her earphone cables on things as she works around the home so I thought this would be a nice gift. The first thing she said is that they were comfortable to wear and she really didn't even know she had them on.The sound out of them is pretty good and the dynamic range is not bad at all.  She uses them on her iPhone and iPad 2 to listen to music and audio books.  Now she can lay her phone or iPad 2 down in the kitchen and walk about 35 feet away in any direction with very good reception.  This includes shooting the Bluetooth signal through 2 walls.  At 40 to 45 feet the sound starts breaking up and at 45 feet it just loses connection.  As you walk back into range it immediately reconnects to the source.The headphones can connect to two devices but only one of them can be a phone.  Set it up with your phone first and then use the manual linking method to set it up with a playing device only, like an iPad.The earphones come with a recharger pack and they charged very quickly.  You can listen to music or talk on the phone 10 hours before needing to recharge.The headset has multiple buttons for your use while wearing the device.  There is an on/off switch, volume up/down rocker switch, a call switch that is used for connecting and disconnecting from calls and pairing the headset to your device and a microphone all located on the LH side. The call button also has a blue LED ring around it that is a solid blue when the headset is searching for a pairing device and it flashes blue when it is in normal operating mode.  While charging, the headset is off and the blue ring turns to red.  When the charger is connected the headset turns off regardless of what position the on/off switch is in. There is also a charging port on the inner side of the LH part of the headset.  On the RH side there is a Rew/FF button, and a play/pause button.  The earplugs magnetically fit into the headset when not in use.The LED ring around the call button can also help you to determine the amount of charge left in the headset.  If you press and hold the call button for 3 seconds the LED ring will light up for 1 second.  Solid blue means high charge, violet means medium charge and red means low charge.While playing music you can skip forward or back one song or chapter by quickly pressing the REW/FF rocker switch.  If you hold the switch you can speed forward or back as long as you hold the switch down.  You can answer a call, transfer a call, voice dial, recall the last number dialed, end a call, go to call waiting or reject a call all by using the call button.  Remember your phone device must be able to handle these types of actions for them to work.Our unit came with two different sets of ear buds that looked like medium and large.  Make sure that you use the set that best fits into your ear for comfort and also for good noise blocking.  It will also help you to get the best sound as most of the audio output will be directed into your ear and give you the best sound.  If they are too loose then part of the sound is lost and you will not get the best sound fidelity.The unit also features a bass boost that can be turned on.  If you press the up and down volume rocker switch on both sides for 1 second it will switch between normal EQ or Bass Boost.  You will hear a beep in the headset when the change is made.Cons:Some items on the device seem fragile as the headset is really a high tech miniature piece of electronics.  The flap that covers the charging port for example just seems excessively fragile.There is the geek effect in that you have this ring around your neck and there is a flashing blue light going when you have it turned on.  You forget you are wearing it but people do look at you sort of strangely.One thing that I did not like is that when we received the unit we noticed that the internal box that contained the headset had been opened before we got it.  The special sealing tape from the factory had been cut and the wall charger plastic bag had been opened.  In addition there was an empty bag for another set of ear buds.  When we purchased the unit it was supposed to be new and the fact that it was opened indicated that it had either been returned or opened in the warehouse.  I don't care for that as I paid for new merchandise but the unit has performed well so far.  I didn't deduct any stars for the opened box as it does not reflect on the product but it certainly does on the seller!Overall we like the headset and I would recommend it to you!

reviewText: I've tried a bunch of bluetooth headsets and this one is the best one I've found so far. They are good for biking, rollerskating, erging (rowing on a stationary rower) and walking all over the place to do errands.Since the bulk of the headset rests around your neck, the earbuds are really light, which helps them stay in your ear. I did end up putting my own silicone tips on them because the ones that come with didn't fit me quite right, but I usually have this problem with most silicone earbud tips.When I first got these, I never really used them to talk to people, in fact I wasn't even pairing them with my phone. Then one time I did have them paired to my phone and I heard a noise and pressed a button and what's this? I'm having a conversation with someone on my phone! I was riding my bike in traffic at the time, had no idea what I was doing and yet was able to answer the phone, have a conversation and then hang up afterwards, so I'd say the controls are pretty intuitive. I've used some other headsets where buttons do a lot of different things, since there just aren't that many buttons, but these let you answer the call on your left, pause your music with the right, raising and lowering volume is on one side, going forward and back on tracks is on the other. I really find it easier to navigate than the styles that try to be smaller and more compact.They do move around sometimes. Especially when riding my bike, they will EVENTUALLY start twisting to the side so by the time I've finished a ride and removed my sling bag, sometimes they are completely out of place and maybe hanging off my back on one side. Meanwhile, of course the earbuds will have fallen out. When they do come out, though, there is never a yanking out from the ears as I've experienced with other headsets with earbuds. The earbuds also come out of their magnetic holders sometimes, but overall they stay put pretty well.I will often be wearing these when I get wherever I'm going walking or biking and I don't find people staring at them strangely or even seeming to notice them much, which I think it a plus.The sound is decent quality and there is some noise cancelling going on. I sometimes wear just one ear at a time, especially if I'm in traffic or I just want to hear what's going on around me. I do find that weird head movements (especially biking or maybe rooting around in my bag while on the train) can sometimes cause buttons to be pushed, like all of a sudden I guess I've pushed the pause button with my chin or turned the volume up/down when twisting around.I sometimes lose the connection for a moment or off and on depending on where the phone is in relation to the headset. On my bike, I've had pretty good luck with it when the phone is in a pannier on the back of the bike, but sometimes when it's in a bag on my back, I lose the signal. It seems to help when I put my iPhone 4s into the outside pocket of my bag, upside down. Lately, I've done even better by getting a little bag that fastens to the front of the top tube of my bike frame (up by the fork.)Cycling JFLY Roswheel Frame BagIt's meant to hold a phone and not only does it maintain my bluetooth connection but I can actually look at my phone to do things like find out what time it is.The customer support from LG is not very good. I was having trouble pairing my headset with my phone at one point (it just wasn't working) and the LG support site had a list of all these different electronic items so you could find yours and get an automatic service/return request and this headset wasn't on the list so it required actually being on hold and talking to a human and asked some silly questions before being given instructions for sending in the headset (with me paying for shipping.) Then I didn't hear anything from them for a while, then one day my headset showed back up with a note that seemed to be saying I forgot to put my proof of purchase in with the headset so they didn't work on it BUT I tried it again and it seemed to be working so...whatever, I don't know. It's out of warranty now as I write this anyway, so not something I have to worry about any more! At least it's working, but if it wasn't, unless something better has come along in the meantime, I'd probably buy another of this same style because of it's multiple activity uses, general ease of use and fairly long battery life.Oh, I should also mention that I have sweated on it quite a bit and that hasn't seemed to affect it at all.

reviewText: I've only had these for 48 hours, but so far I am loving these headphones.  I bought them because I had broken 3 wired pairs in the past 2 months, all at the base where they plug into my iPhone.  I'm not an audiophile, but I'd say the sounds quality is great; comparable to the $20-$25 headphones that I usually buy and I was surprised that the phone call quality is better than my dedicated Plantronics Discovery 975 bluetooth headset which cost me twice as much.  Though I haven't tried it in a noisy environment yet.  I plan on getting a lot of use out of these as I use them for both work and play so I'll update my review if anything goes wrong or any issues develop.My only issue so far is that I wish it came with some sort of carrying case because they can get caught on things if you throw them in a bag.  I don't want to put undue pressure on the wires.  I think any heavy zip-lock or cloth bag would work for this though so I'm sure I won't have trouble finding something around this size to offer a little protection.On a side note, I don't know where these shipped from, but I ordered using Prime and they were on my doorstep 18 hours later as I was leaving for work, so I have to say I'm very happy with amazon shipping.  One note on the packaging; I saw some reviewers say they had a difficult time opening the packaging, but I found it very easy.  You just cut the 1 inch tape tab on the bottom of the box and it opens like a clam-shell.  No other cutting, pulling or forcing required.  Maybe they heard the complaints and updated the package.UPDATE: After a couple of weeks I'm still really enjoying these.  I've found that they are a little strange to run with so I use regular workout headphones for that, but for work, they are wonderful.  No more keeping a bluetooth headset in one ear and a headphone in the other when I'm expecting a call; I like being able to answer calls on the fly without removing the headphones.  I saw that some people had an issue with an occasional skip in audio.  I do get this occasionally, maybe once or twice a day, but it doesn't really bother me enough to worry about.  I just wish I could get these working with my Windows 7 PC; why doesn't Microsoft include native A2DP support?

categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: I've tried so many Bluetooth Headsets in the last 2-3 years. These I just returned because I see the same thing happening. As with all of the others, they lose the connection thoughout the day. I'm sitting at a desk two feet from the laptop or tablet. And, I've had numerous laptops, tablets, phones etc. - same results - I don't get it. Windows or Mac or Android - or even Nokia - made no difference.I have to conclude Bluetooth is not ready for prime time. And, I will not buy another Bluetooth headset - nope not again. All I need is for the headset to maintain the connection so that I can make and receive skype calls throughout the day - that's it. I don't want to have to reconnect if someone calls or if I want to make a quick call. I don't get it - why can't this be accomplished.And, I really liked these. All the weight is in the part that rests - unnoticed - on your neck. And, when the ear buds fall out - as they inevitably do - they're right there a few inches from your ears so it's fast and easy to reinsert them.It's a brilliant design. And, when it was working - it worked very well. And, for music probably fine - good sound. Good range too.The magnet thing too is super clever. When the ear buds are not in your ears, they naturally get sucked into the ends via some magnets so they don't go flopping around. That's clever.Lastly, in terms of durability, I'm not sure these would have lasted all that long in my backpack anyway. They do seem a little fragile. I'm going to stick with my last set of BT - the Plantronics BackBeat 903+  They also lose connection all the time too but I didn't return those in time. And, they're more ruggedly built and smaller.But, I don't recommend those or any BT headset at this point.  I just bought theBose MIE2i Mobile Headset'wired' headset and I'm thrilled with those - never fall out of my ears - and never disconnect - with excellent sound.
title: LG Tone Wireless Bluetooth Stereo Headset - Retail Packaging - Black/Orange
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: I bought this headset to replace the Plantronics Discovery 975.  The Plantronics device provided very good sound quality, but I couldn't get it to fit comfortably in my ear, and it would often pop out during use.  The LG headset is very comfortable, and listeners on the other end of my conversations have said that my voice sounds like I am using a land line.  The ear buds fit nicely.  I agree with other users who have recommended only using one bud and leaving the other ear open - It is better for safety as the buds block much of the external sounds, and being able to switch buds during long calls helps to avoid ear discomfort.The only reason that I am not giving the LG five stars is that I have only had it for about a month, so I can't yet rate reliable quality over the long haul.  I certainly recommend it based on my experience to date.

reviewText: I held out from buying Bluetooth headsets for a long time after my last pair (Motorola I believe) gave me too many issues during college from dropped signals. With LG scoring massive praise and high reviews, I finally thought I would jump in a deal offered by Newegg. I brought these headphones with me to the Philippines, after testing them for two weeks in Seattle with fairly decent results.At first the range was good with the headphones. I could leave my phone in one room and get up to fifteen feet away while receiving a good signal. Maybe eight feet with a wall between us. This was pretty good, the sound quality was great and noise isolation was acceptable.However, once I arrived in the Philippines I started having larger issues. My phone was unable to play to the headphones without skipping around a lot while I was exercising. Also, I found that the headset itself likes to jump around a lot, resulting in a bruised collar after about a mile of jogging nonstop. This was later partially solved by wearing a shirt with a smaller collar and placing the unit underneath, but I was still unable to listen to music without holding my phone in my hand within three feet of the unit.I became fed up with this after the third week that I've since thrown the headset into my luggage and refuse to acknowledge its pitiful existence. I've tried many things, from charging to testing from alternative sources and it has not given me the performance I was hoping for. And since I don't return back to the US until late April, I doubt I will be able to get a refund/claim on the item.
title: LG Tone Wireless Bluetooth Stereo Headset - Retail Packaging - Black/Orange
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: Bought this late 2012, and it worked great, as I mainly use it for listening to podcasts while walking, driving, anything, though I also answer a lot of calls with it. I can't do "behind the neck" style as I have a very thick neck, and this I can leave outside my shirt collar.Audio quality is quite good, and battery life is phenomenal. You practically forget it's there. Charge it in the morning, and even if you use it all day you'll only run out of juice just before you go to bed, and that's with HOURS of listening to podcasts, taking and making calls, etc.The magnet tips are very cool as they "take" the ear buds back so they don't wrap around your neck.Two problems, however, marred its existence.1) It only wants to pair to ONE host at a time. I have both a laptop with Bluetooth, and a smartphone. I really want the headset to pair to both so I don't have to swap things back and forth. Unfortunately, this cannot be done with this particular headset. It's either-or, not both.2) Months after purchase and almost daily use, the left earbud broke in half at the seam. Seems the glue just "popped". I glued it back together with superglue, but it seems I lost a wire connection as there's no more sound from the left bud, even though I detect no wire break.Oh, and you'll very likely lose one or both of the "retainer rings" that hooked the wire back to the main loop. I did. It's not critical, but it's likely that you'll end up yanking the wire too hard and thus rip the bud out of the body if you're not careful.For $60 or so, this is a very good stereo headset. It doesn't have the fancy shmancy voice control, status readback, or such, but its phenomenal battery life and comfort makes it worth considering. Just beware of its weaknesses
title: LG Tone Wireless Bluetooth Stereo Headset - Retail Packaging - Black/Orange
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: These bad boys are awesome! These are the best wireless headsets I've ever owned... Hands down! The pairing process is simple and easy. Siri works great with this set.  The range is exceptional and they hold a charge like nothing else! They deliver what's promised.... And more. Comfort should be mentioned here also. These are very very comfy and can be easily worn for hours upon hours.  They charge rapidly, always a good thing. The sound quality is very good.... I'm no expert,  by any means, but You won't be dissatisfied with their sound reproduction... It's pretty good! All these positives and they are 25 bucks less than that big blue box! I love these and you will too!

reviewText: 10 Stars out of 5 rating:)  Has brought new life into all my audio/video gadgets, including home TV sets.  Stays on neck all day without even noticing and is ready to use as needed.  Great quality which allows for flexibility with movements.  Perfect Perfect design with magnet-ed earbuds safely tucked away when not in-use.  Sound quality is great as well and no problems with callers on other end, so microphone also has great location!  Cant believe I waited so long to try Bluetooth, and this headset is proving to be a nice welcome.  Stupid me thought BT had to be glued to ear all day, which kept me away from BT for so long.  No longer will I use wired headsets, the freedom these provide is amazing.  Battery is also superb for my use where I typically charge every other day.  Battery has yet to go completely dead even after using with phone after several days.  I probably use about 1-2 hours MAX of actual talk-time each day.  The only small downside is with Bluetooth enabled on phone most of the day it does cause a noticeable  battery drain on the phone:(  However I'm now getting into habit of turning off Bluetooth on phone during long periods of stand-by and turning back on after answering call.  Sync is a snap with phone, tablet and a GoGroove BT transmitter used for TV's and PC/Netflix while working out.
title: LG Tone Wireless Bluetooth Stereo Headset - Retail Packaging - Black/Orange
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: I use this headset to listen to podcasts and music at work (and at home while cleaning). The range on this headset is fantastic. I can have my phone upstair charging while I'm downstairs folding laundry with minimal disruption in media. It doesn't give battery notification on iPhone (LG Tone+ 730 does) but I'd rather have the range that this headset has. It's great to be able to play/pause, modify volume, and skip/rewind quickly (without having to dig phone out of pocket and fuddle with menus). The headset isn't five-stars as when you use it to make calls you sound like you are taking in a tunnel. Overall, it is a great headset with a couple of quirks.

reviewText: There are a lot of things to like about this design. I love how it sits around the neck. Sure, the bass function isn't much of a real bass, and the ear bud cables are just a tad too short. But for me, these concerns have been minor. For design, I'd give 4 stars. After 4 months, it's still holding up well, too, despite numerous drops on the ground and falling asleep many a night with it around my neck!I initially awarded 2 stars for performance, after having the unit for about 3 weeks. It seemed at the time that the range and strength of the Bluetooth radio was lessening significantly. However, this proved to be an issue with my iPhone--not the headset--and was easily solved with a reboot of the phone. So here I am correcting my initial review and going back to a full 4 stars!Update 2013/06/18: Still going strong. My chin sometimes toggles the forward/back rocker on the right side when I turn my head too far and scrunch my shoulders a bit (for whatever reason). It's a minor annoyance. I've pulled off my shirt on many occasions, forgetting that I had the headset on, and had it comes loose and clatter to the floor. No damage to speak of so far. A solid investment.

categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: I have owned about 4 hbs-700 headsets.  The hbs-700 can't get much better although I do prefer the hbs-730The range is excellent.  I can usually wander about two rooms away before losing my connection.The sound quality is excellent on phone calls or listening to music.  People on the other end can't tell I'm on a wireless headset.  I also like the magnetic ear bud holders although the bright orange is a little loud.The build quality is excellent, except for the ear buds where they come out of the neck piece.  They need to reinforce the wires.  My hbs-700 headsets have all failed at that specific location.  Regardless, I get very good wear from these headsets.  (typically I've gotten about 6 months out of a headset, 7 days a week 12 -18 hrs a day, running wires, crawling under desks, taking apart computers, replacing hard drives, etc.)I've probably owned 20 different sets of bluetooth headsets.  These are hands down the best bluetooth headsets out there with the exception of hbs-730.  At $60, these LG headsets easily blow away headsets that cost twice as much. They are MUCH better than plantronics, motorola, jabra etc.I've seen some headsets connect by a small wire, and have been tempted, then realized this is a better design.  Here I can take the ear buds out of my ears, and I have a place for them that protects them, but keeps them handy.By the way, the headsets vibrate when a call is coming in, so you can tell your phone is ringing even if the ear buds are in their magnetic holders.If you are looking at the hbs-730, it differentiates itself from the hbs-700 with voice feedback that tells you you've answered a call, or that your bluetooth is connected, or disconnected.  It also vibrates twice when it loses connection with your phone, or gets connected with your phone.The headsets come with 3 different sizes of ear buds, so even the smallest ears and biggest ears will be comfortable.They are a little bit nerdy, but they also command a lot of respect.  I find that when I'm out and about on a very casual Saturday wearing  raggedy shorts, a torn t-shirt, flip-flops, unshaven, and with my long hair down instead of in a pony tail, people still call me Sir and Mr. MyLastName.  I was real surprised to find myself being treated so respectfully until I realized I had my hbs-730 headset on.  I guess it just screams expensive high-tech, so the person wearing it must be a person of means who can afford to look his worst.  ;-)Try them, you'll love them.PS.  Yes, I am a computer consultant.
title: LG Tone Wireless Bluetooth Stereo Headset - Retail Packaging - Black/Orange
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: I tried the newer 730 model but the range is about 10-12 feet and will start to have drop outs and the sound quality is not better and tinny.  I returned the 730 and got another 700 for my wife.  I had a 700 for over 1 year and still love it and working and the tiny wires are still in good shape and I thought it would be torn easily.  Well, I got this 700 last week from a 3rd party seller on Amazon which does the fullfilment and the price was much cheaper, instead of $79, I think it was like $56.  When I got it, the box was torn slightly and must have been opened before.  Charged it and the sound was tinny also but when I tried to do the bass boost, it does not work and there is NO sound or tone reminder going from normal to bass boost and vise versa.  I checked with the first one that I bought and the sound reminder was there.  That is why I think this one is a fake unit, and I have seen them when I was in China.  We I do not understand is that if it is fullfilled by Amazon, why is the box opened and torn.  Something smells fishy.  I can guarantee that there are tons of fake units out there and even selling on Amazon.  Well, i called Amazon and complained and they gave me a discount coupon and I bought another 700 that is sold and fullfilled by Amazon.  This white one is only $44 and the black one is $79!  I do not understand at all.  Finally, I got this white one and everything works, including the bass boost and range is good. So, after weeks or month of trouble I finally got myself, my wife the LG HBS 700.  The form and function for this unit is the best in the market.  Oh, in between I also bought her a Plantronics Backbeat GO2 with sound good but has not vibration alert for incoming call.  I also forgot to tell you that I had bought a white 700 unit from China when I was there and sound good and loud but no bass boost and shorter battery life.  So, stay with Amazon as seller and fullfilment and do the bass boost test!!

reviewText: When originally purchasing these headphones, I did some research. I wanted quality while also not spending some absurd amount. These headphones definitely do the job! The battery life is amazing, and the headphones are really comfortable. They also deliver wonderful sound. Bluetooth took maybe a minute to sync with my iphone 5s. I would wear them while golfing sometimes and the Bluetooth would start to cut out around 20-25 feet, but otherwise absolutely no problems ever if phone is kept close by. The only reason I gave these a 4 instead of 5 is because you do still deal with wires, albeit barely. One of the little clips which holds the wire to the main base of the headphones fell off my set right away somewhere without me noticing. I would recommend some sort of way to have the wires extend and withdraw inside of the headphone base, but overall a wonderful product I am very happy with. My final decision was between these and the Motorola type. I may try Motorola next time just because of the aforementioned wire annoyance at times, but if that's not a big deal, you will absolutely love this set!

reviewText: O.K., at first I was disappointed because I thought you had to hold the button down firmly to activate Siri and all that it does is redial the last number you called.  But I did a little search on the web and to my delight found that in this case a brief pulse of the left button activates Siri.  It is actually better than having to hold it down on my EarPods.  I am a little worried about the longevity of the earpieces themselves but so far so good.  I wear this thing everyday.  It hides under my clothes and the battery lasts ALL day.  I have a motorola headset but it is not as handy as this one.  If this one goes bad, a possibility because of my heavy use, I would not hesitate to order another one.  Love it.

reviewText: I'm not going to bother with some verbose and pointless review, I am a technician by trade, more than "mildly experienced" with bluetooth technology, and these are by far not my first bluetooth earphones.That said, I got these because I am a fan of earbuds, and I found the design to be attractive.As far as the sound, the earbuds seal pretty well, but they do not transfer a very range of bass (a cornerstone of the design)and I find the volume to be less than stellar; however for casual listening they don't do a bad job; and the design is comfortable to a point.My biggest problem with them is the pathetic range, with my mp3 strapped to my arm while at the gym, they drop sound completely if I turn my head away from them, and this is inexcusable. I've used multiple bluetooth speaker/earpiece/headphone devices between the same three devices, and this is one performs badly on all of them.I highly suggest: http://www.amazon.com/Motorola-S305-Bluetooth-Headset-Microphone/dp/B002BH3I9U/ref=sr_1_18?s=electronics&ie;=UTF8&qid;=1341957022&sr;=1-18&keywords;=android+video+out as an alternative, though these motorola ones are a bit fragile, they sound fantastic and function perfectly.M

reviewText: I bought the product because my experience with most Bluetooth headsets is horrible.  Based on user reviews and the overall design I thought this would be the winner.  Well everyone is right about design, audio quality, music features and comfort.  Very well designed and thought out.  The general design of having all controls on the neck band is brilliant and for those who want a great Bluetooth streaming audio headset you will be happy if not delighted.  BUT... how can a company design such a great product in the higher end category and not include a mute button.  I use this for business calls for hours and music on airplanes.  I want all the features.  In business usage I would have traded Bass Boost for a simple mute option.  The only way to mute the mic that I've found is through the handset which kind of defeats the purpose of having hands free headset.  If I'm going to be holding the phone for frequent mute toggle during conference calls, I could just use the speaker phone or a wired headset.  Big disappointment!!!  Small feature that is great for heavy business conf call usage.  Other than that it is a great product.

reviewText: There are things I really like about this, and things that annoy me.I really like the design and the features. This feels comfortable around the neck, and is overall non restrictive. Sound is good, and the ability to receive calls is a plus. Magnets were a cool idea too.On the down side, the ear buds are not very comfortable and they are difficult to remove in order to try the other sizes that come with this(actually I am not sure if the are different sizes or extras). Also there is a blue light indicator, for battery charge and other things which would be convenient, HOWEVER the blue light blinks every 30 seconds always when this is on. Not a big deal when in a lighted environment, but if it is dark it is very annoying because you can see it blink and so can others. this is my one major gripe with these earphones.Overall if you are looking for an "ear bud" style bluetooth earphones these are still a good option.

reviewText: I bought these for myself due to my brother's recommendation. Upon use, I found the headset comfortable and very efficient in sound delivery. Charge time took about an hour when completely dead, but usually I would plug it in for about 30 minutes after using it for 8 hours and I wouldn't have a problem with it.On a side note, the headset causes headaches and is interfered with library security systems. When I was going through our school's security system, I heard a slight buzzing. This is due to the interface between bluetooth and another wave frequency (nothing hurtful but something to be acknowledge). For the headaches, this should occur but is a reason why not to but blue too headsets. Bluetooth (when exposed to the nervous system) for extended periods of time, I found that I would have headaches and need to take a break for listening to my music. When I use my bose headset, I listen to music from anywhere of 8 to 14 hours a day. Having your nervous system exposed to a constant frequency is harmful to your body and you should be careful of this.
title: LG Tone Wireless Bluetooth Stereo Headset - Retail Packaging - Black/Orange

reviewText: I had high hopes after reading several reviews. My biggest issue was that it bounces when jogging causing discomfort. It wraps around your neck and the heavy end is forward. It seamed to bounce on a bony part of my body. The sound was average and it does make a difference on how you seat the ear buds. All of the bluetooth features worked great with my Iphone4S. If you can live with average sound and are not using these to run then they should be fine. I returned these after 1 run.

reviewText: This has been reviewed to death already, so I'll just toss in a few cents' worth:Music sound quality: very, very acceptable. If you're a screaming audiophile you're probably not listening to your phone, but this really, really sounds good. The Bass Boost is even a little too much, depending on what you're listening to.Phone quality: weirdly (to me) one of the best I've used.Controls: well thought-out, spaced and arranged.Convenience: Oh, wow. After a day with it, you'll see what I mean.Battery life: On a full charge, you will get tired before it does.Pairing: You don't really need to read the instructions.So --- what does this gadget need? In a word: COMPLY. Add the comply TX-400 ear tips. I have no idea what the bass gain is, or the noise db reduction is --- but, OH, WOW! Comfortable, great isolation --- just make sure you get the right size. (They have a "sampler" pack, small, medium, large. Find the right one, order the three-pair pack. The whole Comply thing will wind up costing you another $40, if you don't know your size already. Go for it.)

reviewText: Great phone / stereo headset for travel, exercise, workign at computer, anything.As some note - easy to forget it's there. I also love the individual controls with great layout.Phone audio is a tiny tinny is about all I would change. Music sound is pretty good. Bass isn't booming but overall a great set for all I do.I really love the magnetic docking of the ear buds. Keeps them safe; easy to find (and they pop in when even close).I also love the micro-usb charging jack. Everybody who isn't should be migrating to this (like my funky charger / crappy Samsung 460 that was worth the $3 it cost after rebate)For my Android - HTC Incredible - I successfully bound in dual mode and it works great for both phone and stereo audio with one binding. I did have to use the manual bind method as the phone (likely and android OS issue) wouldn't see it in quick bind mode of the headset.Just a great package. Hoping they won some ergonomic awards for it.

reviewText: I got these headphones in June 2013 because my old one's USB port broke, and I got to say that I'm quite satisfied with them, except that you look a bit odd in them.This headset is pretty sturdy and quite flexible. It's also pretty lightweight, making it very comfortable to wear. The sound quality is excellent for this price and the type of headphones. What's also great is that when you plug them into your ears they also work as ear protectors, since they isolate your ear quite well. Another great feature is the call vibration alert, which makes the headset vibrate in case you get a call. But how is the call quality? Well, I got to say that it's decent. Granted, a phone connection will only provide a certain amount of quality, but that's unavoidable, so no points off there. Also there seems to be very little lag in between the phone (Nexus 5) and the headset, so that's a plus. In terms of battery life, I found that those headphones hold about 10 hours before beeping for power, and that's plenty of time. It also recharges pretty quickly over any micro USB cable, therefore making it fairly practical in case you need to quickly charge it up with your laptop.One thing I did notice though is that you may look a bit weird wearing them because it looks a bit like a collar. But hey, I'm willing to pay that price in order to enjoy wireless freedom.
title: LG Tone Wireless Bluetooth Stereo Headset - Retail Packaging - Black/Orange

reviewText: All previous reviews are right on the mark, instantly connects with apples ipad 2, however with the ipod touch 4g you need to manually place the headset in pairing mode (with power switch off, press the call button and move the power switch to the ON side all at the same time for four seconds, this should manually pair the ipod touch 4g with your headset, bluetooth headset name shoud now appear in your ipod touch 4g. Remember to read the manual completely!

reviewText: I bought this because the reviews were raving so much about what a great product it was. I'm generally a bit hesitant to buy LG equipment due to past experiences, but this headset has been amazing so far! I only hope that I can get many years of use out of it. I no longer get discomfort from over the ear headsets (Nokia BH-503) and I don't have the cords that generally come with ear buds. I haven't found a need for custom ear buds the ones included have worked very well for me.After about 4-6 hours, I occasionally get a little discomfort in my ear, but it is usually just because I pushed in the ear buds too hard. Taking them out for 20 minutes and putting them back in more careful generally fixes the issue.I was a little worried about sound quality, but I've been pleasantly surprised. The sound quality on these is much better than my Samsung wired ear buds. It is equal to my Nokia BH-503 over head BT headset but with the comfort of these, they are the clear winners. I also purchased these for family members and they have all loved them so far, even purchasing additional sets for their household.Great design and implementation by LG!

reviewText: I have had a bunch of bluetooth stereo headsets from Jabra to BlueAnt and by far these are the best. Of the 5 different sets of bluetooth headsets I have owned over the years these don't drop the signal or cause static/stutter when the phone is in my pocket, camelbak, or across the room. Every other headset I had would get static or stutter if I had the phone in my left pocket and the headset in my right. They are actually pretty easy to clean, hold a charge for a long time, and are as clear as any bluetooth headset could be. I am not an audiophile and to be honest while I am working out, driving, working, or riding my bike I am not listening for audio quality like you would in setting more suited for that activity. These are light, comfortable, and best of all they work.

reviewText: I purchased the LG HBS-700 Bluetooth Stereo Headset in August 2011 from another retailer. I paid $48.70 with tax. My purpose was to listen to music while driving overnight when everyone else would be sleeping. I know it's against the law to use headphones/headset in both ears in most states but I am an avid mirror watcher so I took the risk. It made my driving duties bearable. And it transmitted Google map driving directions as well. The only drawback to using with Google maps is if you had a long period of time between last transmission/instructions such as long interstate driving it may miss the first part of the transmission. When driving around Chicago using secondary roads it worked very good.This headset sounds better than any cable/wired ear-buds I own. I have the Altec Lansing BackBeat Pro UHP606 with armature micro speakers which ran $99 new, Altec Lansing UHP106 with Ultimate Ears Technology, Skullcandy's Ink'd versions (1) and (2), the Apple earbuds included with the both the iPhone 4 and iPhone 5.Nothing compares to the sound and ease of using the LG HBS-700. The headset sits around your neck resting on your shoulders. You can put your phone in your pocket and control the audio or phone functions without removing it. The only time you would need to hold your phone is if you want to change your audio source such as going from Slacker to Pandora or when you need to make a call. You just can beat the freedom this headset gives you vs. being tethered to your phone by a cable. This makes working out, running or walking a breeze. The earbuds stay in great most of the time even after I start to perspire. The only problem I have had was when I perspired too much after about (3) miles and the play/pause button or fast forward/reverse controls did not work properly. After a few hours they worked again. So this headset is not perspiration proof but it did not suffer a permanent function problem. I wouldn't try wearing them in a rainstorm or they probably would suffer a meltdown.Pairing this headset to a Bluetooth source device is very easy. Takes only about (15) seconds the first time on an iPhone. It automatically pairs about 98% of the time when you turn on the Bluetooth enable source the next time. If it does not pair, I usually just turn off the power and then turn on again. 2% of the time I need to go into Bluetooth setting on the phone and manually pair it. This device has a range of about 30 feet and it works good when leaving a room going into another with walls in between. The headset can also pair over multiple sources/devices. I have a Logitech Bluetooth Boombox which must be manually paired if I am attempting to use it with another Bluetooth enabled device if it was not the last device it had been paired with.One of the BEST features of the LG's is the ability to activate loudness by holding BOTH the volume up and down at the same time WHILE YOU ARE LISTENING TO AUDIO. It will not activate until you hear some type of audio. When activated it beeps in your ear once. The sound just seems to jump at you after activating loudness feature.I still average about (10) hours listening to audio 1.5 years after purchase with the loudness always on before I need to recharge them. It takes between 2-3 hours to charge them fully using the included AC plug. The included AC charger is a 5.1 Volt Output at 0.7 amps. I have also used an AC Apple 5 Volt Output at 1.0 amp sugar cube charger with a USB to micro USB cable I purchased separately. And if on the go with no AC/DC charger, I have used a New Trent IMP50D Portable/External Battery with Output of both 5 Volts at 1 amp and 5 Volts at 0.5 amps using the same USB to micro USB cable. I use the 1.0 amp side to charge the iPhone while also using the 0.5 amp to charge the LG headset. But you cannot use the LG headset while it is charging. I  have also used a Mediabridge Dual USB Car Charger putting out 1.0 amps. This car charger can put out 2.1 amps on one USB but I have not tried to use that one with headset. I use the 2.1 for my iPhone and it charges very quickly. I have experienced no problems with the headset using a source that puts out more than the included AC charger which puts out only 0.7 amps.The headset has controls on both the left and right sides. Those on the left side control volume up/down, a dedicated answer call/hang up call button and as stated above activate loudness function by holding up/down volume controls at same time. You can also use voice commands if your phone supports it by briefly pressing the dedicated answer call/hang up button. Last number redial, just hold the dedicated call answer/hang up button for one second and the headset makes the call for you. And before I forget, the headset vibrates when your phone rings if you are listening to audio. Great idea. The power on/off switch is on the outside of the left arm. The charging port is located on the inner side of the left arm behind swinging mini door. The right side has rewind/fast forwarding tracks and dedicated play/pause button.As far as phone call quality, I have never had a complaint while using this headset as a Bluetooth phone headset. The microphone is built into left side of headset. If you are only using only one earbud for calls use the LEFT side one. Otherwise if the left one is attached via the magnet to the headset it can hamper/block your voice from being heard clearly by the caller on the other end as the microphone sits just behind the left earbud where it attaches by the magnet. As a comparison, I have a top of the line Plantronics 975 Bluetooth headset which can only be used for phone calls. It ran $129 + tax when it first came out and I frequently receive complaints when using it for phone calls.CONS: The included AC Charger wire frayed just behind where the cable goes into the plug and you can see the colored interior cable. I used it only about 20-30 times and wrapped the cable around the charger for storage before it frayed. I taped mine up using electrical tape and it still works. Also where the earbuds sit when attached by the magnets is yellow/orange in color which stands out when you are using the earbuds. I see the new model HBS-730 is gray in color which is an improvement but I wonder why it is not black like the rest of the headset.Last CON is the only way you can see the present charge of the headset is to hold down the left volume control for (3) seconds. A HIGH charge is indicated by a solid blue for one second around the dedicated call answer/hang up button, violet for MEDIUM charge and red for LOW. You can't see percentages anywhere. If you see violet, charge your device immediately is my suggestion. I have gone from violet to red during a 1/2 hour walk and the unit starts beeping in your ear. It beeps more often the lower the charge and just plain turns off when it dies leaving you with no way to listen to audio at all short of your speakerphone on your phone.

reviewText: These are great for a multitude of reason. Even though I gave them 5 stars, I find they have limitations that may or may not bug others.I try to wear these everywhere I go. I have tried multiple brands and models of bluetooth. I have very small ears, and struggle with earbuds that go in my ears. My most favorite bluetooth model ever, before these, the Motorola H730 sit OVER your ear and have a speaker pointing into your ear... don't protrude into your ear. I had to give them up because they don't stream audio from my iphone. Others, no matter their style, hurt my ears, even with the smallest silicone sized tips.These are just comfortable enough. I'd say for 95% of users, the size of these earbuds won't matter, and the sound quality, easy of uses, LARGE controls, a control FOR EVERYTING WITHOUT sharing 1 button to do multiple functions will keep you happy with your purchase. On top of that, the battery seems to last forever, they vibrate when a call comes in, and you can barely tell they are there when not in use. Stereo sounds great, using just 1 earbud works great. Lots of volume. No one has EVER complained or mentioned mic quality when on calls.I have been using them for 2.5 months and no one has ever commented on "what is that around your neck." I always wear collared shirts and tuck them under the collar, or inside my shirt.I have these few complaints- the magnets aren't strong enough and the earbuds are too large to lay on comfortable in bed (I know, who does this?). With just a casual bump, the earbuds fall out of their home. This has yet to irk me, but I think it might bother others. There are these cool, breakaway cable holders that make the earbuds easy to find if not in their home and yet let the cable go in case you catch them on something. Like I said, I have very small ears. To keep from bugging my wife, I use earbuds in bed before sleep. I can't use these because the earbuds themselves are quite large. I use Altec Lansing blitz earbuds for bedtime, and when and if these earbuds die, I'll soilder(sp) the smaller earbuds onto the wires. Like I said, it doesn't bug me when the earbuds don't lock in to their home, so this change won't bother me if I ever need to do it.Orange is ugly, but a sharpie will fix this.Work great on walks and in the car. I will only replace for use in the car when Motorola comes up with a newer, streaming model of H730s. You listening, Motorola?You won't regret buying these, especially if you like to have a seperate on off switch, a seperate answer call/end button, a seperate play/pause button, a seperate up and down rocker switch (switches actually), and individual next and last track controls.It did take a while to sort out its use with my car's stereo... which I use to stream my audio through a cable. Once connected to the car stereo, the ipod audio comes out the car stereo. When I take a call, I have to be carefull to answer using the button on the headphones. If I answer on the phone, I hear the person over the speakers, but there is no mic (my stereo doesn't have a mic). If I answer with the earbuds, I can talk and listen to the caller on the earbuds. Then, unforetunately, I have to manually select the car stereo on a menu on my iphone to resume listening there. Not a huge problem, I don't take a lot of calls in the car. I can also just toggle power to the LGs to regain car stereo audio.You can't charge these and use these at the same time... not rare on bluetooth headsets, but regretable I guess.These are great if you are in and out of your car alot. Just listen to music or audiobooks via the LGs, then you have little or no interuption as you get in and out of your car as the battery lasts forever.Lastly, if I had a very important meeting, the earbuds fit in my pants pocket.. I'd hate to do that regularly as it could break the cables. Would work great in a purse I suppose too.

reviewText: Stellar, lightweight design. But get this: the earbud cords that connect to the unit are just a little lightweight and rubbery. I can tell from the type of material used that these are designed to be sweatproof and should age well, but you'll need to treat them with a bit of respect to avoid tangles, kinks and outright breakage.Sound quality is good enough. I won't pretend to be an audiophile, but I have owned two sets of Sennheiser lanyard-style headphones for previous MP3 players that received excellent reviews for their fidelity, and I have to say that I can't tell a bit of difference versus some stock earbuds that I own -- not when I'm outside, walking the dogs at the park. These LGs are just fine.They're lightweight, and although I thought they'd be uncomfortable (or maybe just annoying) to wear around my neck, they really just "disappear." I just have to make sure to set the sliding cord retainers close to the "pods" on the neck piece, so as to avoid the buds from pulling out when I turn my head.Charging is quick via the included micro USB -- unfortunately via a port that's covered by a tethered plastic piece that I'm accustom to breaking off after a limited number of uses. Power is handled by a slider switch on one side; volume is handled by an appropriately sized rocker switch on the other. The pause/play button and FFWD/RWD rocker works with Google Music, but not Pandora.I love the concept of the magnetic earbud holders at the ends of this thing, but wish they were stronger. And the magnets don't solve the problem of the loose cord, which is left to snag on something if not stored and handled with respect.Nice sounding headset; a pleasure to be free from the cord!

reviewText: The LG HBS-700 is the third Bluetooth stereo headset that I have used (see my reviews of the Motorola S10-HD andJabra CLIPPER).  As in my other reviews I will focus on the music experience as I use my Motorola T305 for hands free calling.  After pairing this unit with my Droid X, I evaluated it for sound quality, ease of use, and comfort.Sound Quality:  I don't have the strictest standards for music listening, but I haven't had many better listening experiences that I have with the 700.  After changing out the earbuds for the larger set to get a good fit, I was ready to go.  I can't emphasize enough the importance of getting a good seal between your ear and the earbud for sound quality.  I have had this wrong on other earbuds in the past, and the difference in sound quality is night and day.  For clarity of playback the only thing that I have gotten better sound from is my Creative Zen X-Fi with the EP-830 earbuds.  While the 700 doesn't produce booming base, it is rare that earbuds do.  By comparison I think that the 700 has better sound than either the Motorola or Jabra units that I have used.Ease of Use:  This is an area where I think LG has really scored.  The 700 has a dedicated on/off switch, and each of its controls does exactly one thing.  There are dedicated buttons for play/pause, skip, and reverse for controlling your music player.  In addition there are dedicated volume and call buttons too.  Once you learn which side the controls are on, it is very easy to control the 700 without being able to see the controls.Comfort:  If you have used earbuds with no issues in the past, you should have every reason to expect the 700 to be of similar comfort.  I have listened for an hour and a half without giving any thought to the headset I was using.  The unit itself rests like a necklace around your neck.  The only potential issue I could see is that people with long hair may find that it gets tangled in the unit.  If you are concerned about this, I would recommend checking out this unit in person.  As of this writing you can do so at a Sprint store.The one caution I would issue would be around active use.  I don't think the unit is designed to hold up to bouncing around, and it also does seem to be sweat resistant either.  I would recommend the Jabra Clipper for active use.  However I use the 700 while sitting at my desk at work.  It does fine with normal walking around and light activity.  I would just refrain from using it during exercise.Overall:  The LG HBS-700 is a very strong offering.  It hits the mark on sound quality, ease of use, and comfort.  The only downside I see to it is that it was not designed for using during exercise.  Otherwise I think that you will be happy with this unit.
title: LG Tone Wireless Bluetooth Stereo Headset - Retail Packaging - Black/Orange
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: This headset was very easy to pair and connect to my media player, as well as my phone.The sound on it is good. I am listening to music on them right now despite the fact that I have a surround sound system that cost close to $2,000. Ok it's mostly because I don't want to wake up my wife and daughter, but the sound is pretty good for a headset.I did make a couple phone calls and the persons voice came through well, and they could hear me like normal. They said it didnt sound any different than when we normally talk on the phone.Having this resting around my neck is comforatable so far. It is very light, i can easily forget it's there at all.There are some buttons on either side of the headset near where the earbuds would stick to for the volume and an on/off switch.One kind of annoying thing to me, just a little one is that while the cords to the earbuds in my ear are long enough to easily reach my ears; i find that if I turn my head to much it will cause the earbud to be pulled out.I would have enjoyed them being an inch or so longer, or having a retractable cord inside the plastic.  It is more than ok though, and this is a very minor thing to me, but it is somewhat irritating and I wanted to let others know.  it kind of makes me think of having my neck on a brace in the sense that I am unable to turn it to much without causing myself trouble.Overall I would recommend this to anyone else who needs or wants a blutooth headset for hands free calls while driving, or listening to music while you run or what not.I personally am happy with this product so far, and would buy it again.

reviewText: This headset is incredibly useful.  I purchased it to be able to listen to various audio streams throughout the day at my desk, while mowing the lawn, while working on projects, and performing other tasks.  My only complaint about it is that if I have multiple devices which have been connected to it, it proves very difficult to select which device is connected.  It also will split connection between various devices, one for phone audio, another for media audio.  I have other bluetooth devices which will accept both inputs from multiple sources simultaneously.  That feature would be the best possible improvement for this unit.Other than that issue (which is a derivative of my usage of it) it meets or exceeds my expectations.  Battery life is quite reasonable, I use it for several hours every day, and only have to charge it every other day.  Once it's on my neck, I quickly forget that it's there.  From a comfort perspective, it could due to be slightly longer from end to end, as my neck is significantly larger than the average, but it isn't a problem for me at the length that it is.

reviewText: Well, I really wanted to love these headphones. They were, so I thought, everything I wanted them to be. They were comfortable, light weight, could be easily tucked away when not in use, they were great. There were a couple of issues though. If my phone was in my back pocket, somehow that interrupted the signal and it would fade in and out significantly.I lived with that issue though as the solution was, don't put it in my back pocket. I could accept that. A few months later though, the left ear phone started getting a little "staticky" for lack of a better term. Well about two weeks or so ago, I discovered a short in that ear bud. If I wiggle it around and hold it just right, I can get sound out of it, otherwise though, it is silent. I'm still tolerating it as I usually only use one side anyway (although it used to be the left for the most part). The right one now though is starting to do the same as the left did. I'm pretty sad about it.I really wanted them to work. The concept is fantastic, but the connections to the ear buds seems to be lacking in the sturdiness department. If you get them, tape that area down or something so that it stays put, that way you hopefully won't end up in the same boat as me.
title: LG Tone Wireless Bluetooth Stereo Headset - Retail Packaging - Black/Orange
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: Have been using this headset mainly to listen to music about 2 hours daily at the gym for a few weeks now with no problems. I replaced a Phillips over the ear waterproof headset, which failed after about 5 months. The LG has better sound quality, longer battery life, MUCH more comfortable fit, and due to the design has larger thus useable buttons. I pair with my Samsung Focus WP 7.5 and they sync fast and have good range. On occasion I get a phone call and the large buttons make answering a breeze, and the mike being around your neck makes for excellent voice quality, I do notice the callers voice volume is a bit lower than the music level but still ok for easy conversation. I charge them every 2 to 3 days, so not sure how long the charge last in terms of hours.The con's:  They only come with one set of spare rubber cups and they are the same size. They are little large for my ear canals, but stay in place once I get them in there. They say they are waterproof (I guess they mean the speakers), but the cover over the charger port doesn't seem to be at all waterproof and is positioned so once you start sweating it lays right against my sweat soaked tee shirt collar, so far no problem but long term???They look like they would be cumbersome hanging around your neck but you really are unaware they are there unless you look in the mirror then they look a little geeky.For the price I don't see how you could beat them.

reviewText: Wow, what a roller coaster this has been! I am rating the LG HBS-700 ($45.99 w/free prime shipping). We had the MOST difficult time getting the bluetooth to work with our phone. Upon initial connection, the bluetooth paired seamlessly. Our issue was it would not stay connected. It would disconnect every 15 - 30 seconds and simply say "bluetooth disconnected" but would reconnect right away, only to be disconnected again. This was so very frustating! I did some internet research outside the Amazon forum and found that there is a known problem with the HTC and LG interface. There's supposed to be a software push to fix the bug but that obviously hasn't happened yet.Here's how we resolved the issue:1. Wi-Fi has to be turned off on your phone2. Restart Phone3. Voila! Bluetooth Disconnect issue is resolved!I hope this review saves someone the frustration we went through. We returned 3 headsets before the light bulb came on to do some online troubleshooting. I purchased this for my husband because he loses standard bluetooth's too easily. This was the perfect solution for him because it is covert and I don't have to worry about him losing it. He loves it and says it's very comfortable. I think this is the best bluetooth on the market currently if you can avoid the connection issues or work around them.
title: LG Tone Wireless Bluetooth Stereo Headset - Retail Packaging - Black/Orange
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: Amazon is going to be angry with me because I usually buy EVERYTHING from them.  This time, I needed this faster than I would be able to get it via mail - so I bought it from a retailer and paid $10.00 more for it than if I had bought it from Amazon (sorry for going to another retailer on this one Amazon).I am using this product (mainly) on an iPhone 3GS.I am in LOVE with this product.My boss allows me to use my iPhone to listen to podcasts and watch movies (in the background) while I work (as long as I do my job and stay productive!).  Recently, a co-worker moved near my work area and didn't like some of the things that I listen to.  So I went to earbuds.  Worked out great, but the wires were in my way.  So I needed a wireless audio solution.Being a very technical person - my first thought was that if you TRANSMIT something - there will be a DELAY.  So I was concerned that audio/video would not sync up properly.After much research - I chose this product.Turned out to be a GREAT choice!  The audio/video has ZERO delay issues.  Now I HAVE seen a delay problem a FEW times.  I've only had this problem AFTER pairing the device with ANOTHER source.  Something gets out of sync. - but if you go to settings (on the iPhone) and disable the device and then re-enable it - the delay disappears.Now then - a few pro's and con's:Pro's:1.  EASY PAIRING.  My iPhone paired with it quickly and easily.2.  Charges FAST - I think I had it on the charger for around 10 minutes.  The light went out (indicating full charge) and I thought 'wow!  Really?  Already?'.3.  Long battery life.  I haven't had them long enough to say for sure - but they advertise 10 hours of play time.  I've been on them at LEAST 6 hours now and they are doing fine.4.  Very comfortable.Con's:1.  The audio quality is better than expected for a bluetooth device - BUT  - They do NOT match my sony earbuds.  They don't have quite the bass "thump" or clarity.  That said - the sound quality IS impressive for a wireless device and it is beyond acceptable - I'd even repeat that impressive is the right word for the audio.2.  There is no 2.  And con number 1 is very minor unless you are a die-hard audiofile.  The sound quality is beyond what I expected for a wireless device.Hope this review helps.  And to anyone who doesn't need it as fast as I did - you SHOULD buy from Amazon.  They have the best price.- Ron*** Added Information ***Ok - it hasn't ever charged QUITE as fast as the first time.  I'm thinking that the thing had a charge when I bought it.  Still, it charges at a reasonable rate.  I used it ALL DAY today and it re-charged in around an hour.  Not bad.
title: LG Tone Wireless Bluetooth Stereo Headset - Retail Packaging - Black/Orange
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: I have tried numeerous bluetooth stero headphones, trying to get the perfect mix of sound quality and convenience.Convenience - These are top notch, and a brilliant concept.  I love the fact that I can just put this headset on around my neck, and leave them on throughout the day.  I wear collared shirts to work, so the headset is mostly concealed by my shirt.  I am a large guy with a 22" neck, and these fit just fine.  My 11 year old son also wore them one day in the car, and they fit his narrow neck just fine too.  These truly are one-size-fits-all.Design - I must give props to the design team here.  This is a very unique take on the stereo bluetooth headset, and I applaud them.  They need to address a few issues on the next model of these though.  The magnetic clips are fantastic, but could stand to be a little stronger.  My earpieces spend more time disconnected from the magnet than they do connected.  Not a big deal, since there is only so far they can stray because of the wire length.  They need to make the cables more durable.  I have worn mine daily for only a little over a month, and I have wires exposed at 3 different points.  The cable insulation can rub off VERY easily.  I have had to resort to "liquid electrical tape" to reinforce those areas.  This could also be partly remedied by a re-designing of the departure angle of the cable from the body of the unit.  The cables come out of the unit at almost a straight 90 deg. angle instead of a lower angle, causing more stress on the cables.Battery Life - Stellar.  I consistently get 9.5 to 10 hours of continuous listen / talk time.  Are there any other bluetooth headsets out there with a 10 hour talk time rating?Call Quality - The call quality is not that bad.  It takes getting used to having a phone conversation in stereo, but I got used to it.  All callers said I was very easy to hear, but that a lot of background noise could be heard.Sound Quality - The sound quality was just mediocre to me.  Don't buy these if you want a full sound stage for your music, or if you consider yourself an audiophile.  Buy these for the convenience and the massive talk / listen time.  the phone calls sounded great, but my music (many different styles) sounded shallow, lacking any low-end sound stage.  I even jammed the earbuds in to my ears tightly to see if there was any more bass that could be heard.  None that I could tell.Controls - Very easy to learn and use.  This is the first time that the button placement makes sense to me.  Basically all of your call controls come from the left side, and your music controls are on the right.  I love the fact that there is a slide power switch instead of a "push & hold" power button.Summary - I like these alot, but I don't think they are going to last very long.  The exposed wiring through the cable insulation makes me think these will have a very limited life-span.  Overall, I like these much better than my Plantronics Back Beat 903+'s.  I like the ear buds on these versus the traditional "on-ear" style of bud that Plantronics uses.  Get these if you want a convenient wireless headset with copius amoutns of talk/listen time, but aren't that concerned with overall sound.  They sound good, but not near as good as other wired earbuds.
title: LG Tone Wireless Bluetooth Stereo Headset - Retail Packaging - Black/Orange

reviewText: These are just amazing,  at least in form and function,  we will see over time how durable they are.These feel really well made, the rubber and plastic has that feel of higher end materials.They are amazingly light, so much that you forget they are on you.They use a micro usb cable to charge,  any android user most likely uses these for their phone and your office will have plenty around if needed.The device is clear and loud,  the buttons are easy to find and use.Now let's move on to some complaints I've read.Low bass:  yes the bass is anything but impressive, but if you hold down volume + and - for 3 seconds the eq switches to a bass mode that helps a lot.The magnets are to weak:  I wonder about this complaint if that may only be for a few units as mine are plenty strong and have not come out even with my jacket on and off.The battery runs out and you never know just how full it is:  well holding down volume -  for 3 seconds shows you the current charge via the color of the led.Now for one issue I ran into and the solution.I found that I would get a call,  answer but I was not able to hear the other person via the headset,  the sound was coming out my nexus4 speaker while the other person could hear me via the headset microphone.I found that the lg blue tooth SMS reader software I downloaded which is specified in the user manual was the cause of this,  after I removed it from my phone everything was back to normal.Over all these are amazing,  the ear buds are soft and comfortable and hold into my ear well,  I highly recommend them, especially for the price.

categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: I had this product for 2 months and liked its performance. At the two month mark, the earpiece cracked and the earbud fell off. I went through 4 or 5 LG Customer Service sources - all which did not have this product listed but insisted you put in certain information that made it very difficult. I finally spoke with someone that told me how to return the product - and that if they determined it was my fault they would tell me how much to fix. BTW, I paid to have the product shipped back.Today I received the product back via Fedex - in the condition I sent it. They determined the break was my fault (it wasn't) and that they could not quote a fix, or a replacement, or a remanufactured replacement. They simply said I was out of luck - LG in effect just said "we are not honoring your warrantee and will not even find a way to try to make you whole".  There was no appeal, no nothing - they decided.I am glad my run in with LG was over a $50 product - I will now know not to buy an LG TV, phone, etc. because I do not want to get stuck with a $2000 TV that LG says "sorry about that 1 year warrantee but weve decided we cant fix or replace your product".DO NOT BUY LG..

reviewText: With such a great review from David Parenteau, it would be almost pointless to read anyone else's review, but I'll throw in my two cents.I've owned quite a few BT headsets and headphones, and have always struggled with a few frustrating issues.- Plantronics makes amazing headsets, and for one ear headsets, none are better.  But I find the biggest issue as being...where do I put it when not using it?- Motorola makes amazing sweat proof stereo headsets, but they are rather large, and frankly, if you're not working out, there's in the way.- Many other BT headsets suffer from an inability to connect quickly as you jump from device to device, and while I'm sure there are several exceptions out there, I've never found one.- One thing that is always frustrating:  I'd like to watch videos or listen to music on my iPad, but still answer calls from my cell phone, and it's been annoying that many BT headsets don't have this function.- BT antenna strength has been a problem for me on almost every stereo BT headset, with several intermittent dropouts while listening to music or on a call.If the above are annoyances you have struggled with, then the LG HBS700 may be just the ticket for you.The HBS700 is a bit of a godsend and fairly close to what I would consider an ideal headset.- First off, the BT electronics is separated from the canal phones.  This alone is a huge advantage.  It allow for larger electronics that don't annoy you while listening to music.- Next, the canal phones have magnetic slots to sit in when not in use.  What a great idea!  having a place to put the canal phones when not in use means they're not dangling and more importantly, don't get tangled.- The larger electronics means bigger battery than other stereo BT headphones, and that's a major plus as you can use it all day.- The unique multi-connection means I can watch videos on my iPad, or listen to music from my laptop, and still have it "cell" connected to my iPhone to answer calls if need be.  It'd be better if it could do calls on two devices, then I could Skype on one and still answer calls from the cell.  - Still, this feature is pretty amazing.- And it connects fast....I mean, really fast.  I can jump from device to device and discoveries occur within a few seconds and connection another 2-3 seconds.  I can't even imagine how many times I've been annoyed with switching devices.- I've broken or lost more single ear BT headsets than I can count.  Always because I have no place to really put the headset when not in use, what's more, I've missed many calls because the BT headset is buried in my shirt or pants pocket and hard to get out in time.  This can't be stressed enough from my perspective.  These things are never in my ear when not in use, but quick to get in my ear and answer calls.- The antenna is strong, also probably because of the larger electronics in the neck band.five small annoyances:- The neck band is weighted slightly on the right, which always gives a lopsided look.- the rear of the band is too flexible.  I get why they did that, to maximize comfort, but there's a fine balance there, and they err'd on the side of too flimsy, rather than too firm.  Not quite perfect.- The magnets are too weak.  Here again, it's a balance issue.  Too strong would also be annoying, but they could have made it stronger.- Sound quality.  Disagree with just about everyone else here.  The sound quality is just soso.  Good enough, but hardly what I'd call great.  Maybe "good" but even that is a bit of a stretch.  Not complaining, mind you, but not ideal by any means.- durability is a major issue with these.  You might get more than a year's use out of them, but don't expect it.  Be happy with 6 months.All in all though, the good far far outweighs the bad, and these will be my new favorite BT headphones for a some time to come.
title: LG Tone Wireless Bluetooth Stereo Headset - Retail Packaging - Black/Orange
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: This is a great product and they are the best that I have used so far.  I use these for running and biking and when I am working on things around the house.  I went through 2 different bluetooth headphones before I tried these.  The other two headsets would constantly give me static when I was listening to music and that was unacceptable so I took them back.Pro's:Sound Quality - Music, Audio Books and Phone calls all work wellVolume - Easy to hear music even with substantial back ground noiseEase of use - It is very easy to sync this to your phone and control volume or skip a song even while runningComfort - When they are on they are fairly comfortable,Con's:Earbuds fall out when I run - this isn't a huge concern, but they fall out every 4-5 minutes and it gets a little annoying.Construction - While they are still working great and I have no issues yet they seem like they may fall apart because of how thin the wires on the buds are.  I purchased these less than a month ago and they are working well so far. I will keep this updated as to how long they work for me.
