reviewText: This headset is simply amazing. The sound quality is very good. It's obviously not audiophile quality, but that's to be expected. The battery life is phenomenal, and the range is plenty. Pairing with devices is extremely easy and fast.So far I've paired it with the following devices:Samsung Galaxy S3 AT&T; (i747 running CM10 M2): : Calls, music, audio all work through the headset and the headset buttons all work with the phone too. The S3 also supports AptX so this pairing was meant to be!PS3: : The HBS-730 only works as a voice and mic headset with the PS3. So no in-game sound will go through to the headset. Bummer, I know...PS Vita: : I was not expecting this, but all the audio from the Vita is outputted to the headset! In game sound, voice chat, music, everything! I couldn't believe it. I thought it would just be voice chat just like the PS3, but I was pleasantly mistaken!Nexus 7: : Works just like the phone, except for the phone part haha.Desktop using Asus USB Bluetooth Adapter ([...]): : All the sound is outputted through to the headset clearly. Although, when watching a movie, for example, there is a very very small lag between the video and audio which is expected from a wireless set, but it's not enough to affect the viewing experience.Overall, get this headset. Just get it an be happy with wireless freedom. The battery lasts longer than expected, it's form factor/weight makes me forget it's even on my neck, and the sound quality is exceptional!Tip: make sure your Bluetooth device supports A2DP & AVRCP to get the full functionality from the LG Tone+. At least make sure it has A2DP, which enables stereo audio to be transmitted. AVRCP is for the button controls, which is obviously not necessary but very awesome indeed. Most Bluetooth devices will have these profiles, but just make sure. (Likely, BT 2.0 and up)As always, I will update this review if anything comes up. So far so good.

reviewText: Please people, beware of all the fakes.  Google or Youtube "FAKE LG TONE" and You will learn about the differences.After enjoying using an original one, I decided to order 3 more for family & friends.  All 3 were fake, from Amazon seller "Manny's Discount Store".  Returned them.  Ordered 2 more from "Metric Supply" and those were fake as well.  All 5 were white LG Tone Plus (HBS-730) and all had the same serial numbers.  That's a big clue right there.Another is in the visual cues.  Biggest give away of a fake is if You DO NOT hear an audible battery status when You turn the headset on, then You know it is fake.  Put on the earbuds,turn on bluetooth on Your phone/tablet, then turn on the LG Tone and  You should hear in a gentle female voice "Power ON. Battery [low, medium, high].  Connected."If You hear this then  You have an original.  The fakes simply say in non gentle female voice "POWER ON" and nothing else.You should be able to hear an audible battery status.  There are many other differences like the earbuds or the charging port cover which is not painted like the rest of the LG Tone on the fakes but has some near translucent blue rubbery cover.Still looking for a seller that has originals on the Internet.  If anyone can provide a link to a reputable seller that has verified OEM products please leave a comment.  Thanks.PS:  The sellers on Amazon or elsewhere are innocent until proven guilty which is a moot point as there is no means of doing either.  They may or may not be aware of the problem and could be victims of fraudulent products themselves unless they are of impeachable character to begin with.  Don't get Your panties in a bunch.  No judgements.  Just do the right thing and fix/remove the fakes from Your stock/inventory and/or listings.  Peace, Love & Aliens  ; )

reviewText: I had the 700s and loved them.  Saw that the 730 had come out and bought them.  I gave the 700s to my girlfriend who loves them.I use the Samsung S3 and it works just beautifully with both headsets.Sound quality is very good.Use when talking on the phone is very good.I have had no problems with Bluetooth reception unless I get far away from the phone.  I actually can pick up my phone when a couple of walls are between headset and phone.  I believe that I'm getting what is advertised in that area and consider it also very good.I tuck the body under my collar quite nicely and don't mind that it looks kind of funny with the wires sticking out when listening.  The functionality is just too damn good.  Strangers think it looks funny?  Fine.  I am listening to Rush Moving Pictures while cruising through the grocery isle or talking on the phone while happily ignoring them and in my own world.The battery charge is quite adequate and it charges quickly.Also, I've dropped this thing many times and it still works like a champ.My only wish would be that it was more functional during weight lifting.  Anything that has you lying back such as bench press or sit-ups will make the device fall off of your neck and it will be hanging from your ears.  I think that if there was some sort of lanyard that connected the ends it would solve the problem.  My current solution is to tuck them under the collar of my t-shirt but that only works half of the time.  If you job or only use machines you are likely going to be fine.I would recommend these to anyone one.  I would even argue with them to convince them it was the best set of Bluetooth earbuds out there.

reviewText: ***Please note that UPDATE 20 DEC 2013 offers some important new information since the original review.***I own both the 700 and 730 models. I purchased the 700 3 weeks ago and used it extensively. I love the 700. The sound is not stellar, but it isn't totally crappy. The sound lacks depth, like the difference between AM sound and FM sound, though not as extreme. The sound also distorts on the loud end. However, it worked great.The 730 has a few extra features that make it better, like the voice battery status and other messages. The sound is much better. The sound quality now rivals mid-tier phones that would please the average user who likes bass and mostly clear sound. It's full sound, but not audiophile quality. I am no audiophile and do have mild-medium hearing loss. I hate total flat response, anyway, even if it is "pure." I like good clean sound with a little extra nice, tight bass. Compared to my Bose QC15s, this is not too far off. I'd say this is pretty darn good for BT headphones. This would be worth the upgrade hands down if not for one big flaw.The range of this is far inferior to the 700 I own. It drops out sound and makes it choppy after 10 feet. With the 700, I can be 2 stories down, 20 feet away, and choppiness is minimal. Not so with 730. Just turning my back to my phone from 10 feet away and sound drops. Knowing the battery life is a little better on the 730s, it makes me wonder if LG didn't simply reduce the BT radio power for more efficiency? I hope not. I was perfectly fine with the battery life of the 700s. That's just speculation, but the radio performance between the two headsets is huge.What I love about BT headsets is the freedom I have to leave my phone down and do things. With the 700, I had this freedom with OK, but nothing special sound. With the 730, I have great sound with good bass, but can't go more than 5-10 feet without having annoying drops in sound.Which one to send back?***Update 9 OCT 2012***I really love the sound improvement over the 700. I find I am using the 730 all the time and have modified my behavior in order to prevent the dropped sound. One thing to note is that these in ear phones are comfortable, but are so because they don't jam all they way in the ear. There is a little more air that gets in. In the office or at home, no issue, sound and bass is great. While driving in the car, I lose a lot of bass and have to turn it up more and stuff them tighter in the ear. It is still a clearer, more open sound.Based on the few comments left, I will be calling LG to see if my unit is defective.I also want to note that the color difference where the buds attach is much better. The silver color is less obnoxious. I tend to be more conservative in dress and don't like loud colors that scream, "look at me."I do wish the wires were a more flexible as the stiffness causes them to stick out. Thankfully, the wires are very thin and most people won't notice them from a distance.I also wish the magnets were a little stronger. It's easy to knock them out of the holder area.In spite of these other little points, I still think this is the best BT headset I've ever had. The biggest advantage is that they are "there." With my past headsets, once they are out of the ear, I kept losing them all the time. Not so with these. It's also way better for listening to music, way better. I also like that when it's loud, I can put both buds in and actually hear the conversation I am having.***Update NOV 27 2012***I ended up keeping both. I'm using the 730 less and just starting going back to the 700 because of the better range. The big reason for this is because the 730 began dropping out in the middle of a longer phone conversation. This was getting very annoying, especially with my 35 minute each way drive to and from work. I'd have to scramble to turn on the speakerphone. All it took was a shut off and turn back on to make it connect, but this is not good. It does this even being fully charged. I wanted to send back the 730, but with my busy schedule, I unfortunately missed the deadline.With the latest problem, I can't recommend these. Short range for music is one thing - it won't matter in certain situations. Drops during calls is a deal killer for me.I am also finding the magnets to be more of an issue, though more a minor annoyance. I tuck everything in under my collar and fish out the ear buds by pulling on the wire. I'd rather just go to where it is supposed to be seated. This is true of both 700 and 730.***UPDATE 19 FEB 2013***After several more months of use, I almost exclusively use the 700s while the 730 sits collecting dust. Why? The only major advantage the 730s has, with its range issue, is the sound quality. So, if it's just going to be headphones, I'd rather use good headphones. That's what I've done - first with the V-Moda M-100 (which include a mic, a great portable headphone with really good sound) and now the HiFiman HE-500, which gives me awesome premium sound, though no mic and not really portable.I still use the 700's paired to my phone because it is more reliable. Still, it does drop on me, an issue I'm going to blame on my phone, as it has other quirks that lead me to believe that.After reading some comments below, those who were in the same boat as me, until LG offers a fix, or a better model, go with the 700s. If sound is really important to you and you are just going to sit in an office, buy yourself a nice in ear buds or headphones with great sound quality and a built in mic. There are a lot of choices that way.***UPDATE 6 NOV 2013***For those of you who are having issues with the tips, I have found a happy solution. I got the Comply T-400 foam tips and they greatly increase the noise isolation as well as staying in the ear better with activity. The set comes with three sizes and I use all of them with various earphones. They are pretty tight going on, but can be wiggled on with a little muscle.Comply T-400 Isolation Earphone Tips (Black, 3 Pairs, S/M/L)Comply offers white and sets with one size.***UPDATE 20 DEC 2013***I finally retired the Samsung Galaxy Nexus. I now have the Verizon LG G2. I did not choose the phone with BT headsets in mind at all. I mainly choose if for the battery life and Snapdragon 800/Adreno 330 combination. The LG G2 phone does have BT 4.0.I wasn't looking for it, but I dug up the HBS-730, which has been missing for some time, but not missed. I charged it up and gave it a try with the LG G2. Holy smokes! The connection problems are greatly reduced! In fact, I'd say the range is about 85%-90% of the the HBS-700s, which is about twice the range I got with the Galaxy Nexus. The choppiness does not start until I get a respectable distance away, even through a wall. I can put my phone in my back pocket without it cutting out. The range is good enough that I now have some freedom to move about.With the range issues minimized, it's like I just got a new device and am giddy and happy! I can now enjoy the feature improvements that lured me to the 730s in the first place, to include the vastly superior sound quality, and being able to connect to 2 devices (need to power off, hold call button while powering back on to pair to second device) which I really appreciate since I use the Cowan Z2 for my music and audio books. I'm loving that I can go wireless with both devices, and know I can still get my calls while listening to the Cowan.The HBS-730 just took on a whole new life and I can't wait to start using it again!Based on my own experience and from the posts from other users, the HBS-730s seem to be device specific for the best experience. Maybe it's because LG specifically made sure the G2 works well with the 730, but I'm glad that it does, as I love the G2 phone (other than Verizon messing up the buttons on the back.)I will continue to use the 730s for a bit longer and if it holds up, I will change the rating.Thank you all for the great discussion down below!
title: LG Electronics Tone+ HBS-730 Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: A flight attendant recommended these, and after doing some research, decided to try them.  Having previously owned a number of different bluetooth headphones, I was ready for a new pair.  To give some background perspective, I have had jaybirds (stopped working after only 9 months..thankfully had warranty  at Best Buy and got my money back as they are somewhat pricey)..Sony wireless clip with FM radio (they were ok but easily misplaced/came loose as wearing them required they beclipped to clothing and finally I ended up losing them), cheapie/knock off ear tags I purchased off Amazon that have really crappy sound, microphone and battery life.I was looking for comfortable, great sounding headphones fornmy daily commute.  These fit the bill.  The battery life is good so far.  Pairing was unbelievably simple..turned them on...turned on scan on my phone (Note II) and they were paired. Call quality is good..no complaints from callers or inability to converse.  The bluetooth signal isnt easily blocked as was the case with my old jaybirds and the crappy ear tags.  The only disadvantages are 1. These are too bulky for exercise.  They seem too susceptible to getting shorted from sweat as they rest around your neck. 2. Wish they came with a case..I am going to have to find something to put them in so they dont get damaged in my bag or purse.  I will likely keep using the crappy tags to exercise as their limited battery life and sound quality are acceptable trade-offs given their portability and better suited design.  But that is all they are good for...these are now my daily go-to headphones for excellent sound and comfort.

reviewText: Great design! Solid! Beautiful!At first, just when I received the headphones, I was concerned by the quality of the sound: not great with a lot of echo. But after charging the headphones: WOW!!! Amazing sound!!! Bluetooth works great too with my phone (Samsung Note 2 with an Otterbox Commuter case). At least 35 feet on the same floor and even through one closed door, at a different floor and at a distance of 30 feet. I wonder whether people reporting losing the signal have either a phone with a bad bluetooth 'antenna' or maybe an Otterbox defender case or any kind of casing that would mask the bluetooth signal. Or maybe their HBS730 has a defective battery that could explain their bad connection with the phone. In any case, if I have anything bad about these bluetooth headphones or the LG customer service, I will update my review.But so far, highly recommended!!!Update: After 2 weeks of using it: no complain at all. Sound still great. No problem to answer a phone call. The microphone is very sensitive. No interruption in my listening even when walking and with my phone in my back pocket. The best surprise was to be able to connect it to my computer. To switch from my phone to the computer, I just need to turn off the bluetooth on my phone and turn off the LG HBS730 headphones, then turn the headphones on and finally connect them to the computer (the Kinivo company has a great video on their website to explain the bluetooth connection to the computer).So still highly recommended!!!!

reviewText: I have been using bluetooth headsets since they were $250 for a Jabra (circa 2004), and I have to say, this is about the worst one I have owned.  I am using a LG G2 (stock, Kit Kat), and this thing has a range of about 2 feet.  If you turn your head away, the signal is lost.  This same phone works with a Logitech Wireless Speaker Adapter for Bluetooth Audio Devicesin my car and a Photive CYREN Portable Wireless Bluetooth Speaker with a range of easily 30 feet, through walls and other obstructions.  I am shocked that LG would make a device, especially for this price, that performs so poorly.  This is my first Amazon Return Ever, it's that bad.Pro:  When it connects, the transmitted audio quality is good, from what i have been told.Con: The Ear piece audio is not good, especially considering the Ear Bud concept, as opposed to the over-the-ear types, that don't always seal well on your ear.  It's not very ergonomic, the way the ear pieces are setup.  If you put it on and leave it on, ok, but don't plan on it being "portable".  The Power Button is in an odd place, and not convenieve to turn on and off, as opposed to the over-the-ear types, with the big power button on the side.

reviewText: I looked through a lot of reviews before I settled on the LG Tone+ HBS-730. Either the ear buds were way out of my price range or they seemed to be unreliable. Everyone raved about the original Tone Bluetooth headset, but said it sounded tinny. This set caught my eye because a lot of reviewers said they sounded better than the originals. However, there were a lot of complaints about these headphones dropping connection with the device in a front pocket or only a foot or so away. Other people said they had no problems. It was one reviewer who mentioned that it could be an issue with an older protocol on older phones. Because of his review I decided to take a chance and get them, if I didn't like them I could send them back. (I have an LG Nexus 4 phone.)These arrived, a birthday present I picked out, and I synced them to my phone. They synced effortlessly. I simply turned them on and pressed the button on top that flashed blue. Went into my settings and turned on the Bluetooth and had it search for new devices. It found the headphones, I tapped, they paired, done. I turned on some music, sounded great. I would say it has plenty of base and a nice range. I use the poweramp app, so I was able to tune them the way I like my music to sound. Would I say they would compete with 300.00 headphones, no. But they sound really good for the price. I made a couple of phone calls, clarity was great. Everyone I called said it sounded like I was just talking normal on my phone. The only issue I had was a brother who talked to me over a speaker phone, it sounded echoey, but that was on his end. Everyone else sounded great. I fiddled with the settings and volume, everything works great. As to connectivity, on my Nexus 4, I put my phone in my pants pocket and did my normal tasks, sound never lost quality or dropped. Put it in my back pocket, same result. Decided that evening to check how far away I could get before it would dropp. I left my phone on its charger and walked out of my bedroom on one side of the house to my living room on the other side, the sound quality dropped a little when I got to the far end of the living room, as soon as I stopped the sound quality returned to normal and I finished listening to the song. I then walked downstairs to my basement all the way to the other side and the sound quality cut out for a split second and recovered as soon as I stopped walking. I sat at my computer and listened to music for almost an hour with only a few momentarily noticeable drops in quality and or sound. I figured that was a good enough test for me. I would say that the connectivity equals that of the older model as described in many reviews. So why do some of us rave about these headphones and others curse them? I can only assume that the reviewer who mentioned needing a newer phone with an upgraded protocol was right. With my Nexus phone, they are stellar. Only time will if they are durable. My only negative impression is the necleas doo-hickies on my neck. But I knew that going in. Can't fault the product when you are forewarned.
title: LG Electronics Tone+ HBS-730 Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: I've loved my HBS-700, but with this newer 730, I really could not be more disappointed.  After buying one and returning it for being defective (one channel didn't work), I received the new one and charged it and then paired it with my iPhone 5.  Here's the summary (after a week):  First, the sound quality sucks.  Really.  Phone calls sound very, very tinny.  Music sounds flat and unimpressive.  The equalizing function doesn't work, perhaps becasue it is hooked to an iPhone (they mention it won't work if you have "apt-X" on your device, and I have no idea if iPhone does).  Second, the thing cannot/will not stay connected over ANY distance.  Forget across the house!  10 feet and it drops.  Phone in back pocket and it drops.  Almost useless.  And, worse, when it drops, it doesn't automatically reconnect when back in range.I'm returning it and looking for another HBS-700.  Two stars only because it "sort of works".

reviewText: Work fabulously well. Pros: The ear bud fit is excellent.  I have small canals, so this is often an issue for me. Once paired, connecting is nearly instantaneous.  Sound quality is clear and balanced with good bass. Audiophiles need not be overly concerned, but don't be foolish:  It's not an over the ear Bose system, so don't expect it to be.  Controls are simple to learn, and there are very few 'combination' controls, which I love.  Separate controls for all the important functions, unlike the Plantronics model that has recently been released (which I personally despised.)  As long as these are made, I will buy another.  No issues with the buttons, wires, other hardware.Cons: When firmly seated in the ear, phone calls can be painful even with the Bluetooth level turned to the minimum on Samsung phones.  Often I have to loosen the buds to escape the clear, and sometimes painful sound levels.  The Android limitation is the number of available increments you can adjust the volume down.  There are apps in the market that allow for much lower volume.  It's been nearly two years since I purchased these, and they randomly disconnect, or I experience one way audio.  I must unpair and re-pair to alleviate the condition.  Not an issue with a task cleaner (as I don't use them).Summary: The sound with music is excellent, though with occasional (and consistent) pause for buffering (again, this may be an Android issue).  Just wish the performance remained consistent.  I.e.: Connection and sound quality.  Give the shear number of LG products I've had that were a tearful disappointment, these are a solid win for the company.
title: LG Electronics Tone+ HBS-730 Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: Works good for calls and the audio quality is good for music but I did not enjoy using them for running. reviewText: I bought this headset to replace a pair of Bose IE2 Audio Headphones. I really love those headphones, especially the earpiece that fits in the ear. There are three different sizes and you can easily buy replacement earpieces on Amazon. The only problem is the head phones were corded - and I ruined the cord when I was doing heavy yard work.So I tried these headphones. Since it is bluetooth, there isn't a cord. Also, sometimes I have to wear earmuffs when operating loud equipment, so that is a concern. Well, it works just fine with this headset. The cords from the necklace aren't very long and it is not an issue at all when I use this with earmuffs.The bluetooth works well, though I have had some issues. I use this with my Samsung Galaxy Note 2 phone, to listen to audio books and podcasts. If I have the phone in my pocket and turn my head or body to the left, sometimes the signal cuts out a bit. If I have a shirt with a big enough pocket, I can put the phone in the front pocket and I do not have the same issue. But really? From my pants pocket to my neck isn't that far!I have another set of bluetooth headphones that cover the ear, and I have never had problems like that. Also, if I walk away from the phone, I can go about 10 feet and then the signal starts dropping.LG needs to work on the bluetooth issue, even though apparently LG denies it is a problem, but it is a problem for those who need to walk around a room without a phone in their pocket or want to connect to a computer, for example.It does seem to work fairly well with talking on the phone, but it's real sensitive to wind noise. So don't talk on the phone outside!I tried streaming music with it the other day, and I must say, it sounded really good! Listened to some Beatles - I Am the Walrus, Revolver, Jimi Hendrix, Moody Blues, Buck Owens, Mozart, sounded real nice, I was very pleasantly surprised.I am not real wild about the earpieces - they are the kind you actually insert in the ear. After awhile it starts to bother me, and I have to take them out and put them back in again. Also, wind does make a noise with these headphones, even when just listening to music or audiobooks and not talking on the phone. It's the design of the earpiece.Overall, I am very happy with this purchase because it allows me to do yard work and other outdoor activities while listening to books, and I don't have to worry about cords. Now, if LG would just adopt the Bose-type earpieces that I described and fix the bluetooth issue, then this device would get 5 stars!!
title: LG Electronics Tone+ HBS-730 Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: I saw a friend using this product and based on the demonstration he gave me, I had to buy one and I do not regret it.  The issues I am about to describe are indicative of being unfamiliar with the product and not as a negative regarding the construction or use of the device.  Getting used to the feel of it on your neck, using the magnetic ear buds effectively while driving or riding your bike is challenging ....however, once you master these things, this is a great product if you use your phone as an MP3 player, for movies, and if you use your phone a lot during the operation of your car, bicycle or motorcycle.  The ear buds are small enough to fit inside the recesses of most helmets (mines a scorpion), and its great to listen to music with (just don't forget to adjust your phones independent volume setting for music-when I was thinking about writing this review, volume was my complaint when listening to music, but another user told me the newer phones are like computers, individual volume levels for music etc.).  Reception is good, music and calls, a little bit of distortion in the higher ranges of volume, but otherwise great!  I love it.

reviewText: Love/hate with this product.For all the positives it has, I ended up returning it because of its' construction.Pros:- great connectivity, battery life and comfort.  The earbuds fit well and the sound is very clear.  It also holds a charge through a solid 5 hours a day.  I would charge it at the end of every day, so not sure how much longer it would last if I kept using it.Cons:- Although it is very comfortable and easy to wear during active runs and gym sessions, it just feels flimsy to me.The little earbuds are supposed to be held onto the neckband with little magnets.  These magnets are far too weak and barely hold them in when they are stationary.  They are also not the easiest to fit in place while the neckband is still around your neck.If you do manage to fit them in, the slightest head movement causes them to fall out.This is not only frustrating, but with them just dangling there, they easily got caught on my jacket, shoulder strap of my purse and scarf.It was an accident waiting to happen and I just knew they'd get torn off one day soon.Another concern was how they'd hold up being toted around in bag.  If you don't want to walk around with them hanging around your neck, there's really no easy way to transport them.  I'd wear them on the train to listen to music, but didn't want to leave them on once I got to work.  I'd put them in my bag, but then had to wrestle with a tangle when I retrieved them.Overall very disappointed because although user unfriendly, the sound and comfort of these were great.  If you're just going to be using them at home and not taking them with you, they will suffice.  A bit pricey for being limited like that though.  That's why I ultimately returned them.
title: LG Electronics Tone+ HBS-730 Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: I originally rated this 4 stars, then edited it to 2 stars, and now I'm editing once again to 3 stars.This product can CONDITIONALLY provide good sound quality and connection range. There is a trick to it. It is very annoying, but the trick is to un-pair then repair the headset EVERY time you want optimal quality. If you don't do this trick, it will still work, but it will sound terrible and the signal will become unstable. For this reason, I've written 2 versions of reviews with either "Default only" or "Tricked out only" to represent performance when the trick is done.Default AND Tricked out Pros:---Comfortable. You can't tell from the picture, but the band that rests on your neck is actually very soft.---Great battery life.Tricked out only Pros:---great sound quality---good connection rangeDefault AND Tricked out Cons:---Inadequate volume control on the headset itself. As other reviews have mentioned, the volume is loud even when set to the lowest volume on the headset. In order to avoid going deaf, you will need to adjust the signal directly on the source device the headset is streaming.---LG SMS reader software doesn't consistently work. Even the most advanced Android phone to my knowledge, Samsung Galaxy Note 2, considers the LG SMS reader buggy and it will interfere with your other text-to-speech/speech-to-text apps like Google Voice, Skype, Swiftkey Swype.Default only Cons:---Connection is frequently dropped once signal becomes medium. This alone renders the product unusable.---Sound quality becomes high pitched and metallic once the battery hits medium.Bottom line: This product has an annoying procedure to make it work properly, but it's still the best available in its class. I almost returned this as garbage before discovering a workaround to make it perform correctly. If you don't mind daily pairing and un-pairing, then get this. Otherwise, avoid this.
title: LG Electronics Tone+ HBS-730 Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: I bought these and the Tone 700 to try them out.  The 730's definitely had better sound quality while the 700's sounded flat.  Two things the 700 had over the 730 are the bluetooth connectivity and the next song feature.  With no object obstruction, i can distance out 10 ft before the connection drops; 700 i can go 10+ ft and in another room with no issues.  On the 730, when going to the next song or fast forward to the next song, the first 3-5 secs are skipped.  Sometimes I won't hear anything so i have to rewind and forward again just to get it to play.  For the 700's, no issue at all.Overall, if you're looking for sound quality, then go with the 730.  I'm a headphone fiend and always looking for sound quality so i decided to stick with the 730 (returned the 700) and just deal with the issues described.  Two months later, i'm regretting keeping the 730 and just using my wired headphones until i buy me some sol republics.

reviewText: So far after a week this is by far the best yet. I use a Jawbone era for low key day to day phone calling and podcasting. It is great because it is small and doesnt have an annoying flashing light. I use a usb lanyard to keep it concealed under my shirt and use it as needed. For my nightly TV viewing where I like to use a stereo headset so I dont wake other family members I was using a jabra clipper and apple earbuds. I evaluated the jabra street 2 but went with the clipper because both had relatively poor battery life and you could keep the clipper plugged in and still use it whereas the street 2 would not work when plugged in.This LG set is so much better because instead of having a dongle to drag around or clip to your neck with long cords for the earbuds these go right around your neck with no excess cording or unbalanced weight.  I cant even tell I am wearing it... I am about 18 ft away from the TV and the clipper often broke connection causing the audio to go out of sync from video especially if a body part or anything moved in front. No issue like that with these. Also much louder and better fidelity.I also have Moto S10-HD headset and they are no comparison, besides being extremely uncomfortable after only a few minutes of use the buttons are hard to locate and actuate.

reviewText: Bought these and was VERY skeptical even with the amount of rave reviews.I use them with my iPad and iPhone 4S and the only thing that I have found to be faulty is if you are a big EDM fan or listen to stuff with heavy bass you might not like these because they don't really hold up and it sounds distorted, it's not as bad if you turn it down a little.The ear buds fit weird, and have fallen out a few times but I wore them at work for 12 hours listening to pandora (and still have battery...had to charge my phone twice) and I was looking under things and moving around a lot, walking around I don't seem to really have that problem. I am looking into getting new rubber end pieces because I don't really like how they fit and I think it would help to keep them in more if they weren't that bubble shape.The horse collar is not obstructive and I often find that I forget it is there, and when I do I'm like "what the... oh yeah forgot about that".People complain about range but I have not had that problem considering the range for an unobstructed bluetooth signal is 30ft, now add the obstructions that we all have in our daily life (walls, furniture, floors, other wireless signals) it can cut the range down and the range I get with this is no different than the other bluetooth devices that I own now.So before blaming the device think a little about your own personal amount of interference...just some advice for all bluetooth devices :-)

reviewText: I purchased these for walking/jogging the beach and working out.PROS:  Lightweight, wireless, sweatproof, easy to connect and use, great sound,  comfortable and also has a great range( placed phone in within 30 feet while working out and had no issues).Sounds good so far? Well, I am planning on returning because of my con and really only complaint.CON:  The device falls off every time I lay on my back while working out.  I forget its there and go to do a bench press or something inclined and it slips right off my neck onto the gym floor.  Would have been better if it somehow connected around your neck to hold it in place and prevent slipping off while lying back.CONCLUSION:  The LG Tone Plus is a great sounding, comfortable headset for jogging/walking or some lighter workouts.  Features are nice and wireless capability is great.  I love the fact that it sits around your neck and you can put in one earbud and still hear what's going on around you or put both buds in and  drown out your surroundings.  Calls work good and range is great.****My one and only gripe and dealbeaker for me is the fact it slips right off my neck everytime I lay back in the gym to do bench presses, etc...Going to pay a double and get the Motorola S-11 flex hd and hopefully these will stay on.  I hope this helps you!

reviewText: I got a new Galaxy Note II for a work phone and knew there was no way I was holding that massive thing to my ear all day or while driving so I started to research different bluetooth options.  I decided to get this one over the previous model because people said the sound quality is better.  I was concerned however about the comments regarding the lack of range.  Most of the time I have my phone on my desk, on the passenger seat or in my suit jacket inside pocket so it's always nearbye.  No problems at all that way.  When I've been at a branch and wore it to the bathroom about 60 feet away it still would buzz when someone called although I didn't ettempt to answer it.  In my home, which is 4,400 square feet (just to give a picture of potential distance) I left my phone in my office which is on the main floor in the middle of the house - while listening to music.  When I was at an extreme end of the house upstairs or in the basement I did experience poor connections and started to lose the music, although that is to be expected.  I love the fact that I can put in one or both earpieces and listen to music and then accept an incoming call when needed.  Good sound quality for both the "speakers" and the mic.  For the price I don't think you can find anything this good.

reviewText: I referee youth basketball and after seeing one of the coaches wearing one of these things; I asked what it was and how did he liked it.  He LOVED it, so I decided to give it a try.  I ordered one from Amazon on 2/13/13.  I started using it and it was the best thing ever!  I drive a convertible and I could never have a conversation with the top down (even with the manufacturer's built in Bluetooth system).  My LG HBS-730 fixed that.  I've had not one single complaint of background noise since I've been using it.  One of the main reasons for me buying it is because all of my music is on my phone.  The sound quality is great!  The only problems I encountered is that the ear plugs would slide out from time to time (even after adjusting the sizes).  Other than that, the product works great!  It pairs easily, it works as advertised.Nevertheless; I noticed this morning, less than 2 months after having it that one of the wires that connects the ear piece is frayed, exposing the metalic wire at the point where it connects to the unit. This is from normal use.  So I checked Amazon for their return policy and it states that I'm eligible for a "partial" refund, and I will have to pay all shipping charges.  Not being happy with that; I called LG directly (800-243-0000) and spoke to Fernando (nice guy), and he informed me that their warranty doesn't cover damage due to "normal use" even if it's less than 2 months old.  I paid a pretty penny for this thing, so that was discouraging news.  At this point my only choice is to send it back to Amazon and look for a product that is more durable and better supported by the manufacturer.I would still recommend this product, if you're willing to accept the risk that if it gets damage (and it is a little fragile); you may be up the creek with one paddle.  I hope this helps someone.
title: LG Electronics Tone+ HBS-730 Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: I have both this headset and the much cheaper Kinivo BTH220 Bluetooth Stereo Headphone and I must say that this one is the better set. Costing almost twice as much though, this is more than expected.A quick review:Comfort: Excellent. The main portion of the set has a nice weight and rests around the neck nicely, does not get in the way, does not fall off easily and the controls are pretty intuitive after  wearing it a while. The ear buds are likewise comfortable. You can turn your head every which way and you will not run out of cord.Audio: Great. Both the call and music audio sounds great. More rich than the Kinivo headset I have. Of course it is still no $300 studio headset, but it is still very nice.Build Quality: Excellent. This thing feels like it is made to be comfortable in every way and does not feel flimsy or cheap.Conclusion: If you would like a nice, quality headset with good audio quality and you can afford to pay a bit extra for it, this is the one to get. The Kinivo set is nice enough, but this set is just better. You do get what you pay for.

reviewText: Nice headset. Only thing holding it back from 5 stars is the fact that the earbuds and their cords seem very fragile. reviewText: I know it's hard, if not impossible to build sweat/workout proof Bluetooth headset. This unit works great, except in just under four months of use in workouts 3-4 days per week, the forward/back button stopped working. I sent it in to LG and in two weeks had a refurbished unit shipped back to me. My problem is that LG should cross ship these on a credit card so I'm not forced to go without for two out of the 14 weeks I've owned the device. Motorola would do that for me when they replaced my Moto Rokr four times in the first year. The fifth time I gave it up, even though I loved Moto support, the device was clearly not ready for workouts.Samsung advertises this unit for workouts. The button issue aside, the yoke design is not great for doing sit-ups, as the unit will slip off your neck and yank the earbuds from your ears as you sit up. To get around that, I've taken to a mummy pose while doing sit-ups - holding the unit in place with my crossed hands.I'll let you know by updating this comment if the replacement unit fails.

reviewText: I had been using the Motorola S9 wireless/bluetooth headset for listening to music while working out, and taking calls, I loved the fact that there were no wires hanging to obstruct my movement...however, the headset was TOTALLY uncomfortable. I soon found that the purpose for which I had purchased them was over shadowed by the effort it took to keep them on my head.The LG Tone Bluetooth Headset is absolutely stellar at providing awesome sound, convenience and good call quality, all while working our. The unit is so lightweight and comfortable that I forget that I have it on. I have small ear sockets and have always had difficulty finding a comfortable headset (wireless or other) that would fit comfortable and that would stay in my ear. The LG Tone HBS-730 fits perfectly!Though I ABSOLUTELY LOVE IT, and highly recommend it, there are a few Cons, below I have listed both the pros and the cons at a glance:Pros:~Good sound quality~Comfortable~Lightweight~Good call quality~Easy to pair and use~Conveniently places controls~Aesthetically pleasing~Two colors to choose from (Black/White)~Perfect for the car~100% Noise canceling~Earbuds conveniently snap into unit via magnetCons:~Will sometimes loses connection during a call~Does not come w/a car charger~Earbuds some time come off of the magnet when hanging

reviewText: These headphones work wonderfully with my cellphone (and the phone's included Beats audio), my laptop and my TV. The battery life is excellent. The telephone function works well. Sometimes the bluetooth signal is weak.  If I put my cellphone in any pocket of my jeans, for example, the signal deteriorates when I walk, or if face away from the transmitting device the signal gets very weak. But overall I love using the headphones.  Finding the correct earbud size is critical.  None of the included earbud tips fit my ears very well so I used a pair from another device and I was stunned with the improved sound quality. With the correct earbuds the sound quality is incredible. The included earbuds have smaller openings than the pair I eventually settled on and they seemed to have restricted the sound. Like other commenters, I have used these with a motorcycle helmet to listen to music and GPS directions with great results. They work well in the gym with an armband holder for my cellphone.

reviewText: I have a good friend from NYC who pays $100 for a haircut .... the guys would always joke him that he has a "hundred-dollar haircut on a ten cent head" :)  It's a great analogy for this headset... the design and technology are very cool and functional, it is well thought out. However, the 10 cent earbuds result in poor sound quality IMO. I would have glady paid $20-$30 more for this headset with an earbud upgrade. I bought these primarily for audiobooks and podcast on my minipad and they are fine for my needs but for music (in several genres) the sound quality lacks. There does not seem to be any mid-range.... it's either too much bass or too much treble. There are 3 preset EQ settings (bass boost, treble boost and normal) but all leave me unsatisfied when listening to music (compared to say my small pair of Beats earbuds).I've read reviews that the Bluetooth range is only a few feet but I can go 25-30 feet before the signal is lost (average+ BT range)  and the signal reconnects at around 20-25 feet. I have not used it for calls yet but have used it to check voicemail and I'm less than impressed with the clarity vs. a Jawbone Era/Icon and Plantronics Legend.Overall .... for the reason I purchased, I like it and I'm happy... but it may leave you unimpressed if you're a true audiophile.

reviewText: Let me say up front that my hearing is not the best at 68 but I can discern clean clear sharp audio from muffled audio and love the sound! This review is more about the general design of the HBS-730.I have been a fan of Bluetooth technology ever since Ericsson (a former employer) started putting it into their phones (pre Sony-Ericsson). I love the wireless convenience but was never quite ecstatic about its implementation until now! LG has obviously thought through the design of this device carefully and has applied good engineering where it counts--functionality--and good design where it counts--comfort and convenience.At the gym, this is the first BT hearing device that is NEVER in the way, remains in place so the buds don't fall out, provides easy to access controls that work, receives and processes interruptions to my music or audio book listening (interruptions like incoming phone calls and self-imposed outgoing phone calls) without a problem, and this device so easily deals with issues of pairing.Not only that but this device provides audible queues informing the wearer (with at least one ear bud inserted in the ear) the state of the device power switch, the state of the device battery, and the state of the device pairing.This headset is hands-down the best BT headphone device I have used, and I have invested hundreds into these things over the years since the introduction of Bluetooth in phones and headphones. One more plus... the magnetic docking of the buds into the wrap-around neck piece is ingenious and the buds almost always stay secured to their base when secured in this way.  I gladly give this Bluetooth headphone my best rating.

reviewText: I love the freedom of wire-free ear buds. Short of buying the full headphones, and after owning a few cheap pairs of bluetooth ear buds, I finally bought this and I couldn't be happier! At first I was weary of having to "wear" the band around my neck, but that is a small compromise for the sound quality and comfort these give! I am not an audio expert, but I do like my music to sound crisp, clear, and strong in bass, and I have spent money on Bose, Senheiser, Skullcandy, Plantronics...in pursuit of the ideal.Battery life: with average of 3 hours use per day, 5 days a week, They last 4-5 days before needing to be charged again.Pairing: Easy! Turn on headset, your device detects, press "connect". Pairs in 5 seconds.Comfort: Very comfortable, although they bounce up and down on my collarbone when I run, but no big deal. The silicone tips on these are the only ones that stay in my ear, without having to switch them out for the Comply Foam ones. You do have to really push them in in order to get a good seal.Construction: The wire around the neck does seem flimsy, but I am being careful with them and give them a good wipe after sweating, because I want them to last.

reviewText: I had the HBS-730 in black and loved it, unfortunately it fell off me when I was thrown in an accident and since I was in full adrenaline panic mode at the time I didn't notice they were not on me until I got home.So I bought this in white only because the white was $10 cheaper, I don't care $10 worth about the color though I prefer black if all things are equal.Now I wish I'd gone with the black but I wore these for a week before I realized it and had thrown out the packaging already. I'll keep them, I'll use them, and I'd probably even love them if I hadn't had the the other set before, here is why:- This is stupid perhaps but this headset uses a different voice than my last one, sounds like just some random lady at the office that they recorded, I don't like her voice where before I'd really not noticed.- When the headset is low on batteries it gives you a warning, waits a while and then warns you again. My old one did this too but infrequently enough that I could keep listening to my music for a while. Important sometimes for that last 2 stops on the train or the last 5 minutes of my run! Give me the warning well ahead of time so I know to charge it but give me time to actually listen. This new one? Once the voice says the battery is low there is no point to continuing to listen because she interrupts the music/phone every 5 seconds to tell me the battery is low. I wonder how much battery time is wasted with that but it is so annoying that I just turn the damn thing off.- The bluetooth signal is just a bit weaker. Sometimes I lose signal when my phone is in my purse as my purse swings around behind me, one of the things I loved about the 730 before was that it was the first stereo headset I'd found that reliably maintained the signal through my body (I'm a totally average sized woman), this is still better than the others I'd tried just not perfect.I don't know if this is a difference between white and black versions/batches or if the quality in this model went downhill or what but there is definitely a difference. I suppose compared against other stereo headsets I'd tried I'd still give it 5 stars but compared against the other of the same model: 4 stars
title: LG Electronics Tone+ HBS-730 Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: This is the best bluetooth headset ever!  I have bought a couple for myself and family and several friends have followed suit.  My 2-3 year old model with the orange tips is still working perfect, but this newer black one with silver tips has some great enhancements.  Instead of an ascending tri-tone for power on and a descending tri-tone for power off, it now speaks to you with a Siri-like female voice.  She also tells you when you are paired, connected, disconnected, etc.  This is a neat upgrade from the tones.This thing works awesome and is almost as good as high quality headphones for music.  Mine has taken quite a beating running and biking, and has been wet and muddy many times.  It still works perfect and battery life is still great.  I can say that I am careful with batteries though.  I plug mine in overnight every night and use it much of the day every day.FYI, it is not as good as a Jawbone or BlueParrot for phone only use, not quite as loud or clear, but for a do it all device it can't be beat.  I usually use one earbud when talking or listening to podcasts/voice and pop the second one in for music.  As long as the left tip of the neck band is exposed and your environment is relatively quiet it makes a great bluetooth for calls.
title: LG Electronics Tone+ HBS-730 Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: I bought this version because I wanted sound quality over range as I always have my phone on me. I forgot my phone on a machine at the gym and was walking around not cutting out for a while. I would say the range is 60 feet not 30 like I've heard. Maybe the newer versions were revised or people are over exaggerating. I just wanted to get away from getting tangled in wires when I'm working out, I didn't even think about how much use I would get out of the phone calls too. Everything sounds clear and people hear me fine too. The magnets keep the earbuds in for the most part but they could come out sometimes...who really cares about that though?  They're so light I forget I have them on sometimes. This is what I was looking for.
title: LG Electronics Tone+ HBS-730 Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: I did not buy mine from amazon but wanted to review this for those one the fence about buying it. I put of purchasing this because of the price initially, and have purchased about 4 in ear blue tooth at $35 to 45 a pop, as i was about to buy a fifth one( for a grand total of $175) after loosing my last one, I decided to go to verizon  and with my discount got it for $55, and I have no regrets,m in fact purchased my daughter one too. Pro's: large enough to not loose, good sound quality for music,  charges from completely dead to full in about an hour, charge lasts up the 4 days with regular use and the gym, so lightweight its barely noticeable when its one, and it fits under my motorcycle helmet so I can listen to music. Con's: wish it were voice activated, i'm scared it will fly off my neck when warmer riding weather comes and im not wearing a hoody when i ride, wish the magnet were just a wee bit stronger to keep the earplugs connected. As you can see those are pretty minor cons so go ahead and add it to your cart

reviewText: These headphones actually sound pretty good for a reasonable priced Bluetooth set. Decent bass ( although not great) and good clear mid and high range. For those who are skeptical about sound quality for music (audiophiles not included), these sound just as good or better than a decent pair of wired headphones. Call quality is good too, although it somehow feels different talking while wearing both earphones. Great noise reduction as well.It took me some time to get used to wearing the thing around my neck, but I like how all the buttons are easily accessible. Alright for walking and moving around, but they don't seem to be stable enough for heavy running or movement.One of the best things is battery life. I listen to music for 9 to 10 hours a day at work and they haven't died once. The best battery life I've had yet for a Bluetooth set. Overall very happy with my purchase. Time will tell how long they last as I tend to eat through headphones with my heavy use.Update.After using these several months,  I still love em.  However as others have noted, the bluetooth connectivity is weak.  You can't be very far away from phone before it starts to break up.  It also seems to stutter here and there when the phone is in range.  Not enough to make it an issue with me,  but could affect people who are talking alot.
title: LG Electronics Tone+ HBS-730 Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: This is my first set of bluetooth headphones, and I am pleased with the performance. The few things that I dislike about the headset is that it doesn't seem to play nice with windows 7. It either sounds tinny when you have it set as a microphone, or you get the sound needed and the mic doesn't seem to work. Also it likes to disconnect after about 5 min all the time, even when listening to music through the computer.The battery life is impressive, I have been using it off and on for 2 days now and still haven't even gotten a low battery warning.I like having the buttons on the headset to control music and answer calls. However lately I have been having troubles getting the play button to work. Not sure if its the phone or the headset. The call quality is pretty good but there doesn't seem to be much noise canceling so when talking to people, they sometimes complain about the background noise.The sound isn't as rich as some of the wired earbuds that I have used in the same price range, but that could be from the connection and not so much the headphones themselves, but it's all the same considering that's the only connection type.Overall I would buy these again. For the price and and functionality I really don't see how these can be beat at this time.

reviewText: Which can be a good thing, depending on your needs. If you just wear this around home and the office to take phone calls and listen to Coldplay's Viva la Vida while sipping on a venti caramel mocchiato, with no serious physical activity in your near future, then this may be a five star product.Alas, I've noticed at least one design problem that stops this product from being truly great. What stops this bluetooth headset from standing amongst the titans and dining with the gods are those little plastic clips that hold the earbud wires. They're relatively fragile, and break with vigorous action on the part of the user. So when you're dancing to and fro with purpose and vigor, you may find that the source of your musical motivation may go splat.When the plastic clips break, the wires directly stress the point where they enter the device, and quickly stop working. Be wary of this flaw if you are active. Does not stay on very well without assistance in high winds. Great sound quality. Good controls.
title: LG Electronics Tone+ HBS-730 Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: I've used this daily for about 4 months, so it's time for a review.Let's start with what I like about it, unfortunately this will be a short list.  The noise cancelling is very good, no problems with background while on the phone.  The sound quality is good for voice and reasonable for music.  And comfort, I have the neck of a defensive lineman and its still comfortable enough that I would forget that it was there.  Battery life also is good, you can wear it all day connected to your phone with no problems.In short, out of the gate, it works as advertised.  So where does it start to come up short?First thing you're going to notice is the buds are going to go exploring down your chest very regularly, especially if you're wearing a collared shirt.  The magnets just aren't very strong.  Second is the wire management.  It has a long wire on each bud, a giraffe could almost wear one of these.  But these are unruly to keep up with.  They have a teeny easy to lose clip to try to manage this excess wire which is quite ineffective and easy to lose.The real problem with the wires is they are thin and cheap.  After 4 months, mine are showing breaks at the connection points on both ends, and I assure you I'm a gentle user.  I only use them at the office, no jogging or anything that might account for this.And then there's the cover over the micro usb charging port....if you keep short fingernails, you're going to hate this thing.  Once you finally get it open it feels like it's going to snap off at any second.Overall, this works, but it feels cheap cheap cheap, and was starting to look bad to me after only 4 months.
title: LG Electronics Tone+ HBS-730 Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: Own it for 2 days now.Was a little bit scared by all the negative feedback regarding its range. But turned out to be not so bad, have absolutely no problem listening to podcasts across entire flat, no sound glitches at all (1 bedroom appartment).Problems began to show up when I went out in the street. Phone in the back jeans pocket, music started to get choppy right when I left the building. But placing phone in the front jeans pocket solved everything. So I guess, human body+environment interruptions are doing their evil job.However, this headset entirely works for me. Its not aproblem to place my phone in the pocket that is closer to the phone whilI'm on the go, and I have absolutely no problems with range at home. No problems in noisy environment of NY subway.I wish, however, LG made a way to fine-tune BT settings on this device, many people (including myself) would gladly give up some battery live in favor of stronger BT transmitter function. I would also pay more for a "rugged" version of this headset, because I entirely LOVE the form factor, and do not like the flimsiness of cords. Maybe spare parts and ability to connect-disconnect headphones from unit will make this a killer product on the market.More color options would also be desirable because I'm going to get another pair for my son.
title: LG Electronics Tone+ HBS-730 Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: I purchased these as a replacement for the LG HBS-700, the previous model.  I loved that set and used it pretty much every day until somehow misplacing them after about a year.  I had read previous reviews for this product and was concerned about the range issues many people reported.  I figured I would take a chance, and exchange it for the older model if I had a problem.I am happy to report that so far, I have had no connection issues with the 730 and my LG Nexus 4.  I am able to walk approximately 20 feet away from my phone, with a wall in between, and still have a solid connection.  This is similar to the performance of the HBS-700, and is definitely enough for my needs.  I am not sure if they have been tweaking the components in these to address connection problems, or if it just happens to certain phones.  In any case, the LG Nexus 4 seems to work well with this set.Sound quality does seem to be slightly better than the previous model, but I unfortunately do not have the 700's around to compare.  Bass seems fuller.  A lot of my listening is podcasts, but when I switch over to music I have no complaints regarding sound.  They won't blow you away if you have listened to high end cans in the past, but for the freedom of wireless and the low price, they are more than adequate.I've only had these for two days so far, but so far, so good.  I'll update the review if connection/range becomes an issue in the future.

reviewText: These are nice earbuds and fit snugly in my ears. They come with different rubber tips so you can replace the stock tips if they're not the right size. reviewText: I'm entirely unimpressed by this device. I don't know, maybe it's me.First off, this seems like it might be a knock off device, not the one pictured. As someone else mentioned, the on/off switch is reversed, there are silver bands on the earbuds which aren't on the promo images. But maybe there are slight variations based on the assembly from different plants. The other reviewer also mentioned there was no LG logo on his device. I didn't see one either, but there was a small sticker where the logo should have been with the words "TEAR INVALID" on it. Underneath that sticker was the LG logo. Very odd. Seems almost like a non-english speaker attempting to prevent me from removing the sticker, that it may invalidate the warranty? Just guessing here.At first I had tremendous trouble pairing the device with my Samsung Galaxy S3. The instructions (which don't appear all that professional) say to turn the power on, and the blue LED will light solid. Of course they don't tell you where the blue LED is. I can't find one anywhere. The only thing that lights up is the red ring around the "call" button when I plug in the charger cord. So I tried the manual pairing method. That seemed to work (though no blue light appeared anywhere), I got it to play some music. But the sound was pretty bad. Muffled, not much treble, as compared to my wired earbuds I got with my Galaxy. But when I turned the power off, and back on, it didn't reconnect with my phone. Even the manual pairing method wouldn't work after that.So I figured maybe the battery was low, there doesn't seem to be any way to tell. I let it charge for about 15 mins, then powered it on. The red ring around the call button began to flicker and the headset vibrated a couple times, and it connected to my phone. I got it to play some more music again, but the sound was no better.So my plan is to give it a good charge overnight, and see if it acts any better. Though if the sound remains as bad as it is, I'll be sending it back, and requesting a non-knock-off version.

reviewText: I have a 700 and a 730.  I tend to listen to audio books when my attention isn't on something else.  I use e audible.com app which works fine.  Or did until I got my 730.  Now on some books, words will cut out, especially at the beginning of sentences.  I thought the audio book was simply made with too wide a frequency range for Bluetooth, but then I went back to my 700 and it works perfectly on the same book.I like the audio responses of the 730, and I need two headsets as when one runs out of battery, I pull the other off the charger and put the low one in charge.  Alternating two is great, and these are super comfortable.But I don't know if the problem is a buggy 730 or is simply the way the 730 works.  I've had it for over a month and long since discarded the packaging, so can't return it, but will contact lg about it and post here what happens.  And I guess I'm going to order a second 700 so I can keep using them the way I want.I don't know if this cutting off the beginning of sentences is unique to audio books or for any sounds/music.  I normally have my iphone within 10 feet of me, so I don't have any problems caused by range.I've already worn out two 700s (guess I'm a bit rough on tossing them in my purse and apparently break a wire to one of the earbuds), but like them so much I keep replacing them with another set,  and I'm keeping a ziplock bag in my purse so I have a protected place to put in if I take it off (grin).  In fact, I love it so much that several others in my family are now wearing them too thanks to my recommendations.
title: LG Electronics Tone+ HBS-730 Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: I've tried so many bluetooth ear piece. They're either not working very well or I still got complain about background noise. Then I opt out for a bluetooth headset for phone call and music. I look up Sony and Jabra clip on bluetooth. Both of them require you to plug in a headphone in order to use it. Good thing is, they're compact, somehow long reception range. However, I found that when you clip on those bluetooth on your shirt, those headphone wire will be too long. Makes it kinda bulky and lost the purpose of wireless (Might just well plug the headphone into my phone).This LG here, completely serve the "WIRELESS" purpose. I don't have to worry about the bulky wire got stuck with something. The music/sound quality is very good for a wireless headset. It comes with 3 size ear plug to fit your ear so you won't distort by outside noise. For phone calls, my friend said my voice change a little but I never ever got complain about my background noise again. My wife even said she thought I was indoor with talking with me. The buttons are plain and simple and easy to use, no multi-function key to mess with.The only cons is the reception range. It's very short and easily distorted by objects in the pairing path. I use it with my S3 to play music and it'll break up very easy (phone in back pocket). However, when I use it with my Note 3 it didn't happen again. Maybe the Note 3 has more power Bluetooth 4.0 while S3 is only 3.0. Overall, for the money, function and quality, I'll still recommend this headset over Sony or Jabra.

reviewText: I have owned a number of Bluetooth headphones over the years, but none for about 5 years due to: (a) the fact that I always ended up losing them, and (b) the audio (sent and received) was always relatively poor.On a whim, I purchased these (HBS-730), and I love them. I realize that others have said the range is bad, but my phone is apparently always close enough to me that it isn't an issue. I've had no dropped audio whatsoever.For the price - under $50 - you can't go wrong as long as you're OK with the basic premise of the design. These wrap around your neck (or, for me, go under the collar of my shirt). For some, that might be uncomfortable. I don't notice that I'm wearing them.I love the fact that I can wear either of the earpieces (or both of them, of course) without affecting the microphone, which is located on the left end of the main body. Since one of my uses for these is talking while driving, and since I can't legally drive with both ears plugged, the design allows me to use either ear (and to switch ears) without the listener being affected. Audio is easily loud enough for calls with one earpiece in, and especially good with them both in (when at home, for example).I also am quite happy that these use a micro USB port for charging (as do most of my devices) and also came with a charger (which is worth something in and of itself). No extra proprietary cords when traveling are needed, and I've got another charger I can use with any USB charging cable (I don't think it's extraordinarily powerful, but it'll slowly charge just about anything).The audio when listening to music is stellar. Not audiophile-grade, mind you, but *vastly* better than I was expecting from something in this price range that included the Bluetooth circuitry, a charger, a cable, and so on. Most plain headphones at this price don't sound as good, and few sound much better.Finally, one of the potential drawbacks - the size - is, to me, a benefit. I'm far less likely to lose these.Are there nits to pick? Sure, but nothing significant, and none that take away from my rating for these in their price range.
title: LG Electronics Tone+ HBS-730 Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: I had the lg700 over a year but lost them.My wife got me these to replace them.They are even better.They have great reception.Bass boost, treble boost or natural setting.The noise reduction is much better than the lg700.The battery life is between 8 and 10 hours depending on volume and bass.Full charge takes about 3 hours from empty.You get better battery life after the first couple charges.you can answer call with any bluetooth.But if you have bluetooth 3.0 or higher it will read you texts and you can answer text through them.you can do what ever your phone will let you do through voice command with them.The range (not through walls) is about 100 ft.In house it will work through out my 3200 sqft home no prob even outside to mailbox.If you go out of range it pauses your music and reconnects and un pauses.you can fast foward and rewing  also.

reviewText: Best headset on the market I had the J Birds freedom, Dr Dre Beats, Sony , Motorola , Bose ,  Platronics , These are the best sounding headset on the market nice tight crisp bass not muddy , Tones are rich detailed and precise and accurate using high quality mp3 not cheap junky hacked ones ..Make sure you match the earpieces with your ear and place them tightly into your ear canal.. All the other headsets were way more expensive than these and had way less features and not to mention were more buggy with the blue tooth connections..These were a secret until the word gets out ..Let me touch on the J birds they sounded almost as good as the LG 730 not quite + all the ear combinations on the J birds became uncomfortable after wearing for an hour or so , and the J bird noise cancellation doesn't work and everyone said I sounded like I was underwater when talking on them .  I don't want to get into why every other brand was inferior I will highlight why the LG's  are the best and what phone I have the Samsung Galaxy 3..  The LG 730 Tone + blue tooth connectivity between phone and headset always connects and never interfers when I go to my vehicle Bluetooth .  Sound quality the best even better than my 300 dollar PC headset .  The unit has volume controls so you dont have to touch your phone to even change songs or start playing them or answer calls. The headset informs you of battery life none of the above did that or had an indicator.. The battery goes all day I have to change my phone battery after 7 hours of listening to music on the LG .I put in a new spare phone battery I keep in my wallet the LG says it has a  half charge by then outstanding battery life .  The LG vibrates to let you know when you have a call .  The noise cancellation I drive a tin can of a truck at work I have never found a headset that someone could hear me when driving until Now ... The amazing part they can only hear me not the truck or the diesel engine and the pot holes and bumps that are shaking my teeth out of my head..  I get asked if I am on my regular phone when talking no one knows I am working .  So until now I can't tell you how long I have been looking for a headset like this and does such a good job LG please make more of these in the future... The price is also the best I listen to music for at least 10 hours I cant feel the unit around my neck only the earbuds

reviewText: Best bluetooth for this price point. I use these ALL THE TIME. And I still feel like it makes me look a bit nerdy so I found putty them under the collar rather than outside helps. Plus still no way to turn off the stupid LED that pulsates blue all the time. Expect to get looks as people seem to think you may be in security or something. Often I use with one side in to hear the world around me but still get through audio books or listen to music.Bluetooth does tend to drop a bit when the phone is positioned against you like in your pocket and has to go through "you" to get to the ear piece. Hoping they would come out with a version that takes advantage of the newer bluetooth standards but we'll wait and see.The good news is that I've had the prior version and now this one. With all my little complaints these are still dollar for dollar the best buy I've found on the market today. Very comfortable as they rest on your neck/shoulder. charge lasts for 10-12 hours and amazingly only takes about 20minutes to recharge. I like the new audio prompts when you power on or off telling you connected or battery level. And still one of the least expensive on the market. Great for driving too I might add.
title: LG Electronics Tone+ HBS-730 Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: I love mine. Works with Android and iPhone. Great for multitasking because you don't have to worry about running a wire from your phone to your ears. These head phones represent freedom - no getting tangled up while working. Works great as a headset for phone calls (good mic). The battery lasts pretty long. I use mine about 1.5 hours a day while commuting and only charge it about every 3 or 4 days. The charging port is the same as most non-Apple smartphones, which is convenient for Android users (i.e. one charger fits all). They're pretty durable, just be careful not to yank the ear buds too hard (the wires are pretty thin and would probably break relatively easily). If you're really fashion-conscious, they are a bit gadget-y and may make you feel a little nerdy at times - just something to think about.ONE THING YOU SHOULD KNOW: if you are using an older smart phone (e.g. Atrix 4G), the Bluetooth technology is a little different and it does pose a problem - namely, you won't have control over the volume at the headset. I thought mine was broke, but after a little research, I found out that it was a hardware issue. It worked fine on my newer phones. So I don't recommend for older smart phones. If you're not sure, check the Bluetooth specs and make sure they match on the headphones and your device.
title: LG Electronics Tone+ HBS-730 Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: I have to agree with others, connection is not as solid as previous 700 model. Can not give higher than 3 stars here.  Even after reading previous reviews I couldn't resist additional features on the 730 so took a chance.  All additional features work great, especially the voice activated battery indicator.  I will keep it since connection seems to be good (with descent range) as long as there is clear line of sight, which works for me 80% of time especially when driving.  I can see this as a problem if working-out.  However when phone is in holster, pocket it does cut in and out.  Didn't have this problem at all on previous 700 model, which lasted for over 1 year until I accidentally damaged left side. I would strongly suggest the previous 700 model over the newer 730.  Great new features means little if primary function, BT connectivity is degraded.
