reviewText: I've been on a quest to find the perfect set of bluetooth headphones. Instead, I've found two bluetooth headsets that, together, manage to come real close. These LG headphones are perfect for the gym. The sound is really good (not exactly flat, there's a noticeable bass bump....I'm an audio engineer and very picky) and they get loud enough, which can be hard to find. It seems like every manufacturer has their own idea about where buttons should be. These take a little getting used to, but after a couple uses this isn't an issue for me. I like the magnetic openings at the ends that hold the earbuds when you want to talk to a gym-rat buddy. I have a pair of Wireless Beats that SUCK for the gym. I usually take about 2 hours to get in a good gym workout. By the end of my workout, when using the Beats, they and my ears are really hot and sweaty. And forget about benching with the Beats on..... they're heavy enough to fall right off. Not so with these LG's. Even when doing flat bench exercises, these LG's stay barely noticeable around my neck, At the gym, I wear my phone in an arm strap case, so I haven't noticed any connection drop outs with the LG's INDOORS.And this brings me back to the beginning of my review. Indoors, at the gym, these LG's are as close to the perfect headphones as I've found. Outside, running or even just walking, not so great. My pair of wireless Beats are great when I run.  The LG's have a lot of dropouts outside for some reason.  However, running outside with the Beats, I've had zero drop outs.The ear bud inserts don't block wind noise very well. The Beats are over-the ear and block out all wind noise. I haven't tried running with the LG's, but I imagine the neck piece would tug at the earbuds because I'm not exactly a smooth runner and even on the elliptical they shift a bit (not at all bad, just extrapolating). Between these LG's and my wireless Beats, they make the perfect pair of headphones.
title: LG Electronics Tone+ HBS-730 Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: I originally had iLuv headphones to use with my SGS II when watching youtube, playing Pandora and other music. But I always spent loads of time untangling the cable. The LG Tone+ definitely decreased the cable clutter for me, especially when doing physical activity that required movement of arms, twisting, picking stuff up and so on. body movement caused the rubber cables of most headphones to drag on my skin and clothing eventually loosening them from my ears. im really digging this headset right now!my only minor gripe is the sound quality,but that's okay since being cable free Is more important to me. listening to youtube videos and Pandora is fine on my phone.the magnetic earbuds are a nice touch, they keep the buds from just dangling around when not in use. battery power lasted me for 3 days on/off usage before I had to recharge for 3 hours on the microUSB port. the buds also (for my ears) aren't totally sound isolating, so you can still hear stuff going on around you like alarms, people talking and so on.

reviewText: First I can't believe how quickly I received the headset. Ordered placed on 10/31/13 with expected delivery on 11/2/13 and it arrived today 11/1/13 at 11:20am!!! It was fully charged!! I was expecting to charge it up for awhile then 4-5 mins pairing process, but as soon as I switch on power and pairing with my phone and tablet, I was all set. This is an awesome product. When I saw a friend with these a few months ago the cost was much pricier. I was thinking to myself do I really want it, is it really worth it. I've been using an over the ear Bluetooth but it's been uncomfortable while wearing glasses. Plus I couldn't listen to music. Now I'm able to be on the go listen to music while walking and able to switch to answering those important calls.  I would not hesitate to recommend these to everyone!! You absolutely can't go wrong. I've been reading some great reviews and I'm so thrilled that can finally add to them and happy to finally own this great product!!Nov 6thIt has been 6 days now since I've been using this awesome headset. I realized the next day that if I'm listening to music, I need to pause before answering the phone as the calls drop every 5-8 mins. I initially thought it was my friends or even the headset itself and was able to retract the above review. I admit that I haven't read the instructions thoroughly. But I'm still happy and will keep this headset. A few friends are curious about how it works and I'm thrilled to show it off!!

reviewText: I bought this last summer in 2013 and loved it! Then I bought a car with Bluetooth so I sold this on CL. After about a month, I realized the Bluetooth in my car sucks, and needed an actual headset if I wanted to connect wireless in my car. So I bought this headset again April of 2014!Things I love about this headset:-take it anywhere, very little wire to get tangled in...sits around my neck and I forget it's even there-mic works flawlessly, people on the other end said they could hear me great even with lots of background noise-surround sound (in both ears) so I can drown out my own background noise-clear sound coming through for music and voice... it's no Bose, but it's amazing either way!-it vibrates when you get a call, so even without the earpiece in I know a call is incoming-music controls at my fingertips while leaving my phone in my bag/pocket!-sleek design and nice colorThings that could be improved:-better magnets for the headphones-the way the wires connect bothers me. I don't like that they head towards the back before heading back to the front, but that's a minor irritation more than anything-text integration for iPhone so I can hear my texts read to me while I'm driving as a 4S userOverall, 6 stars, but Amazon only lets me give 5!

reviewText: This headset this is excellent.  I use a Jawbone ERA for most voice calls (the noise cancellation is better), but this thing is comfortable, with great audio sound.  With that said, the noise cancellation (if there is any) is average, the microphone is in a nebulous spot, and the phone call audio is overboosted (I've tried setting bass boost off, treble boost on, and normal mode with no luck).So for 90% of voice calls, I use my Jawbone (which is coming to the end of its life based on my experience with earlier models...), and for long trips or times when I want to listen to music but be ready for calls, I use the LG.Pros- fit around neck- lightweight- audio soundCons (all minor)- phone audio is over-boosted- phone noise cancellation (if any) is weak- earpiece installation/replacement a pain- earphone wires tricky to get in good place (not too taught/not too slack)
title: LG Electronics Tone+ HBS-730 Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: I have owned about 4 hbs-700 headsets prior to buying this hbs-730.  I didn't think the hbs-700 could get much better.Well, this is better.  I was a little worried about the range of this unit due to several comments I read online.  They must have fixed the problem, because I often find myself three rooms away while talking on my phone, before I realize I've forgotten my phone.The sound quality is excellent on phone calls or listening to music.  People on the other end can't tell I'm on a wireless headset.  I also like the silver magnetic ear bud holders better than the bright orange ones.The build quality is excellent, and they have reinforced the wires for the ear buds where they come out of the neck piece.  This is an improvement, because my hbs-700 headsets have all failed at that specific location.  Hopefully these will last longer because of the reinforcements.  (typically I've gotten about 6 months out of a headset, 7 days a week 12 -18 hrs a day, running wires, crawling under desks, taking apart computers, replacing hard drives, etc.)I've probably owned 20 different sets of bluetooth headsets.  These are hands down the best bluetooth headsets out there.  At $60, these LG headsets easily blow away headsets that cost twice as much. They are MUCH better than plantronics, motorola, jabra etc.I've seen some headsets connect by a small wire, and have been tempted, then realized this is a better design.  Here I can take the ear buds out of my ears, and I have a place for them that protects them, but keeps them handy.By the way, the headsets vibrate when a call is coming in, so you can tell your phone is ringing even if the ear buds are in their magnetic holders.The hbs-730 differentiates itself from the hbs-700 with voice feedback that tells you you've answered a call, that your bluetooth is connected, or disconnected.  It also vibrates twice when it loses connection with your phone, or gets connected with your phone.The headsets come with 3 different sizes of ear buds, so even the smallest ears and biggest ears will be comfortable.They are a little bit nerdy, but they also command a lot of respect.  I find that when I'm out and about on a very casual Saturday wearing  raggedy shorts, a torn t-shirt, flip-flops, unshaven, and with my long hair down instead of in a pony tail, people still call me Sir and Mr. MyLastName.  I was real surprised to find myself being treated so respectfully until I realized I had my hbs-730 headset on.  I guess it just screams expensive high-tech, so the person wearing it must be a person of means who can afford to look his worst.  ;-)Try them, you'll love them.PS.  Yes, I am a computer consultant.
title: LG Electronics Tone+ HBS-730 Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: I have never yet, despite heavy use, had the batteries run down.  This thing is incredible.  The sound is LOUD and the design easy to work with.  The necklace part can hide under my shirt collar most of the time.  It does not quite work the same as my phone when it comes to Siri.  Hold the iPhone button down firmly for a second or two summons her on the phone.  On the LG it simply redials you last called number.  A brief tape of the left button however, (don't hold it down too long) and Siri pops up nicely.  This is not well documented as far as I could tell, but once I figured that out, this was GREAT.  I may just have to buy another for a spare in case it ever breaks, I would hate to be without it.  It has quickly become indispensable.

reviewText: Pros:* Actually quite good distance--sometimes up to 15m or so without line-of-sight. (I'm using this with a laptop; not a cell phone. Most cell phones have fairly terrible Bluetooth power.) Class 2 devices like this should get at least 30m with LoS, and this might even do so.* Audio is relatively good, if a bit flat, and the earbuds actually stay in my ears.Cons:* The magnets are pure gimmickry. Giving the earbuds a hard look will cause them to fall out of the tip "holders". This will not prevent the cords from getting tangled or destroyed. Sorry.* The "multi-point" is also gimmickry. If you're listening to an A2DP via your laptop or tablet or something and a call comes in on your cell phone, forget hearing who the caller is, much less talking to them. I was just barely about to make out something like a voice, and my phone has *great* speech synthesis.* Non-A2DP audio is just completely terrible compared to a real headset.* LG provides no support for this device, as with most things they sell. There are no firmware upgrades to fix multi-point. I was told point-blank that it's not possible to upgrade firmware on this device. I suspect that's completely untrue, but there are certainly no downloads available on their site. Not even the manual, or a spec sheet.Other:Since it works for music, I'll hold onto it until I can afford some decent Bluetooth headphones--if those exist. But it's the last LG product I buy.
title: LG Electronics Tone+ HBS-730 Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: I had the older model of this headset and it was really exceptional, so I was excited to see that they had a newer model.  But sadly newer did not mean better.  The only thing I can say against it, and it's a deal breaker for me, was that the bluetooth connection was extremely flakey!  It cut out on me at least 3 or 4 times a day.  One odd thing about the cutout, it seemed to happen much more often if I was moving, but not only when I was moving.For example, if I was on an exercise bike at the gym and listening to music it was fine most of the time, but then if I went for a run it would start cutting out on me.I'm really sad too, because I like the sound quality a lot!  The sound is definitely better than on the old set.  But I'm on the phone a lot and I need that bluetooth connection to be stable....so I'm returning the new model in exchange for an older one.

reviewText: I've been using these headphones for a week now. I like the comfort of them. They provide 3 different sizes of ear buds so you can find the one that suits you best.The sound is good, but I personally think that the bass could be a little better. It seems to distort a little on songs that have a little bass to them, and I am not talking about rap or dub-step music, just pretty much rock songs that carry a little heavy bass.The range is kind of poor in my opinion. If the manufacturer is claiming 33 feet, that's just not true. I go down a 20 feet hallway, take a turn around the corner and the sound on calls and/or music starts cutting in and out. It's not a huge deal to me because I typically have my phone in my pocket. However, if I need to charge the phone I must stay near it when on calls.Again, the comfort is good. The magnets could be a little stronger like I read on another review. I feel that they are almost worth the money. $40 bucks would be about right for these. I paid a little more than that. I'm okay with the purchase.

reviewText: I use this to watch my TV which is connected to a small HTPC in my exercise room. I use the Kinevo 4.0 USB bluetooth adapter for my HTPC.Connection is flawless. When I turn the headset on the TV audio automatically switches to bluetooth and vice versa when I turn the headset off. I recommend turning on the HTPC before the headset as the pairing does not always work the other way around.  Audio works in both Windows Media Center and Plex. If there is audio lag it's very subtle IMO.The headset works great on a treadmill and elliptical as the earbuds really block out the noise. I can watch TV with the volume lower because I don't have to drown out the equipment noise with the TV speakers.The range is at least 20 feet in open space in my experience which is plenty for me.

reviewText: I purchased this in white as a replacement for an LG Tone that failed after about a year of daily service. I loved my Tone and figured this would be basically the same, but newer. It has some key changes which caused me to return the first one and now the second (in black).The pros:- The sound quality seems to be pretty good (I'm no audiophile, but it sounded good to me).- The form factor is the same.- It puts a neat battery indicator on the iPhoneThe cons:- The volume buttons are reversed which has me constantly moving the volume in the wrong direction.- Now it talks to me. This might be neat the first time, but the indicator beeps from the earlier one were just fine. These take a little longer to listen through. It's minor, but annoying to me.- The pause button does not work consistently with my iPhone 4S. The stop function works and serves largely the same purpose, but I don't want to have to hold the button down for a full second just because I want to hear someone who is trying to talk to me.This last is the biggest irritation for me and the reason I'm switching back to the previous version. The instructions clearly state that a brief push should pause playback and it simply does not do so - no reaction unless you hold it for a second until you get a beep.

reviewText: I use these every day for about 10 hours most days plus for several hours a day on weekends working around my house.  I am a heavy sweater so I am not surprised that after 8 months of daily use in a machine shop and my yard, that something went wrong.  I have used these with a Droid 2 and Samsung Note II with very little connectivity problems I have seen in other reviews.  If you use it in an area where there are many walls between the phone and headset, then there will be connectivity issues.  Also, I have notices, if there is any more than normal pressure put on the phone itself, ie. tight pants pockets, the connection is spotty as well.  I cannot blame these on the headset itself.  The battery was easily lasting 12 hours a day with my Droid and about the expected 10 hours with my Note II.  Overall, considering the abuse these receive, I would most definitely buy these again as the sound is the best I have heard and the comfort is second to none.

reviewText: I just bought these headphones for a business trip to a major city, and my impression is: Wow. The LG Tone+ is everything I want in a set of in-ear headphones. Note that these were tested on a Samsung Galaxy S5, which naturally has enormous Bluetooth range- I can leave my phone in a room and be across the parking lot before the connection drops.Pros:-AptX. If your phone supports the AptX protocol, you will hear CD-quality sound. (Note that despite not saying so on the website, the S5 does support AptX).-Yes, that means good sound! I'm an audiophile with extra-sensitive hearing, and these headphones are as good as you can possibly get in this price range. I listen to dance music (driving bass), rock music (midrange), and audiobooks (voice, treble). All sound as good as I can get with a full set of speakers.-Cool design. Of course the neckband is mostly to store the batteries and antennas necessary to make the Bluetooth work, but having extra controls and magnetic rests for the earbuds makes them very cool.-Good signal. After a good 8 hours of use, I've had a handful of brief stutters that resolved automatically within a fraction of a second. My phone has been in a front pocket, a jacket, a backpack, across the room- it's great.-Good battery. I had a 4-hour train ride and I think the batteries were only down to what the announcer said was "power medium". Very nice.-Good sound dampening. Even when not in use, I sometimes used the earbuds to block our sound- like when passing a train engine at a train station. The earbuds can completely dampen the normal hum of a city, including nature sounds and distant vehicles. That's more than enough for me.-Easy "one-ear" use. If I need to listen- say, as I'm crossing traffic- I can pop out one earbud and use the magnet to hold it to the neck piece. Once I'm done, pop it back into my ear. Simple, easy, effective.Cons:-The magnets holding the earbuds are kind of weak, so they pop out easily in a pocket or just as you move. I leave it on my neck as much as possible.-Wire management can be an issue. It's not as bad as a traditional wire, but the design could use some minor tweaks. For example, why don't the wires just travel inside the loop for most of their distance? This would be an easy way to pin them back out of the way for most people.-App support for buttons is not perfect. My favorite apps (Play Music, DI.fm) only "sort of" recognize the fast-forward or play-pause buttons. I can usually stop music (hold the play/pause button), and track skip will work but I can't fast-forward within a track. Considering that these are fairly popular apps I'm wondering if I should look into a firmware update for the headphones. Regardless, volume and power always work, so that has me covered.Overall:-Competitively priced, great audio, great connection, great batteries. What else could a person ask for in a headset? I wish there was a version of this same product with over-the-ear headphones, but this is as good as you can ask for in-ear headphones.
title: LG Electronics Tone+ HBS-730 Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: be careful when ordering from amazon.  I bought a new Tone+ and when I open the item, there are clear ear wax on the ear buds.  the sound quality was nothing special, equal to a $20 bluetooth receiver I bought previously.  also there is this signal interference with the headphone around my neck, and my phone in my pocket!  This was obviously an defective item that was returned, and amazon just repackaged it as new and selling it again.  very disappointed.the 2 pieces of plastic that holds the wires in place pinches the neck, making it very uncomfortable to wear.Bought a Plantronics BackBeat Go2, same price, sound quality was significantly better, much better base, packaging is clearly brand new, and nothing hang around the neck. only drawback is shorter battery life, but it was enough to last my daily commute on a single charge.returning the item as defective, hopefully amazon wouldn't just re-shelf the item as new and sell it to the next customer.

reviewText: I was truly worried when I purchased this headset. I'm a marathon runner, and between long races and dailiy training I've been thru at least a dozen headsets, wired and wireless. I looked at this headset, saw the little wires coming out of it and I immeadiately thought "I'm going to break this thing in like 2 seconds". I've previously broken every other brand available, but not these, after months of heavy use they are still going strong and show no signs of even wear & tear.The battery indicator is a godsend. You no longer have to wonder if your headset is going to die in the middle of a training or race. In short, this is an innovative headset and a must have for runners that don't wanna get tangled in wires.The only issue I ran into is I can't pair them with my MOTOACTV watch, but I believe they are not at fault because I can pair them just fine with every other bluetooth device I own.

reviewText: I previously owned the HBS-700, and purchased the HBS-730 after the aforementioned died during a run.The HBS-730 has excellent sound quality -- absolutely LOVE the sound coming from the new model! The improved voice prompts are also a very welcome touch, "Powering on. Battery Full. Connected."However, as other reviewers have mentioned, there's static/crackling coming during the silent parts of streamed music whenever the source does not have clear line-of-sight to the headphones. Example: I placed the iPod Touch into my back pocket. As soon as I turned my head 90 degrees to the left or right, there is an immediate disconnection, followed by a "Disconnected" voice prompt. Place the same device onto the table, and there are no issues whatsoever.The headphone also skips a split second during the first few seconds of a song.With the 2nd HBS-730 I purchased at the same time, it was paired with my Samsung Galaxy S III smartphone. (I did not bother to pair the other unit with the phone.) Despite the phone being right in front of my face, the headphone kept repeatedly prompting: "Connected", "Disconnected", "Connected", etc.As I use the HBS headphone for jogging/running, such abysmal connection issue is highly undesirable.I am returning BOTH HBS-730 I purchased, and getting one HBS-700 instead. I am saddened by this, however, as I absolutely love the Pros of the product.
title: LG Electronics Tone+ HBS-730 Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: I have to say, I really wanted to like these headphones. As one of the few sets with Apt-X and given that I was loathe to spend over a $100 on a pair of bluetooth headphones, I went into this purchase with high hopes which LG promptly crushed.To start, these headphones have a very odd design. Maybe it's just me, but the earbuds we always falling out of the holder and if I wore a coat, they were damn near impossible to use because they'd always fall out, get stuck in the coat, or the coat would block the controls.I also had the poor signal issue that many people complain about. When I first received the buds, they worked perfectly, but they soon started dropping out even if the phone was in my front pocket. It seemed as if these headphones could not do their job if they had less than a 3/4 charge.More importantly though, these headphones are just poorly manufactured. After less than two months use, one of the earbuds stopped playing at the same volume as the other. I could not believe that they lasted for such a short amount of time. I still haven't bothered with the warranty process, mostly because I know I'll just get another piece of shoddily manufactured plastic and I'm not really in a hurry for that.My recommendation is that you save some extra cash and get a nicer set of BT headphones. It will be worth it in the not-so-long run.
title: LG Electronics Tone+ HBS-730 Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: I picked up an earlier model of these for someone else and when my own headset stopped holding a charge, I gave these a try.  They're a great set.  The earbuds fit snugly but not too large (there are other buds you can attach) and the sound is actually very good.  I tend to use them during the late night hours while reading news articles and the like, so as not to disturb my wife's sleep.  They're much more comfortable than your standard over the head, cup style headphones and less likely to snag than other sets.  One thing in particular that impressed me is how long they hold a charge.  Sometimes I can go a week without charging them (not heavily used) and if I don't use them for a while, they hold a charge just fine.  I'd recommend these to others looking for a decent but affordable headset for regular use.

reviewText: Gift for my sister, a marathon runner and avid "person running for no reason." She says she's tried a bunch of this type of gear and this is the best. reviewText: I've own the LG HBS-730 Tone+ since Feb 2013. For the first 6 months, I loved them. I work outside, jog and use them at the gym and they are awesome. All I do is put them around my neck, put on the ear buds and GO. Battery life is about 4-6 hours. Depends on the use. The range is about 30 feet. I can leave my iPhone in my room and walk across the house while music is playing. Controls are easy to use and I never had to take out my phone to change a song, answer the phone or change the volume. For the first 6 months, they are great!Now the bad, around Aug my headphone started losing the connection. Like when it changed to the next song, it would be silent for 10+ seconds, then you hear the song. It only happens if its not fully charged or if I was wearing my armband and my phone was within a foot. I tried to contact LG b/c it comes w/ a one year warranty but kept getting the run around. Until they finally said they won't replace them. I was very disappointed and I would love to give it 5 stars but if a product won't last pass 6 months. It's not worth buying.

reviewText: It's amazing how gadgets like these make our lives better in subtle but important ways. It's surprising how a little thing like a headphone cord can limit what you like to do. Going out to ride a bike, bopping around the house doing chores, talking on the phone with your hands full, you can do these with a wired headset but it's not nearly as enjoyable. These headphones have all the positives of a normal set of earbuds with very few drawbacks.Pros - Sound, battery, range, comfort, appearance, build quality.Cons - Color (pearl white), button feel, LED indicator.Sound - The sound is obviously very important to the success of a headset. I'm no audio expert, but I am picky. I know the difference between crappy, distorted, flat performance and good, clear dynamic range. With Bluetooth anything sound quality is always a concern. These headphones don't disappoint. I was nearly shocked at how good the low range is. Bass is clear, powerful and full, not muddy. I sometimes have to turn the volume down on a song that has a strong bass line because it feels like it's a tiny bit too punchy. There is an EQ setting for bass boost if you're not a fan of bass. I used to have a couple of twelve inch woofers in the back of my car growing up, so I'm a fan of strong bass. It's not enough to make you deaf, but you definitely can feel that the bass is there. You do need to make sure the buds are seated in your ear canal to get the full effect. It's impressive. I have high quality over the ear headphones that don't have this good of bass reproduction. I just switched from listening to Daft Punk to Yo-Yo Ma and the bass sounds just as good on both tracks. The midrange and highs are also clear, full and crisp. Vocals are beautiful. At full volume there is the occasional crackle or pop but that is to be expected. Not bad for a regular headset, especially a bluetooth connection. Obviously sound quality is dependent on the source. I found that sound coming from my Nexus 5 phone was noticeably clearer than the bluetooth from my Mac Mini, possibly due to the apt-X tech.Range - With a wireless connection range is always a concern as well. Great sound means nothing if you can't hear it or if it's constantly dropping out. Bluetooth is an amazing technology but has its limits. I find that normal use, if I'm not separated from the device by walls or doors, I consistently have a great connection. There can be the odd drop out, but not enough to make it a bad experience. I can easily expect to get 30 feet of unobstructed distance from the unit without worry of a disconnect sometimes double that range. Now if I move to another room, separated by a wall then there are dropouts. I expect that though. If your want is to have absolutely perfect connection and be in another room, these aren't the headphones for you. The connection is good, very good, but not that good.Battery Life - The battery on these beauties is amazing. It easily runs for several hours without hardly a dent in the battery level. I charge these every few days and have never gotten anything less than the "medium" battery warning when I power them on. The battery strength is liberating, not limiting on these headphones. You'll run out of juice before they do.Comfort - The soft rubber tips on the earbuds conform nicely to your ear canal without pressure or discomfort. They seat well and rarely come loose. If I'm chewing gum they gradually work themselves loose, but that's to be expected. They provide three different sizes. My ears use the smallest ones, which are still a bit too big. I must have freakishly small ear canals for a grown man. Changing the rubber tips can be tricky as they are super tight on the buds, but with perseverance it can be done. The main unit sits lightly around the base of your neck. I forget it's there most of the time. For some reason mine likes to rotate around so that the left side is higher than the right when I'm moving around a lot. Not sure if it's my neck shape or possibly a slight imbalance in the two sides that causes this. No big deal. The only thing I find uncomfortable about this headset is the pointy buttons. The volume up/down and fwd/back buttons are thin and easily distinguished from the round call / stop / pause buttons but they are kind of pointy and sharp on the ends. Not that you would ever scratch yourself, but just not pleasing to the touch. A slightly more rounded button would be nicer and feel higher quality.Appearance - Some headphones, especially wireless headphones make you look like an idiot from a low budget sci-fi movie. These don't. If you have a collar on your shirt these often disappear and other than the wires going to your ears they are hardly noticeable. I like that they come in black or white, the silver accents are tasteful and they don't look cheap. I was surprised that when I ordered the "white" color they were actually pearl (iridescent) white and not plain white. That was definitely a bummer for me, being a guy pearl is not my thing. If you're a lady you might not care as much or might actually prefer the pearl as it is a bit more feminine in my opinion. It's not over the top reflective and at just a glance you wouldn't notice but it bugs me a bit they didn't put that in the product description. Pure white would have been a classier choice in my opinion, but hey. The only other flashy thing I don't like is the LED indicator around the call button. It does give you a visual indication that the unit is charging and when it's done charging but if you're listening to audio in a darkened room it does seem like a police cruiser is parked outside your window. It's bright.Features - Multipoint Bluetooth means you can connect it to your phone and tablet at the same time to the headset. Convenient if you're watching a movie or listening to music from your tablet but still want to be alerted about incoming calls and messages from your phone. Cool. It allows two simultaneous connections. Noise canceling seems to work well, when I'm on a call people say I sound clear and no excessive background or wind noise. Very nice when I'm riding the bicycle. Text to Speech to read back sms messages worked with Apple/Siri but I couldn't figure out how to get it to work with stock Android/KitKat. There's probably an app for that. There are tons of in-call options, call waiting, voice dialing, HD Voice, call reject, etc. all considering you have a compatible phone. The magnetically tipped earbuds/collar are a cool design feature. Nice to have the buds hanging out where you can pop them on and off with little effort and they are always in the same place. The magnets are the perfect strength in my opinion. Firm enough to keep the earbuds there but not tough enough that you have to fight to get them loose.Build Quality - These headphones seem suitable for medium abuse. I exercise (biking mostly) with mine, sweat a bit but definitely don't get them overly drenched. I have a two year old that likes to play with the earbuds and magnets and she has yet to pop an earbud loose from one of the wires. If I left her alone with them in a room for ten minutes they might not work when I got back though, they're not that sturdy. I've read other reviews where the on/off switch breaks or stops working over time, mine still work about four months later and doesn't seem sketchy. I am a bit concerned about the charging port over time, it does take some force to push in the Micro USB charger and would not be surprised if it eventually broke. It might get more easy to plug in over time. I toss these in the seat of the car or on the coffee table when I get home and don't worry too much about parts coming loose or insides breaking. They seem fairly sturdy for what they're meant for.Overall I would rate these headphones very highly. Were it not for the cheesy pearl finish and the pointy button design they would be five stars.

reviewText: I didn't get mine from Amazon because I didn't want to charge anything to my card but I did buy the 730 based on reviews here. I purchased my through another online retailer that had a clearance for new 730 with damaged boxes from shipping (so they say). The price was very close to the $55 they sell it for here.First Impression 4-26-13.I got mine from USPS today. One, It was very light. Two, The part that goes around your neck is very flexible. Although it has a rubbery feel there won't be that big of an issue with tangling and the sticky feeling. This thing is loaded with buttons and features for calling and music, it even has an app that's supposed to read your SMS (text messages) from Google Play.Features on this is a blessing and a curse for this stereo headset because there are more things you have to read and learn about in order to operate this. For instance: in order to sync the Bluetooth with my phone, the manual says I got to hold down the phone button and then turn the power switch to ON. There is a lot more to remember from the tiny but information filled manual. The blessing is that this device is modern and up-to-date. There is something called aptX that's built into this headset that can be used with newer Android phones like the Samsung Galaxy S3 which also has this. the aptX boasts better music quality that is much needed. I also love the drivers on this headset because this is what I gambled $50+ for.First I'd like to let you know that using this headset on anything other than a good phone like my Samsung Galaxy S2 with awesome music apps and built-in equalizers, is a waste. By itself without a good equalizer I say this is a 6/10. With Poweramp app (equalizer on / no changes, and low bass). I received sound quality from those tiny drivers that most popular/cheap ones can't even match. Hell, I didn't even need to break-in and that's what blows my mind. I was able to dissect the music I'm listening to. For the first time, I was able to pick out different parts of songs, and vocals are clear. I can actually make out what they are singing about in Final Fantasy Distant Worlds - Draco and Maria. I used a song like I Miss You by Klymaxx to test out the headset with the dissecting part. Only with a good equalizer I can give this headset an 8/10.Style. This neck band style does make me look a bit weird with the wire sticking out. There are clips on each side that you can slide to take away the slack and/or adjust length. Be Careful not to take too much out or you won't like it when you swing your around and feel the band tugging. This thing is really light and the end sits right on top of my collar bone. This so light I don't even care that it is laying on my collar bone. The earbud seals really well and very comfortably. A lot of earbuds normally seal too well and leaves pressure in your ears. This one stayed in my ear and does pretty well at keeping out outside noise. At the ends you can insert the earbuds into a slot to hold it in place instead of letting it dangling.This unit is comfortable, modern, sounds great, not so stylist, and has too many functions and signals to remember. This may not be a Bose or Ludacris Soul (I'm leaving out Dre's Beats because I didn't like them) but for an afforadle headset this isn't just a winner, it is the winner! Earbuds are really hard to get right because they are so small and you can buy tons of them and never get clean bass or clear vocal, and sometimes sound like a radio. For $55, this is a 10/10. Just about everything about this unit is premium for a bluetooth unit at such a low price. I'll write a follow-up after I tested all the features and tell you about how this unit does at my workplace.Initial Testing 4-27-13I was able to walk about 6 car length (front and back) without a hiccup and more when I give it time to adjust. Im not sure if it is the 730 or my Samsung Galaxy S2 but they both did wonderfully together. I had a few situations when my jaw bone would hit the track button and change my music. The back side of the earbud is magnetic. When I had it dangling and I was leaning against my door the earbud would stick to the door. I hid my 730 under the collar of my shirt keeping almost the whole unit hidden. I will test call quality next time.Update on Performance testing 5-27-13My SGS2 power button broke and it keep resetting randomly so I switched phones. Until I can get it fixed, I am using the HTC Amaze 4G. The HTC couldn't be more than 2 feet away from the 730, otherwise it would cut out. This test proves that if you are getting poor performance then it is your phone or player. 6 car lengths Samsung VS. 2 ft. HTC.

reviewText: 07/14/2014 *** Update***I've had this set for over a year now.  What was good is still good, when the connectivity is there.  When riding my motorcycle and the phone is mounted on my handlebars with nothing between me and the phone, connectivity is good and stays there.When I am doing yard work and the phone is on my right hip, connectivity is iffy.  And I get complaints of echoing and such intermittently.  I thought is was my phone because I had the Android 4.3 upgrade which trashed my wi-fi and I thought might have impacted my bluetooth as well but two weeks ago, I finally got a replacement phone.  The new Phone (Galaxy Note 2-Verizon) accepted the 4.3 and 4.4.2 updates with no issue to my wi-fi this time(YEA!) but the bluetooth issues are still there.  My son has the same headset with a galaxy S4 and the same problems.  My wife has the same headset on her Iphone-4 and no issues.  Go figure.So, my recommendation is this:1)  Buy it, try it out heavily and return it if it does not work.2)  If you have problems, Do not wait to return it or maybe get a fix from LG.  I waited too long and the warranty ran out.When it works, the sound is GREAT.  Good bass (well, let's just say my ears like it but I do have a bit of hearing loss so fidelity is no big deal for me).  Good volume.  Works great with my laptop and android tablet.The sad part is a cheap Bluetooth v2.1 works better with my phone than this one.I purchased this headset for one specific reason.  To be able to listen to music and communicate on the phone when riding my motorcycle.  I did not purchase through Amazon but a local big box store who did price match Amazon.I am going to look for a Bluetooth v4.0.  maybe that will work better.  Note, the v2.1 that work better fit me terribly.  I've got a big head and those did not have enough STRETCH to get around the back of my head.Setup Description:I have the LG730 paired with a Galaxy Note II phone (Verizon).  The phone does not have the stock battery, it has a 9300mah extended battery(warranty ZeroLemon Protection Guarantee CompatibleI mention this because it may be part of the problem I do occasionally have with the headset under the CON section.  I use the case provided by ZeroLemon for my phone.I mount my Galaxy Note 2 on my motorcycle (2007 Goldwing) using a RAM Mount for the phone (RAM Universal X Grip Tablet Tabletsand the handlebar (RAM Mounting RAM B 174 LO4U Reservoir Lowrance.  I bought the wrong phone mount initially but just flipped the prongs around to the smaller set on the back and it works great.  No fear of vibration.  I used it on a 1600 mile trip two weeks ago with no problems.I have a 3/4 Vega helmet with a face shield that I usually have lowered.  I also wear a heavy motorcycle jacket (not a leather jacket but a heavy duty nylon jacket with Kevlar protectors and such).  The LG730 sits inside the jacket and I zip the jack all the way up but leave the collar open to be able to get to the answer button.  The ear buds have no issues as long as I have them stretched out all the way.  I only wear one, not two when riding so check your state laws on that ([...]  I can turn my head left or right and not pull the bud out of my right ear.Usage Experience:PRO:Sound Quality:  Excellent compared to the helmet speakers I was using.  Good Bass and volume levels that are adjustable both on the phone and the headset so you can get the mix you want.  I am NOT an audiophile so I'm not concerned about the highest hi's or the lowest lows.  I just want to hear the music and hold a conversation.Microphone:  Very Good.  I made several test calls to multiple people while riding my motorcycle.  Up until about 40 MPH, they could not tell I was on a motorcycle.  Up to about 70MPH, all they heard was a bit of a buzz from my mufflers but could still hear me clearly and I could hear them quite well.Call notification:  Works well.  I can hear the phone ringing in my ear bud, the phone itself and vibration from the HB730.Call Answer:  Works well with bare fingers and light gloves.  Harder to get with thick gloves but doable (Auto answer would be nice).Wearing:  They are very flexible and comfortable to wear.CONS:When not on the motorcycle, I wear my phone on my right hip.  Sometimes the sound quality goes to pot listening to music while walking.  I"ll get skips in my songs.  This never happens on the same songs with my wired headset.  Turning off and back on the Tone+ usually clears that issue.  it's not an issue with the battery life (Usually high or on medium) and my phone with the 9300mah battery is NEVER low.  :)  (Love that battery....)I've noticed that when I lift up my left arm, i lose significant signal.  I've got a normal arm, no metals or anything in it but the blue tooth connections severely weakens and the sound almost drops out completely.  Drop my left arm back down, I'm good to go. (This may be related to my extended battery which completely covers the back of my Note 2 phone.  I'll find my original battery and see if I can duplicate the problem.No auto-answer.  Would be nice when working out or riding so I don't have to take a hand off of my handle bar.Hard to find the manual on the LG website.  An odd CON but I was just looking for it(to see if it can auto answer) and finding any support document for the LG Tone+ other than the sales page just wasn't there.Summary.Even with the small cons listed, this is a great Bluetooth headset for my purposes.  I also exercise at the gym with them.  I don't run (yet) but do walk on the treadmill and no problems to date with the slipping off.  Running might cause a problem because the are not tight around the back of my neck and may bounce.If it ever breaks, I'll buy it again.

reviewText: i am happy with this headset on my samsung note 2. i have tried two other stereo bluetooth earbud headsets: theJayBird BlueBuds X Sport Bluetooth Headphones - Midnight BlackandSony MW1 Headset Black Lite Version (Retail Box). the Jaybird had poor sound isolation while the sony had the very worst sound and was also uncomfortable to use. This LG is good. the microphone is by the neck, which i prefer over being on a hanging cord or on the ear. the battery is also around the neck, which i prefer to something heavy on the ear or something that has to be clipped to a shirt collar. These fit like normal stereo earbuds, with all the electronics around the neck. i find this to be the best i have tried. i returned the sony and the jaybird.this is the first set i have gotten in the last year that i was happy with. it is light, the sound is good, the controls are easy. works fine 20 feet into the next room. i called lg and they serviced me immediately. (the little three inch manual is also available in pdf as a download.) he said battery life is 15 hours on phone call, 10 hours with music, and 15 days with no use. when the headset is turned on, it announces battery life as high, med, and low. the earbuds comes come in three sizes. i find that the middle set is much more comfortable. this is much cheaper than the sony or jaybird and much better. i almost gave up hope finding a bluetooth stereo earbud set. the sound is comparable to corded earbuds. my friend said that the phone reception was the best he's had with my phone so far, bluetooth or not.i also got a car charger for it:High Quality Lg Tone / Tone+ (HBS-700, HBS-730) Bluetooth Headset (Tangle Free) Retract Car Charger Adapter- the retractable cord works great.

reviewerName: Retired "Retired, and enjoying my free time. ...
reviewText: I purchased this used Headset in April, 2013 for my son. So this is what he said.I acquired this headset as a used headset and it appeared to be well used but was in good shape. It was advertised used, but also was stated to be in Retail Packaging and it was not. It did not come with instructions for HBS-730 model headset, the instructions were for the HBS-700 so they were useless. The headset works very well, sound is very good stereo, great for music at the gym. As a phone headset, while working outside my home, it tends to cut out if my phone is in my back or front pants pocket, but works great without cutting out if my phone is laying on car seat while I am driving. Since it is a bluetooth headset, I would not expect that to be a problem, but it is, calls don't get dropped, but I just hear it cutting out and I don't hear what is being said. However, my main reason for this headset was to use while working out at the gym, so I am keeping this headset for that reason only. It is comfortable to wear during cardio workouts and stereo sound is very good, in fact the sound is way better than most high end quality ear buds I've tried. My next headset when the time comes will be the same brand/style and have the same functions as this model.UPDATE: Still working as good as when first purchased in April 2013. Reliable as long as phone is nearby. Pairs easily with both Droid RAZR and iPhone5.UPDATE 2/7/14: These headphones are still performing well for my use. My mother also purchased new LG HBS-730 and says she is really liking them. She does not have the issues of cutting out like I do and she sits either her phone or Bluetooth iPod Classic on a central counter within her house and is able to walk all over without it cutting out.

reviewText: I have had these since Oct 2013, 2 1/2 months now. I use them all day and everyday. I do not use them for music very much but almost exclusively phone calls.PROS: The transmitter is away from my head and I do not get headaches, which is why I tried them anyway. I can choose to use one ear bud or both depending on the type of call and the surrounding noise. They are clear and sound good. The battery life is good but I expected that. I have to charge them about 2 times per week. The controls are easy but did take some getting used to but not too much.CONS: I do not like ear buds in general and these are not exception. I have trouble keeping them in. If I leave one in my ear and it does not fall out, I end up hooking it with my hand in some way and yanking it out. I have stopped trying to leave an ear bud in and just am trying to get good and getting it inserted in the process of answering my call. It does alert with a buzz and vibration as well so this is possible. I have noticed the range is very limited. I often lose my BT connection within just a few feet. I guess this is good in one way as I always know immediately if I am walking out of the room and I have left my phone there. The biggest negative for me is the wires themselves. At first it was trying to figure out how to not have them always getting wrapped up, tangled up or just lost to the point that I look bee just flew down my collar as I am frantically trying to find the ear bud to answer a call but now, the wires are damaged where they connect to the headset and are about to break. I want to really like this but am just having a really hard time trying to figure out how to use them successfully.Here is hanging on to hope.

reviewText: I've had my set for about two weeks now. My goal was a headset for running and training for a tough mudder as well as for my motorcycle.Sound quality is great. The bass is slightly lacking but overall pretty good for an earbud set. Noise isolating helps drown outside sound, but is not noise canceling. When used as a headset on the phone, the buttons and features work great. Haven't had anyone complain while talking to them.Battery life seems pretty good. Two weeks of training about an hour or two a day and it still says high battery.Range is one thing I have seen comments on a lot. I have no problems. I leave my phone on the treadmill and walk over to a pull up rack about 20' away with absolutely no issues. I don't know why you would wander any further than that away.Gaming is one place I see a slight issue. To get the quality across Bluetooth they must compress the data because there is a slight delay on fast paced games. I tried a few online and hard drive videos, and the lag wasn't as noticeable.Running with these has one slight issue as well. The front portions of the neck piece that contain the controls tend to bounce onto my collarbone. This got annoying, and I'm sure it isn't that good for the headset to bounce off bone nonstop. I remedied this by putting the end pieces under my shirt collar. This prevented the bounce, but they do get awfully sweaty now. Only time will tell how they hold up to the sweat.I am eagerly awaiting motorcycle season in Wisconsin to test them out on the road.Overall I am very happy with the purchase and have recommended it to others.
title: LG Electronics Tone+ HBS-730 Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: Would not pair to my phone right out of the box. (Nexus 4)  When I went into manual pairing, I was able to pair it.  Then I took it for a road test - literally - drove into work using it for the first time.  It was terrible - cutting in and out, un-pairing and re-pairing ever few seconds.  Called my provider - T-Mobile and did troubleshooting with them, but to no avail.  I have called LG and am returning for a replacement.  Will still be out for shipping back to them, so not very happy about that.  If it works, I will come back and re-rate.3-3-14  After perusing the interweb I found many with same problem since KitKat came out.  One recommendation was to switch off WiFi before hitting the road.  I tried that and drove to work with no interruptions.  If this continues to work, I guess it is a minor inconvenience.  I cannot believe that LG was not aware of the problem when I talked to them.  It would have been nice if they would have suggested this as a fix.  Also, my cell carrier, T-Mobile said they had not heard of such a problem.  Since it was a fairly simple search that found this fix, you would think that manufacturers would be aware, or are they so afraid of Google that they will not challenge their upgrade.  I do enjoy not having to hassle with cords as I am working around the house or yard and the sound is pretty good.  I can get 30-40 feet away before I start having problems with reception.  I have moved my rating of the actual device to 4 stars, since I believe now it is more a problem with OS of the phone, not the device itself.
title: LG Electronics Tone+ HBS-730 Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: I bought two pair of these for wife and I, both of us using them on same type of phone we each have a Samsung Galaxy S3.I will go ahead and get the bad out of the way which I deducted 1 star.The bluetooth signal is weak, it says 33 feet but there is no way in H E double L it will actually work at 33 feet. I put the phone on my kitchen counter and stepped off 13 feet before it started to cut out. So the usable distance is 13 feet.This distance shrinks considerably if anything is blocking it, it will sort of work in your pants pocket if you wear thin pants like summer time Khaki cargo pants, but for the most part while in your pants pocket you will get cut outs here and there, moderate to severe depending on pant material, which side (right is better) and probably even if you have large belly.Now myself I just put the phone in my shirt pocket and I never have any problems at all.Works fine in my car where ever I put it.Now for my wife, hers was cutting out worse than mine, she has been wearing jeans which is probably why, she has to put hers in her bra and works pretty good from there. I just ordered a arm band from Amazon a few minutes ago which I hope works, if not we may have to send hers back and get the HBS700.Now all the rest is great, they sound very good especially for BT ear buds, I would say as good as my Klipsch S4 wired ear buds.Having the controls and battery around your neck is a great idea because you can have a larger battery, easy to reach controls and all the weight is on your shoulder where you don't even feel it at all, just the small buds in ear so you can wear these all day.These came in the mail fully or at least mostly charged, have used the heck out of them for 2 days now and seem like I can go at least another day so I haven't even charged them yet.I am sure after a few full charges these should last several days between charges.The voice control is nice especially while driving, just push a button and say "call whomever" or "play music" or specific artist, with Google voice can send email, text, navigate maps etc. Basically you can just put phone in holder and never touch it.The vibrate when you get a call is nice certainly cant miss a call.Overall they are probably the best BT ear buds you can buy for everything BUT the signal strength or maybe it is the Apt-X latency, but what ever it is they are good for about 13 feet for good reception, maybe 15-18 feet in perfect conditions while holding your tongue just right.Put phone in your shirt pocket or possibly an arm band and you should be good to go with great sound.I have a feeling that this signal problem can be fixed with a firmware update, hopefully LG may do this in the future.So far all pluses out weigh the ONE minus so I am going to keep them because I can manage to work around the weak signal.(Edit:) Nov 20th.Got wife an arm band for her cell phone, works pretty flawless from there so she is keeping hers also.These would be BY FAR the best BT earbuds on the market if they just had the same range as the HBS700.But we are making them work for us, still easier than messing with wired earbuds.

reviewText: There have been other reviews that this product has horrible range, but I have had no problems with it at all.  I've sat my tablet down and walked about 30ft away and still worked perfectly.  The only time I've had difficulty is when the source was inside and I was outside.  Only then did it finally cut out on me.  Sound is very good.  Music from my tablet isn't as good as music from my phone, so I would say sound quality is based more on your source than the earphones themselves.I've been extremely pleased with battery life.  I haven't even heard the headset tell me it's even gone to half power yet.  The app you download with this is very nice!  I really like having my text messages read to me without even having to do anything with my phone.  The magnets that your ear pieces connect to are very convenient.The only problem I've had so far was the headset finding my phone after I connected my tablet also.  Was annoying for about a day then it somehow self corrected so it's no longer a problem.  I would really recommend buying these.  I haven't tried this yet, but if you use it with your PlayStation for a headset and you also had it connected to your phone, it would read your incoming texts so you wouldn't even have to look away from your game.  How nice is that?!

reviewText: These link to my phone (iPhone and Galaxy s5) quickly and without any trouble.I use to use ear-buds with cords that got tangled and would get hung on clothes or a yard tool and jerk out of the phone, or would not stay plugged in while the phone was in my pocket.Now, I never worry about cords.  I forget it's on my neck.  Very light.  Has every feature including answering a phone call and hearing and being heard very well, the ability to increase or decrease volume, pause and play, skip back and forward in songs, and the ear buds stay in the headset when not in use magnetically.  Flexible enough to keep in my car.  Durable enough for yard work.  Battery life is very long...rarely have to charge it and I use it constantly.Best of all....perfect stereo reception.  I never lose connection when the phone is on my.  I can lay it down and it has a distance of about 15 feet, but loses connection if I go to another room without phone, which happens only because you forget you need a phone it is so convenient.Love it.  Can't live without it.
title: LG Electronics Tone+ HBS-730 Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: These are awesome. Started seeing people wearing them a few months ago and asked what they were. Everyone said they really loved them...so bought a pair and agree.The sound is very good; as good as any $20 corded earbuds. I'm able to rewind podcasts, adjust the volume of the headset (it doesn't adjust the output from the phone in my situation, so turn the phone up most/all the way and then you can adjust the LG down or up as you see fit). It pairs nicely with Android so I can hit a button and have it dial someone without having to touch the phone. They are light weight and the charge seems to last me a number of days of moderate use.

reviewText: I owned the first generation version of these headphones and I'm impressed with the improvements. The call quality is very good and the sound quality is great as well. New features include audio reading of text messages (if compatible with your phone) as well as battery status notification. The range you can travel with these is also very good. I can leave the room with the headphones on and continue to listen to them for a wide range. They are lightweight and most of the time I don't even notice I have them on. The only complaints I've heard about the Tone is that if you are working out or running the headset can bounce around on your neck or be hard to keep in one place.  I use them daily including while driving (I drive a six speed) Overall i recommend buying these!

reviewText: I have been using this headset for around 6 months now, and love it still. The sound is good, and it lasts a very  very long time, especially compared to models hanging in your ear only. reviewText: Best bluetooth headphones I've owned to date. The functionality and connection is top notch. Specifically, plenty of controls on it that all work well and intuitively. It also vibrates. It also has impeccable range.The mic is also the best of all the bluetooth devices I have used. I like the fit of the earphones as well. Battery life is long. Only real critique is: I don't particularly like working out with them. For example, if you go for a run, it tends to bounce. Also it gets kind of gross as you sweat. If you do any exercises laying down, say bench, it will move. If you look down, your jaw will push buttons. I have had problems with past bluetooth devices, loosing connection in short distances and particularly having poor microphones but definitely do not have that problem with these. 4 Stars because of the issues working out with them on.

reviewText: I previously owned the HBS-700 and my daughter broke a piece off one of the speakers so I decided to upgrade to this instead of repairing the old one..What a bad idea, I totally loved the HBS-700 and was expecting the HBS-730 to be just as good or even better. The HBS-730 does have improvements such as telling you the battery level when you turn it on and the battery level is also displayed on your phone all the time..But there are major drawbacks :1) the sound is distorted at high volumes2) phone calls sound muffled3) sometimes when skipping tracks, the new track does not start playing on the headset until 10secs into the track.4)The music sometimes have short pauses as if there was a break in signal..Note these problems were non existent in the HBS-700 and the sound was much more powerful without any distortion on the 700..I'm giving away the HBS-730 and just fixing my HBS-700 to use, don't waste your money on this, just buy the HBS-700 if you can find it...
title: LG Electronics Tone+ HBS-730 Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: If I could give this 10 stars I would! A Beach mistake (forgot it was around my neck while frolicking in the waves with the kids), let it dry and recharged it and worked! Think I would learn from that? Nope..Went to the pool few days later and forgot it on the table outside for 2 days, in Florida, during tropical storms! When I finally located it, it was soaking wet..Put it in rice for the night, charged it the next morning for about 8 hrs., crossed my fingers and BAM..worked perfectly! I am thankful to LG for making this product!! I would not recommend testing the water theories as the mini heartattacks that go along with it is not worth it..But I am shocked and VERY happy!!

reviewText: I had tried a pair of Kinivo BT 240 headphones, as I'm a gym rat and just could not stand the wires of my iPhone anymore. They didn't fly with me, as they were too tight on my ears. not a design flaw, just a compatibility issue between product and user. But there was NO WAY I was paying the high cost of Beats or Jaybird. I had seen these on countless numbers of my customers, so I figured I would check out Amazon, and to my delight, they were very highly rated. I couldn't be happier, paired with my iPhone 5S instantly, came fully charged, easy to use, and comfortable everywhere, including the gym. This is a slam dunk product for LG, I only pray they don't hose the next version. Sound quality is great. You can't go wrong!!!! For some reason, Amazon lists the Black at $30 higher than the White as of 3/6/14, but hey, I like the White ONES BETTER!!! SCORE!!!

reviewText: i looked at many reviews on this product as well as others and i will say i hardly think the range of this device is 30 ft, as advertised, especially with your back turned to the mated device, but if you're like me and keep your phone in your pocket or on a belt-clip, this will work perfectly. i tested it out by setting my phone(samsung galaxy s3) on my kitchen table in a phone call and walking away from the table. it seemed to start cutting out with my back turned at 15-16 ft, but turn towards my phone and crystal clear again. with my back tuned it worked well in the 10-15 ft range, although i didn't try to see how well it worked in different rooms so i can't review in that respect. as for call quality, i called the person with my cell w/o the headphones, then had them call back with the headphones in, the neckpiece vibrated as well as a distinct though not overly loud ring sounding through the earpiece. i hit the phone button on the neckpiece and it answered, and she said the sound quality was crystal clear on her end, a lot better than it sounded just talking through the phone normally, so i assume the noise cancellation works pretty good, as the tv was going decently loud in the background. when you first power on the headphones, a female voice says "power on" then "battery (whatever level battery is at)" then a couple seconds later "ready to connect" then hit to connect bluetooth in your device and she says "connected". i've used them with voice commands with my phone and it works fine. what gets me is the sound quality. i've had a few sets of earbuds before, but they are no comparison. they have incredible depth. normally on earbuds(and most headphones) when you crank it up to max the highs and voice level mids are overpowering and gets distorted out, but not these. they get loud, but don't lose the quality or depth at all. to me they are great for listening to music which is what i really bought them for. i'ts convenient nt to have a wire running down to your pocket to get knocked out of the device, or yank the buds out of your ears, or hung on things. the magnets that hold the earbuds in place on the neckpiece are alright, but i would count on them staying if you fling them around or something. they seem to hold a charge pretty good, i've used them for maybe an hour or two total on the phone and listening to music and even forgot to turn them off for a day and a half and it still says battery high. also on a side note, they work really well mated to my ps3 as a headset, can't say if they will work for xbox cuz i haven't tried.
title: LG Electronics Tone+ HBS-730 Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: I was all primed to give this thing a lousy review.  I thought the sound quality left a lot to be desired.  What I learned is that the correct sized earbud cushion is critical.  After I changed from the ones that came installed on the device to the large size that was included in the package I saw a world of difference and about a 75% improvement in sound quality.  Very good sound, extremely comfortable and decent battery life, what more could you ask for.  Actually, there is one more thing that makes this special.  It talks to you and has a simple on-off switch..  Now that may not sound like much, but I have a few different headsets and it gets very confusing trying to remember what and how many beeps mean what for each one.  This one is sooooo... clear just to hear a positive spoken feedback such as; "Power on, "Power off", "Connected", "pairing", "Battery high", "Battery medium" and "Battery low".  With so many devices and gadgets in use these days whoever developed this thing learned a cardinal rule somewhere along the line, the old KISS method, "Keep It Simple Stupid".
title: LG Electronics Tone+ HBS-730 Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: I was a bit weary of these at first to be honest. Verizon reps all seemed to push them and I wasn't quite sure of how big of a fan I would be with the around the neck, detatchable ear bud design.The sound is just ok. Not a lot of bass, not a lot of treble, rather high mids, even with EQ changes in my iPhone music sound settings.However, people never complained about the sound of the calls when using it to talk on the phone.I grew to like them but when I joined the gym recently and tried to use them that is where the trouble began.I do a lot of cardio and run on the treadmill and elliptical a lot. I could NOT take the headset bobbing around on my neck and alot of the time because it seems one side is a bit heavier, the neck portion would rotate around and jerk the one bud out of my ear.Also, don't let the sweatproof/resistant label fool you. I don't sweat bucks like some guys at the gym, but the little I do shorted these out within a month. I moved onto the Moto S11's and havent looked back. Sorry LG.
title: LG Electronics Tone+ HBS-730 Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: These wireless headphones are good; however, if it isn't in direct view of the smartphone, it cuts out.  I had the HBS-700 prior to these and they worked great with the IPhone but when I switched to the HTC One-X I began having probelm with connectivity.  I thought with the purchase of this new model it would not be a factor but it still is.  When it doesn't cut out, the sound is great!  The main reason for getting wireless is so you can walk away with carrying your device, right?  Well, that doesn't happen with these.............................3/18/13I have to reduce my rating for these headphones.  I am totally disappointed in them and am in the process of finding out if I can return them.  Basically,they are not worth the money.  I don't even have to be three feet from my cell phone before it start cutting out.  If I turn my back, it starts cuttin out.  I should have stuck with the HBS-700 because although it cut out from time to time, it didn't cut out as much as this one.  When I'm around someone else who has a cell phone, it's even worse.  It makes listening to music while working out non pleasurable!  I don't often give bad reviews but have no choice on this one.
title: LG Electronics Tone+ HBS-730 Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black

reviewText: I couldn't believe LG would release a faulty product as mentioned in countless reviews. (Bluetooth issues) I had to see for myself... Unfortunately the set I received did indeed suffer from this very issue. I'm sending my set back in exchange for another. Hopefully its just a fluke as I really like the design. (Note: They aren't the best for working out. As you can imagine, situps with these dangling around your neck would not work out very well.) But they are great for using at my desk and walking to and from work.I'll update my review once I receive my replacement set.Update:Received the replacement device within one day. (Amazon's Prime membership & shipping is amazing)Unfortunately the replacement functioned exactly the same as the prior.Constant bluetooth disconnects with the device within 2 feet.Could be an awesome device if LG would resolve the bluetooth range issues. (Still not recommended for workouts however due to the around the neck design)Sending this one back and going to try a Motorola S11-Flex HD headset instead.Update:OMG! Motorola S11-Flex HD headset is amazing!

reviewText: I've had this about a month now, so far I like it better than the HBS-700 (I bought this one anticipating that the earphone wires that I can now see copper on with the 700 are going to fail eventually, haven't yet). This version has what seems to be a louder profile and the battery status indicator and voice prompts are a big improvement. It is a little squirrelly about moving positions sometimes and for some reason, it's fussy about which MP3 files it'll play without problems (for instance, I can play back one file using the HBS-700 no problem, the 730 choked on it, stuttering and skipping etc.). Guessing it has something to do with the encoding of the MP3 (I mostly listen to books). Dunno, just strange, so 4 rather than 5 stars.Updated 1/7/14 - I hate doing this, because as far as I can tell, this is a good product if you want to make calls or just listen to music, but since my main use for this headset is listening to audiobooks, for my personal use, this headset is basically worthless. I have the older HBS 700 version of this headset, and that's still working fine. Whatever LG did to this version, despite all the other improvements, killed it for audiobooks. When the audio book hits a pause between words, which happens all too frequently in books, it delays the resumption of the output until a few words have been spoken. I figure this is some kind of noise reduction internal software fight it's having with the input. I don't know, I just know that if you use it for this like I do, you're going to have a bad time. I've had to switch back to the older model, and I'm just waiting for those earbud wires to break on that. Customer service was basically no help, so I just left them with the recommendation that they fix this going forward for the next iteration of this product.
title: LG Electronics Tone+ HBS-730 Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: I've tried the Bluetooth Motorola's and hated them.  Went back to wired Sennheisers, but couldn't answer or make calls.  Tried these and OMG, what a difference.  They have great sound quality, extremely light, long lasting battery, and people I call say they hear me clear as a bell, they can't even tell I'm riding.  Great for sneaking out work and still answering the phone!  I ride about 14 hours a week and I look forward every day to using this product.  The only problem has been not being able to hear people because of the noise cancellation these have.  I usually ride alone, but when I ride with someone and want to talk, I have to pull one of the earpieces out.  By myself, I really don't care what people might be saying to me.  You can also lower the volume if needed in congested areas to hear the ambient noise.

reviewText: I have had the older model the 700's for a while, never had a problem with them loved everything about them. reviewText: I was annoyed with my wired headphones getting tangled in my pocket, and caught on clothing, or obstacles while wearing, or doing chores around the house.  Purchased this, LG Tone+ HBS-730 Bluetooth Headphone, as a solution, knowing full well that they wouldn't match my wired headphone's audio dynamics.  They don't, but they're definitely good enough, surprisingly good enough!I've had some reception issues while out for my daily walk.  I use them in conjunction with my iPhone5, and on occasion, the sound will cut out, then continue, if I move the iPhone from say, my jacket pocket to my rear, pants pockets, as when I take my jacket off, because I heating up too much.  Other times, the sound has cut out just from moving my head around.  Some days are better than others, no rhyme, or reason.Everyone had different sized ears, and I just couldn't use the ear buds that came with these headphones.  No problem though, I "Amazon'd" these ear bud replacements, 2 Pair, Mens Size - Earphones Plus Brand, Tri-Level, Replacement Ear Cushions, Earbuds for Sound Isolating Earphones, and now everything's good!It's a little strange having these headphones hang around my neck, but I actually forget they are there after a while.  Haven't run into battery limitations as I charge them every morning while reading the paper.  Syncing with my iPhone, iPad, or Macbook Pro is easy.We'll see about longevity.  The earbud wires are pretty thin, and it's not summer yet, so we'll see how well it holds up to sweat and salt from workouts.I would recommend these with no caveats!
title: LG Electronics Tone+ HBS-730 Bluetooth Headset - Retail Packaging - Black
categories: [['Cell Phones & Accessories', 'Accessories', 'Headsets', 'Bluetooth Headsets'], ['Electronics', 'Accessories & Supplies', 'Audio & Video Accessories']]

reviewText: I have bought 5 to 6 Bluetooth headsets over the last 10 years and this one beats them all. From Motorola to Plantronics and not one of them measured up to this one. Let me start with the audio: with my phone 20 feet away in my back bedroom I have no distortion or "skips" in the connection. The built in voice information software will tell you when you have lost connection if you walk outside connection range and will automatically reconnect when back in range (at least on my Samsung S4). Holding the voume button down for 1 second and it will tell you  your current battery level. Secondly, music clarity is as good as my Sony over the ear bluetooth headset. If you have audible notifications for emails and/or text messaging, you will get the notification sound in the headset and music will pick back up where it left off, the same with incoming phone calls. Microphone works great, even if you like driving with your windows down. It has little to no wind noise, according to my family and friends.Only con I have is that the magnetic ear piece has a tendency to fall out when wearing a coat or over garment.
